top_10.name: The Coffee Berry SF
top_10.address: 1410 Lombard St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA
testimonials: I love this spot! It‚Äôs a cozy little space, but perfect for grabbing a coffee and pastry on the go. The folks working here are always so chipper and friendly; the pastry selection is phenomenal. The ube croissant is unique and delicious. Their cappuccinos are always perfectly crafted.

Great coffee and amazing service! The espresso was delicious, and the staff was very friendly and welcoming. I really enjoyed my visit and highly recommend this place. I‚Äôll definitely be back again ‚òïÔ∏è

Cute, clean, and bright coffee shop with owners who really care. I went today and both owners were working. They have a large pastry selection, with traditional ‚Äúfika‚Äù Swedish buns from Thursday to Sundays. They‚Äôre phenomenal, I‚Äôve only tried the cinnamon fika bun but I‚Äôll be trying the others as well. I believe they use Sightglass coffee, both the flat white and dirty chai I got tasted great. The chai wasn‚Äôt too sweet.

This spot is also great because lots of dogs are regulars here! So you always get fluffy friends inside. It also seems like there‚Äôs tons of regulars, as I often hear the owners saying ‚ÄúSo, the usual ___ (insert name of customer)?‚Äù I may become one of those regulars even though I live in Outer Richmond, I like this place so much!

Added bonus: really clean bathrooms, lots of windows for bright environment, kind, prompt service, owners who genuinely care about their establishment. Only con (although not a terrible one) very limited seating! Maybe only for 8-10 people. But they do well considering the size. All in all, 5 stars and possibly my new favorite coffee spot at the moment!

top_10.name: The Coffee Movement
top_10.address: 1737 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA
testimonials: Terrific third wave, stopped here on the way to cheering the SF half marathon. I love that they do the 3 way tasting, with a coffee prepared 3 ways, I had a very floral coffee. Pastries are good too.

Here‚Äôs a polished and natural rewrite of your review:

---

A nice coffee shop in the Richmond District. It‚Äôs usually busy, and the space isn‚Äôt very large, though there is some seating available. What they‚Äôre best known for, as far as I know, is the tasting flight ‚Äî three featured coffees of the day served either as different pours or prepared in different ways. They also offer several types of coffee beans.

There are three workers behind the counter preparing drinks, and they work very efficiently. Orders come out quickly.

We ordered the tasting flight, a cocoa cappuccino, a latte, and some pastries. I really enjoyed the tasting flight ‚Äî it‚Äôs a unique way to sample three different coffees or brewing styles. It was a great experience. We usually stop by whenever we‚Äôre in the area. The prices are reasonable and affordable. I also really like their espresso machine. ‚òï
Parking is on the street and could be challenging near the shop.

The chai latte is well-spiced and creamy‚Äîeasily one of the better ones around. Espresso drinks are good too, made with quality beans, and the espresso tonic is nicely balanced with lime/orange twist. Friendly spot with decent pastries and outdoor seating. Worth checking out. Close to golden gate park and de young museum.

top_10.name: Delah Coffee
top_10.address: 370 4th St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
testimonials:
Delah Coffee is such a gem in San Francisco, tucked away near 4th St and Clara St. I heard this was one of the first coffee shops to come to the SF area, and it definitely feels special the moment you walk in. The interior is absolutely beautiful with really nice furniture and a warm, inviting vibe.
The service was excellent‚Äîsuper friendly and attentive. I ordered the chai along with a borak (cheese pastry), and everything was delicious. The cheese pastry came with honey, which was the perfect touch.
They have a great menu with classics like meat pies, cheesecakes, milk cakes, and a nice variety of refreshers as well. Whether you‚Äôre stopping by for coffee, dessert, or a light bite, this place hits the spot. Definitely worth a visit!

Delay Coffee is such a cozy and refreshing spot! Their pistachio latte is absolutely delicious ‚Äî creamy, perfectly sweet, and full of real pistachio flavor. The tea is smooth and comforting, and they offer an amazing variety of snacks and desserts that taste as good as they look. Everything feels fresh and handmade.

It‚Äôs the perfect place to relax, grab a warm drink, and enjoy some treats. Highly recommended if you want something yummy and comforting!

Wonderful atmosphere, delicious, strong coffee, expertly created, lovely service... The staff is a riot üòÇ they always make me laugh or have something to say.. especially the manager, I dont know her name but she always has such a great attitude and makes me feel better. I come in here all the time to order the Rose Latte, and work on some stuff on my laptop.. great to bring a friend

top_10.name: The Coffee Movement
top_10.address: 1030 Washington St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
testimonials:
Visited The Coffee Movement yesterday. It‚Äôs a very small spot with no indoor seating or restroom‚Äîjust an outdoor standing area and a small bench. I ordered an anericano which is roasted at Sint Frank Coffee as their house blend, and it was incredibly smooth and delicious. They offer oat milk only as non dairy option. The only downside was that I wish the coffee had been a bit hotter. That said, the staff were absolutely wonderful‚Äîso kind and welcoming. If I‚Äôm ever in the area again, I‚Äôd definitely stop by.

CC accepted

The Coffee Movement in San Francisco is such a gem. The coffee is the perfect blend ‚Äî not too sweet, not too bitter, just incredibly smooth. I got the ginger latte and it tasted amazing. They were also able to accommodate dietary restrictions and made mine with almond milk, which I really appreciated.

My partner got a cappuccino with a sprinkle of chocolate on top, and it was really nice as well. Cozy spot, great service, and genuinely delicious drinks. Highly recommend stopping by!also there not a lot of indoor seating spot so if you‚Äôre cold dress warm you seat outside

The Coffee Movement in Chinatown is such a gem. It‚Äôs a tiny spot but the baristas make every drink with so much care, and you can really taste the difference. I tried their latte and it was smooth, rich, and beautifully balanced. The vibe is friendly and relaxed, with outdoor seating that makes it a nice place to hang out for a bit. It feels more like an experience than just grabbing a quick coffee. Definitely one of the best stops in SF for coffee lovers.

top_10.name: Third Wheel Coffee
top_10.address: 535 Scott St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA
testimonials: Wonderful coffee. Hidden but definitely worth the find. Warm and quick service. Coffee was the right temperature, smooth consistency, and beautiful flavor.
New favorite coffee spot! The vanilla pine latte was divine, excited to try more seasonal drinks. Also, the baristas are super kind :-)

For our honeymoon, my wife and I road tripped down to California. On the way, we stopped at many coffee shops, in search of the perfect espresso. And here, at third wheel coffee, we found exactly that. I ordered a flat white, and thoroughly enjoyed it. My wife's vanilla latte was also amazing, and so was the pastry that we had. (We also ordered a matcha for the road which was quite good as well.) The shop is located in a cool urban San Francisco location. The barista was kind and friendly, as well as very knowledgeable. You can tell coffee is his passion! Would definitely recommend going out of your way for if you're in the San Francisco area!

top_10.name: Heyma Yemeni Coffee & Brunch
top_10.address: 248 9th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials: Wonderful wonderful place, from the hot food to the warm service; very hospitable, lovely decor, very clean environment, great music, wifi.. definitely returning.. the brunch is a must try I ordered the foul. Highly recommend

What a delicious and delightful place to eat! Great decor, lovely semi-private alcoves and private back room, AMAZING food, I got the foul, the orange blossom coffee, and the rose milk cake. Great music, kind staff, cannot over-recommend.

I got hooked on Yemeni coffee beans while traveling in Egypt, and HEYMA Coffee absolutely nails that flavor profile. The coffee is rich, deep, and aromatic, clearly treated with care, not rushed or over-roasted.

If you‚Äôre into proper coffee, this will hit. It reminds me of traditional Turkish-style coffee, especially that warm, subtly sweet spice note (cardamom) that adds depth without overpowering the beans.

The rose milk cake has strong dulce de leche energy: soft, milky, lightly floral, finished with pistachios. It‚Äôs indulgent but balanced, and it pairs beautifully with the coffee.

Great atmosphere, thoughtful menu, and it‚Äôs located right by Civic Center BART and well connected to the rest of downtown. Definitely worth checking out.

top_10.name: Four Barrel Coffee
top_10.address: 375 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials: Had some tasty lattes here. They have good seasonal flavors during the fall months. I really enjoyed their coffee cups for dine in drinks.

One of the best third wave coffees in the Bay Area, a consistent excellent medium roast espresso, as well as an interesting selection of pastries. The space is industrial chic, with the roasting machines in the back of the space. Not too busy in the early morning

I went here on a Friday morning. The place was busy and packed. The coffeeshop is spacious. There were ppl talking or people on their laptops.

They only serve coffee, meaning no specialty flavored drinks. My friend ordered our drinks while I saved our seats. The service seems great and the place is pretty big. You can see the staff roasting the beans in the back. My latte was good. I ordered oat milk but it tasted like either 1% milk or non fat milk. Luckily, I wasn‚Äôt allergic to dairy so I didn‚Äôt bother to bring it up to the staff. Also, I normally get flavored drinks but the latte was good. I would go back

top_10.name: The Mill
top_10.address: 736 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA
testimonials: This is a cute coffee shop offering different varieties of toast and pastries. The kouign  amman had richness embedded in every bite. It was  flaky and paired well with their medium roast coffee. The ambiance is cute and it‚Äôs great spot for a date

Tuesday at 10:15am.
The caf√© was quite full of patrons drinking coffee and eating the $14 avocado toast.
I ordered a matcha latte with oat milk to go. ~$8!!!! The taste was mild, not very strong.
This NoPA neighborhood is well suited for well- and highly-paid tech workers. Not reasonably priced beverage or food. The patrons mostly had their laptops open and doing work. They were parked out and taking over space for people who just want to chill with a coffee or tea. This caf√© needs a No laptops policy.

Stopped by The Mill and everything was a hit.

The cortado was perfect ‚Äî smooth, balanced, and just the right size.

Food-wise:
‚Ä¢	The Egg in the Hole was the standout ‚Äî that garlic butter on the country bread is next-level.
‚Ä¢	The smoked trout toast came in a close second, fresh and flavorful.
‚Ä¢	The hummus + cauliflower toast was good, just not as memorable as the others.

Wrapped it all up with a slice of the persimmon cinnamon pistachio crumble cake, which was absolutely outstanding ‚Äî warm, spiced, and perfectly textured.

Great vibe, friendly staff, and beautifully executed menu. Will definitely be back.

top_10.name: Saint Frank Coffee
top_10.address: 2340 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: Came to try their coffee flight as per a friend‚Äôs recommendation and found it a tad underwhelming? Possibly just personal preference as they leaned quite sour/acidic. Overall still a great experience and service was friendly!

I luckily walked in at a time where there was no wait and empty tables, so yay for me. Ordered a pour over and an iced white, and both were lovely. My iced coffee was particularly satisfying, and they made it with non-dairy milk which was a win for me. The almond croissant was great, tasty filling and nice crispy edges. Highly recommend!

Unfortunately, worth the hype. I am sad about the many mornings I will freeze in line to get this...

For the snobs: Yes, you'll find coffee and beans that are comparable in many places in sf (we're privileged like that, aren't we?).

This place is not a coffee shop, though. It's a coffee experience. All credits to the team. You get to know and discuss your coffee with knowledgeable and kind staff.

I will see y'all soon :)

top_10.name: Haraz Coffee House
top_10.address: 1452 Franklin St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials:
I tried the Iced Mufawar and a samosa. I appreciate the unique items on the menu and the variety of pastries. The coffee was definitely stronger than I expected, so I would recommend sweetening it if you get it! The samosa was really good, too.

Plenty of space to work from the cafe or read.

Early January 2025 Authentic Yemeni cafe that serves up a delectable menu of regional Middle Eastern drinks and selective or fusion style pastries üç∞.

For the pastries sweetness levels are well managed while savory items are very limited in choice

Drin options particularly coffee ‚òïÔ∏è are numerous and varied with distinct aroma and taste. Special consideration also given to presentation.

Service is only via counter and self service tabling.

Cafe decor is also contemporary and a hybrid of modern Western styles mixed with slight Middle Eastern touches

The place is commonly frequented by remote workers and seating can get pretty limited

I love this place! Fantastic rich coffees in a swanky modern retail space. What a hidden gem. We ordered a Cortado and a latte. Both perfect with great flavor. And they got the milk just right for both drinks. And the staff are super friendly. I love locally owned and operated businesses. And coffee is my favorite vice!

top_10.name: Pie Punks
top_10.address: 145 2nd St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA
testimonials: This place is fantastic! One of the best deep dishes / Detroit pizza I‚Äôve had. The cheese is so good. The beet salad was good just felt like they were canned beets not fresh.

Highly highly recommend this pizza joint for your next dinner out. We found Pie Punks on google and were drawn to it because of its very good reviews. The decor and ambience of this place is unmatched, it‚Äôs got a great vibe as soon as you walk in. The staff and friendly and they have a great selection of drinks and food. We ordered a Detroit pizza and salad to share, both of which were delicious, fresh and presented well. Service was also very quick. Cannot recommend this restaurant more to someone who wants fast service and tasty food.

Came here with a group of 6 and was seated immediately!

Good:
- Pizza was delicious, I liked the sausage grandma the best
- the pizza tasted healthier than other pizzas I‚Äôve had, not too oily
- Great portion sizes! We had so much pizza leftover and it was good value

Bad:
- The place was a bit dim
- Detroit pizza was smaller for the price

Overall this was so much fun and loved the pizza it was quite tasty

top_10.name: Golden Boy Pizza
top_10.address: 542 Green St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: That long line is so worth it. Reasonably priced. The clam and garlic pizza is incredibly flavourful. A combination I‚Äôve never had before and I‚Äôve been missing out. Hot and fresh. Delicious soft crust. Gooey cheese. Garlicky goodness

The pizza here is amazing. I tried the pepperoni slice and it was genuinely delicious with a very authentic flavor. Even late at night the queue was surprisingly long, which says a lot about how popular the place is.

It‚Äôs just a small takeaway counter, so don‚Äôt expect a premium atmosphere, more of a classic, local vibe. During peak hours you‚Äôll need to wait in line, and once you reach the front you place your order, pay, and give your name. After that there‚Äôs a short wait until they call you, and then you get your pizza.

Overall, great taste and totally worth the wait if you‚Äôre craving a quality slice.

Really good to-go pizza! The flavors are minimalist but nevertheless very-very tasty. My favorites are pepperoni and clam&garlic. Love how fast they work on orders. So even if you get to wait it won‚Äôt be more than 10 minutes. And the second best thing about this one is - you got to enjoy it at the Washington park üíö

top_10.name: Il Casaro Pizzeria
top_10.address: 348 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials:
The food here is so freaking good. We ordered meatballs, burrata, pizza, cannoli, and panna cotta.

Everything was expertly prepared and extraordinary delicious. Our Every dish entered the clean plate club. We are really looking forward to coming back and trying more things from their menu.

The pizza here was good ‚Äî not amazing, but definitely enjoyable. To be fair, I‚Äôm from Berlin where there are a lot of excellent pizza places, so my standards might be a bit high. Compared to what I‚Äôm used to, this wasn‚Äôt better, but it was still a solid choice if you‚Äôre in the area and craving Italian food.

I had the Montepulciano wine, which was very good. I sat outside, and they had heaters, so it was comfortable even in cooler weather. The staff was very friendly as well.

Overall, a solid option for a casual Italian meal.

This is one of my go-to spots in San Francisco. I‚Äôve probably been here 20 times or more. There‚Äôs so much good pizza in North Beach, but this one really feels authentic. I usually get their marinara though their pasta is also excellent. I especially love the pesto pasta. The restaurant has cute outdoor seating, and while they don‚Äôt take reservations, I usually find a spot easily. It‚Äôs perfect for big groups or a romantic date night. For me, this is a reliable, safe bet that‚Äôs always a great experience.

top_10.name: Outta Sight Pizza
top_10.address: 422 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials: Great thin-crust slices and super clean spot. Tried the Ruby and Vinny‚Äôs Special ‚Äî both tasty. The staff is very sweet! A bit pricey at ~$6 a slice, but I‚Äôm also spoiled by old NY $2 slice days üòÖ Worth a visit.

Great pizza! A very solid option in the city for a New York style slice. Very thin crust which is more crackery, which is not my preference, but executed well. Good char on the crust, but a bit too much mozzarella in my opinion. The thicker layer of cheese doesn‚Äôt reheat fully and is slightly chewy. Sauced down mildly. All nitpicks, good slice, 8.7

For a super cheap pizza, this place is pleasantly surprising - they have daily specials and unexpected add ons like anchovies or stracciatella. I tried the ruby (their vodka sauce) and a Vinny's special (onions, chives and creme fraiche). Both were ok in flavor (especially considering the price). I was a little concerned that a dog was allowed to sit at one of the tables, didn't feel very sanitary...

top_10.name: Pizzetta 211
top_10.address: 211 23rd Ave, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA
testimonials: A real blast from the past - used to go here with our small kids in the early 2000s. Still just as cute. Pizzertas are still just as delicious (if not quite as quirky as they used to be - though maybe that is a good thing for the business?). Well worth a visit

Simply delicious and fantastic service with cozy, warm setting.  I was looking for a simple, thin crust neighborhood type place in SF and saw this so giving a try.  It blown my mind with everything from the great chill relax vibe, to great nice and friendly service and the foods are simple but yet elevated to several unexpected levels.  Our server recommended the farm egg pizza and I picked the pepperoni one.  I was skeptical at first of the farm egg but surprisingly I like it more than my pepperoni (still fantastic but damn).  Who knows that eggs pizza was that fantastic and so yum!  The salad is simple but tasty and the dressing was marinated well without seeing it, just tasting.  We finished it all without stopping.  We just ate 4hrs prior so we‚Äôre are still full (just want a good pizza before we flying the next day) but the pizzas and the salad was just somehow disappeared without us knowing that we ate them all. On top of these, we ordered the passion fruit panna cotta and yup, gone just gone within 2mins.  Really want to order more but had to restrain or else we‚Äôre unable to fit into our clothes. Will be on my list to must comeback in SF for sure.  Thank you for the incredible foods and service. Just simply loving it. Oh they have inside but it‚Äôs small and tight with 6-7 table for 2-4 seatings, but they do have outdoor sitting with heat lamps and blankets.  Very romantic and cozy place for sure.

This was a really very good place. The pizzettas were fresh and made with high quality ingredients. We tried the hazelnut pizza and it was very delicious and interesting. They also offer homemade sausages, and the salads were creative and something different. The service was great. The place itself is quite tiny and small, but cozy.

top_10.name: Montesacro SoMa
top_10.address: 510 Stevenson St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials: Delicious pizza with a special recipe dough.  It's just a little bit different, but not blatantly obviously so.  Regardless it's delicious!  Great friendly knowledgeable service.  Wildly interesting eclectic decor, especially the washroom.  The neighbourhood is a little more gritty but not dangerous by my accounts, and there are neighbourhood ambassadors around as well.

We absolutely loved dining here! The pesto and the eggplant with red pepper pinsas were outstanding, and the cauliflower salad appetizer was bursting with flavor. The atmosphere has a charming vintage feel that makes the place so inviting, and the staff‚Äôs kindness made the experience even better. Can‚Äôt wait to visit again!

Super tasty Roman-style pizza (with a great selection of antipasti too) served in a cozy, gorgeous space. I stopped by Montesacro SoMa with a friend for a weekend dinner after receiving multiple recommendations for this spot from several coworkers / friends. I got there a few minutes early, so I was immediately struck by how cozy and intimate the store felt; the staff seemed relaxed but on top of their game, and I loved that you could somewhat (but not quite...to preserve the mystery of it all) see the kitchen work their magic with a partially visible container of prepared dough, slightly exposed assembly counter. I love the walls of wine bottles, random chandeliers, and deli counter -- it genuinely felt like I was back in Rome.

For food, we started with the Sottoli, a plate of beautifully EVOO-marinated vegetables (red bell peppers, sun-dried tomatoes, and eggplant), topped with a bit of chili and parsley. I loved the simplicity of this antipasti; the veggies were super flavorful and delicious. It's a great vegetarian or gluten-free choice, but you can also get an order of their bread if you'd like to bulk up this appetizer. The veggies were delicious on their own, but also went wonderfully with the main star of the show, the pizza. We got their margherita just so we could compare this classic vs. other pizza joints, and they certainly did not disappoint. The tomato sauce was flavorful, with just the right mix of herbaceous, savory, acidic, and sweet, and the pizza was topped with a generous portion of melty mozzarella and basil. I love that they fully lean into the Roman-ness of their restaurant by serving the more ovular pinsa, with a slightly thicker, chewier crust and highlighting local Roman ingredients. Now that I've confirmed their margherita pizza (or, rather, pinsa) is 10/10, I can't wait to go back and try their other options!

top_10.name: Pronto Pizzeria
top_10.address: 798 Eddy St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: The Best of the best pizza in SF!!!!! The pizza and wings are to die for! 10/10 hands down! The atmosphere is great, the staff is very nice and down to earth. Definitely recommend PRONTO PIZZA. Can be busy at times but it so worth the wait!
THE BEST PIZZA! Hot honey burrata was fantastic. Each ingredient is very carefully chosen for its quality and is organic and you can feel the difference. Very welcoming staff.

Excellent food and outstanding service‚Äîdefinitely a must-try for halal authentic Italian flavors. We ordered the Philly steak, Fettuccine Alfredo, and a half-and-half pizza (buffalo chicken and burrata), and every dish was fresh, flavorful, and perfectly prepared.
Houari was incredibly polite and a wonderful host, which made the experience even better. The place itself is modest with limited seating, but it more than earns five stars for its food, service, and overall quality. Best of all, everything is halal!

top_10.name: Tony's Pizza Napoletana
top_10.address: 1570 Stockton St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: Tony‚Äôs Pizza Napoletana in San Francisco is a must-stop for any pizza lover. The menu has tons of styles to choose from, and every slice tastes fresh, authentic, and made with real care. The crust is perfectly cooked ‚Äî crispy on the outside and soft inside ‚Äî and the ingredients are high quality and flavorful. The atmosphere feels lively but still comfortable, and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable when helping you pick a pizza. Whether you‚Äôre a classic margherita fan or want to try something unique, Tony‚Äôs always delivers an amazing pizza experience. üçï

When I say this was the best Margherita ive ever had. I'm not even exaggerating.  The sauce was so delicious.  We had to try the royal Margherita as well. It came with a fresh basil plant and oil to put on. It's not as big as the Margherita but packs a punch. We can't wait to come back to the bay and eat here again. I highly recommend this place. Service was good even though busy. Prices were reasonable as well. Especially when its so delicious.  Thank you for such a great meal.

Man, I miss SF. The best city in the world. Walking through North Beach brought back so many memories and is even more magical that what I remember. A lot of San Francisco's charm is the array of restaurants and the neighborhoods they are in.

Just look at the picture...

Tony's pizza does not need my review, obviously. They have a firmly planted existence here and they are wholeheartedly deserving of all the praise and stellar reviews on their legendary pizza.

My review is for all the professional servers. They were very attentive and efficient. Casual observation showed they all worked together seamlessly and enmeshed into the vibe of this buzzing room belonging to the most pleasing pizza.

Much props to the Tony's team for an excellent experience!

top_10.name: 'Napizza
top_10.address: 3258 Scott St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA
testimonials: Best napolitan style pizza in the entire city! We had a phenomenal experience overall, and really felt like in Italy. We ordered a bufalina and a salsiccia: the dough was just very soft, flavorful and slightly crounchy, the toppings were very authentic, and the olive oil was great. They also served us an outstanding tiramis√π - the best tiramis√π we had in the city. The waiter was also very nice, and the place is very quiet. Couldn't recommend it enough!!

Really good oven roasted pizza, the chef even threw in some veggies we asked for in our chicken pizza. The pesto gnocchi was a little hard for my taste. A very cute restaurant with cute lighting and decor.

My absolute favorite pizza spot in SF. We come here atleast once a weeküòÇüòÇ. The pizza is really the best, authentic Italian dough and recipe. We usually have the Calzone, but open. We also love the salted caramel ice cream. The service is also always very fast. The pasta is also great and all the meals we had here were amazing. Highly recommended.

top_10.name: Piccolo Italia
top_10.address: 799 O'Farrell St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: We really loved this pizza place because the pizza was delicious and so was the dough. It was hot and very fresh and you could tell that it was homemade. I highly recommend this amazing pizza.

HALAL rest

The pizza at this location is, frankly, underwhelming, especially if you‚Äôve experienced higher-quality pizza elsewhere. A single slice ranges around $6.40, depending on the variety, but the quality doesn‚Äôt justify the price. This is the type of pizza one might reach for late at night, perhaps after a night out, when taste isn‚Äôt a primary concern.

When fully sober, the pizza‚Äôs flavor reveals an unpleasant chemical undertone that‚Äôs difficult to overlook. It‚Äôs simply not enjoyable for those seeking a satisfying, well-crafted slice.

For a genuinely better experience, I recommend Out of Sight Pizza, just a block or two away. Their pizza is more affordable, higher quality, served with excellent customer service, and enjoyed in a clean, welcoming atmosphere. That said, this location serves as a convenient option for late-night cravings when other choices are limited.

top_10.name: Mo's Grill
top_10.address: 1322 Grant Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: Amazing food. Great service. Big portions. This is a 1/4 of the meal I shared with the hubby. The pancake was delish‚Ä¶crispy edges, soft and fluffy a dream come true.

OK. Maybe my expectations were too high after reading all the amazing reviews. My palette was set for the best burger in the world!

My burger was good‚Ä¶ but not the best ever. (A little dry, actually.)

That said, the clam chowder was excellent, and the milk shake was amazing!! Can‚Äôt remember the last time I I was served a shake with the tin canister. I‚Äôd go back just for that!

In fact, the I‚Äôd go back anyway. Just maybe just not looking for the burger apocalypse!

Had to wait a bit to get seated but it was worth it. Lucky enough to sit at the small counter instead of a table which gave us a great view of the kitchen activity. Burgers were delicious. We had the Aussie burger and the cheeseburger. Come with an appetite as the burgers are big and the fries are great.

top_10.name: Pearl's Deluxe Burgers
top_10.address: 708 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: Great burgers, nice little place.  Walk if you can, parking is hard to find.

Was very hungry after a +50k steps day around SF and craving for a proper large burger not too far from my hotel.
Lucky me, Pearl‚Äôs was just around the corner and following some online reviews I went for the Deluxe Bula Burger with extra mushroom and Kobe meat as replacement (buffalo not being available unfortunately) with a side of a mix French fries and onion rings.
Said sides were absolutely perfect, best French fries I had for quite a moment and onion rings crispy without being too dry.
Burger was massive and really comforting. Not the the absolute best I have ever had but very decent with a meat cooked to my desire (real ‚Äúrare‚Äù).
Atmosphere was low key and very quiet, with fellow European travelers from Italy and France dining there too.
All in all a great no-frills comforting experience after a long and busy day with the best possible food to indulge in.

We went late (10 pm on a Friday). The burgers were fresh and fast.  They were juicy and incredible.  I had the Phat bob, she had the mushroom.  They were amazing.  The garlic fries are also great, made with fresh garlic.  The onion rings were ok but def go for the fries instead.  Service was fast, helpful, and friendly.  A great experience.

top_10.name: Beep's Burgers
top_10.address: 1051 Ocean Ave, San Francisco, CA 94112, USA
testimonials: First time to be in the area so we had to try the famous beeps burgers. Super delicious! Burgers were made fresh and even just by looking at it you know that you and your burger will have a good time. Definitely worth the detour. Nothing negative. Just expect its a take out diner.

I mean issa vibe man. Highly recommend. Great local SF spot that's been around for a minute. Line might be long but orders come out decently fast except when someone in front of you is ordering for their whole friend group... Some outdoor seating but that's it so I recommend coming with a car to eat in or a warm jacket. The parking lot is small and usually pretty crowded and street parking nearby might not be the easiest for non locals.

Fries are great. Burgers are great too. All Made with peanut oil apparently though :(

This place is good,  but the quality can change any given day.  I swear I have never had the same burger twice.  This last one being the worst.  Still try it out,  but if you prefer another place.... maybe go there.  Burger wasn't as juicy as the past.  Fries were fine,  shake was good

top_10.name: Super Duper Burgers
top_10.address: 783 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials: This was a really great burger! To be honest the bun was a tad dry, but the flavor of the ingredients was awesome! It‚Äôs great that they have free homemade pickles!

Gluten free pasta straws?  What a great idea!  These are 100% better than paper straws especially for things like my strawberry shake. Got a shake, garlic fries, and a super duper cheese burger. All excellent. Thank you.

It‚Äôs your standard Super Duper Burgers. If you‚Äôre unfamiliar with the experience, but love burgers this place is a hit. Never skip the pickles. Personally, I‚Äôm a big fan of their pints. Love a good draft beer with lunch. Affordable. This is my go to spot for a place to sit and have a break from the bustling city life.

top_10.name: Super Duper Burgers
top_10.address: 2201 Chestnut St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA
testimonials: The best burger I‚Äôve EVER had. (Much better than in/out to settle the SF argument). The only thing that could make these burgers better is brioche buns. Fries are amazing here.

First time here, but I could smell the burgers from across the street. My husband and I both got the Super Burger! It was üî•hott, fresh, well-seasoned which we really appreciate. You could order at the counter or on the kiosk. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They provide extra Condiments like mustard, ketchup and pickles on its own side station. There is seating inside and a patio outside. Best thing to do is to sit in the window and people watch. Excellent spot, really good vibes! A MUST TRY

Super Duper Burgers delivers a well-executed fast-casual dining experience rooted in simplicity, transparency, and consistency. The open kitchen concept builds trust and adds an engaging element to the visit. Interior design is clean and functional, with warm materials that prevent the space from feeling sterile. While seating is compact, it‚Äôs thoughtfully arranged to maximize comfort and flow. The branding is clear and cohesive without feeling forced or overdone. The restaurant prioritizes efficiency while maintaining a welcoming atmosphere. Overall, this location succeeds as a reliable, well-designed spot for quality burgers in San Francisco.

top_10.name: Slider Buns | Burgers, Hotdogs, Philly Cheesesteak
top_10.address: 1202 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: Delicious hamburgers, fries, shakes. The philly cheesestake needed more onions and peppers. Family fries was a whole plate of fries. House dressing is thousand island dressing. Highly recommend!

My name is Omar and I‚Äôm a Uber driver. I go everywhere to try the different food so far this nice clean fantastic food restaurant the best taste so far. I thank them for keeping the restaurant clean good service and nice people. I will always come back here.

In all honesty, I was staying in a hotel nearby to this place and I just really wanted a hot dog.

This place actually hit the spot on that. I'm used to a lot of these types of places grilling hot dogs and burning them, but Slider Buns made my hot dog perfectly!

It was really cool that they added a bit of dicing into the hot dog itself to make it easier to eat too, never seen anyone do with with a hot dog before but I thought it was a nice touch to mention.

Would definitely eat here again when I'm in town. Only really dropped it down a star because service is middling and it took a fair bit of time to get my food.

top_10.name: Super Duper Burgers
top_10.address: 2304 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA
testimonials: Good quality burgers with reasonable wait times. Milk shakes were ok. Our garlic fries were an oily soggy mess. No table service, self-service sodas and free pickles. Seating is ok but not very comfortable, also the music is loud inside making it hard to have a conversation .

The best Super Duper location for burgers. The burgers are consistently juicier here. They actually will cook your burger to medium-rare when requested. Other locations seem to think medium is medium-rare. Nope. I've probably eaten at Super Duper at least 50 times, and the Castro location 30 times.

Plus the people watching of the sidewalk and intersection from the south facing counter stools is outstanding!

I been here during late night when I was craving for a burger while I was very hungry. Upon arrival, there was a bit of a line, but I did not mind it since I needed some time to decide what to get since it was my first time here in general. Finally it was my turn to order and I was met with one of their welcoming, well trained and understanding staffs that made the process a quick and easy one. I decided to order to go since my friend was waiting in the car where parking was not the best option in the area due to the overall safety. Everything was made to order which is the way I like it and I never mind the wait since I am a very patient person. Luckily I still captured a photo of my order even though I conquered my burger in a minute or two due to hunger. I highly recommend this place to all burger enthusiasts, if you are looking to try something new or in need of a quick bite just like me. I definitely will be back to tryout the other delicious options they have to offer.

top_10.name: Native Burger
top_10.address: 3420 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
testimonials: This place was delicious! Southwestern and the northern with garlic fries??? DELISSHHH! Juicy burger and great portions, loved the toppings. This place is super tasty!

Your classic diner burger.Juicy and flavorful. Perfectly cooked.

Double-fried fries were crunchy and fluffy, onion rings were good, and jalapeno poppers were poppin'.

Native is awesome! Salads, sausages, burgers, and sides! Awesome story about keeping this spot in the neighborhood. Burgers are great and bigger and better than before. The owners are creative and exploring new menu options and ways to improve all the time. Native Burger is great!

top_10.name: The Melt
top_10.address: 455 Market St at First, Suite #140, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA
testimonials: It was my first time trying their double meltburger, and it was really delicious! The beef patties were juicy and huge, I couldn't even finish them in one sitting, and ended up splitting them into three meals lol. Highly recommended!

After a lackluster meal at Mel's the night before, I decided to search for a top rated location this time. I came across The Melt which was heavily favored and rightfully so.

Although the location was busy, I was able to walk right up and use one of the self service kiosks to place my order. The interface was easy and helpful. I ordered a double BBQ Bacon Meltburger and a Cookies and Cream shake. Within a few minutes my order was ready and it looked great. This burger was huge, and since it cost 18 bucks, it better be! I could barely bite into this burger it was so massive. It was fantastic, so much flavor and quality meat. The shake was equally as great and helped wash down this tasty burger. The food was a little pricey, but you definitely get your money's worth. This is the perfect spot for a lunch or late night grub. Would definitely revisit if I had the chance because some of the other meals look just as good.

Stopped in for a quick lunch bite to go. This is a casual sandwich shop. Very minimal decor. White walls, concrete floor and a few tables and chairs. You could enter your order at the kiosk or directly with the cashier. I Ordered a tomato soup which was smooth and creamy and tasty. I also ordered the Italian Job which is a mushroom and cheese sandwich on a spicy garlic bread. Unfortunately the bread wasn't spicy nor garlic. I'd stop by again for the soup alone.

top_10.name: Super Duper Burgers
top_10.address: 721 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials:
recently visited Super Duper Burgers and overall had a good experience. The burgers are fresh, well-prepared, and you can really taste the quality of the ingredients, especially the beef and buns. I liked that the menu is simple and focused, which makes it easy to choose without feeling overwhelmed. The fries were crispy and paired well with the burger, and the sauces added great flavor.

That said, the experience wasn‚Äôt perfect. During busy hours, the waiting time can be a bit long, and seating may feel crowded. Prices are slightly on the higher side compared to regular burger places, so it feels more like an occasional treat than an everyday stop. Staff were generally friendly, though service speed could improve during peak times.

Overall, Super Duper Burgers offers tasty, high-quality burgers with room for improvement in service efficiency. I‚Äôd recommend it if you enjoy fresh burgers and don‚Äôt mind waiting a little.

It was ok.
I had booked marked this place because they have veggie burgers, I was hoping black bean burgers type of veggie.
They only had 1 type of chicken burger.  Overall this place was not what I was expecting or my cup of tea. As a ranch conuseur the ranch in this place was the only good thing.

I ordered the super burger with sharp cheddar. The flavor was really nice. The meat has a nice crisp crust and was super juicy.
Everything was nicely balanced.
In the future I'll do the mini because the super had so much meat.

The garlic fries had a really nice flavor as well.

We ended with a soft serve cone we shared with our son. It was a nice surprise.

Service was good and the staff were friendly.

top_10.name: Boochmania
top_10.address: 685 Harrison St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
testimonials: The cutest vibe and most delicious food! ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS and would come back. Love the vegan options and how flavorful and healthy the food taste. So rare to find such delicious vegan options! YUM!

Some of the best food I‚Äôve had. Everything was freshly made and you can tell they care for what they do. It was delicious.

They are super nice as well. I liked it so much I even ordered some to go. This will be my go-to place from now on whenever I‚Äôm in the area.

Such a great experience. Our host was incredibly warm. The food was above par (had the pulled lamb on a burger and the home fries). And delightful Turkish coffee served at the end (complimentary). The currant w clove kombucha was very yummy too‚Ä¶ even though it‚Äôs not usually my thing.

top_10.name: Shizen
top_10.address: 370 14th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials:
Reservation required!

One of the best gems in the city for vegan sushi. Amazing ambiance, service, and decor.

Lot of great options - highly recommend the Boddy & Souli, and Candlestick sushi.

Don't skip their dessert of the day!

All vegan Japanese restaurant that has celiac-safe GF options - wow! Super excited to try this place so when I was in the area at 4:15 last Sunday, having missed lunch, thought I‚Äôd stop by. Was surprised to see there were already people waiting for it to open and the line was quite long when it opened at 4:30. Reservations are recommended but we were lucky enough to be accommodated. A charming dining area, albeit not a ton of elbow room. Seating options include tables up to four, up to two, and a small sushi bar.

The waitstaff were very friendly and responsive and helpful with recommendations.

Food wise, everything was good, including the miso soup and yuba salad, but the rolls are where the magic is. They‚Äôre all beautifully crafted and presented. We tried the California roll (great!), sweet tofu nigiri, Missing piece (made GF), and Boddy and Soul (recommended, and a winner by my dining partner, but not GF).

It was a real delight to enjoy such delicious food, carefully created, crafted, and presented, making it a multi sensory treat.

Wish there was a GF tempura option to make more of the rolls available to celiacs, but I loved what I had. Definitely recommend the fun, relaxed, down to earth atmosphere and uniquely Japanese vibe. Think stylish onsen, an indulgence where you leave feeling fulfilled, healthy, and happy!

Delicious vegan sushi that actually delivers on flavor! The Dynamite Roll (10/10) was the highlight, followed closely by the Roasted Bell Pepper Nigiri (9/10). The Shishito Peppers and Candlestick roll were also solid (8/10).

The price point feels high given the portion sizes, but the technique is impressive and it gives vegans a genuine sushi experience. Highly recommended for the execution, especially if you don't eat fish.

top_10.name: The Bite
top_10.address: 996 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials: Absolutely fantastic restaurant with great service and fantastic food. If you are looking for fantastic Turkish | Mediterranean food, this should be your first choice. We will definitely be back soon and every time in San Francisco!
Delicious vegan options (clearly indicated) and friendly service. I ate this gyro so quickly bc of how good it was (see second pic)I‚Äôm definitely returning for moreüòå

Been a rough week and The Bite made sure I end it on a high note. I just ordered late night delivery for tonight's dinner, and next two days of meals. Entr√©es are high quality ingredients. Made fresh to order. Meat was not dried out. Lightly seasoned to enjoy the fresh natural flavor of the foods.

Bonus points for the careful packaging of my delivery order, especially the protective wrapping for the soups.

Highly recommend!!!

top_10.name: Wildseed
top_10.address: 2000 Union St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA
testimonials: I ordered the mushroom pizza and let me tell you it was soooooo delicious. Just a side note I would advise adding on a sauce and warming up your slices if you get it delivered because it soooo yummy. This ended up being 2 meals for me as it was quite filling (but in a good way)
The brunch dishes are delicious with lots of good drink options both alcoholic and non alcoholic. I would love even more brunch options! Dinner options are ok.

I love this restaurant! My friends treated me there for nice dinner after their engagement photoshoot. I‚Äôm not a vegan person but I must say, I‚Äôm super impressed.
We ordered the Italian sausage pizza because I was curious to know how close a plant based sausage could be to the real thing. Surprisingly, it was very close and delicious, but definitely didn‚Äôt taste artificial or processed! The pizza crust was crunchy, moderate thin (and with good texture) and doughy, and I love it. I they did a great job to let the customers know what ingredients were used (both through the menu and verbal), the service was excellent and the staff cared deeply if the customer had any food allergies.
What truly impressed me was my main course, the Thai curry. It is the most flavourful Thai curry I have ever had these days, and it was served black rice. I love how healthy it is and yet it is even better than meat-flavored curry.
Will definitely come back again to try more vegan food there.

top_10.name: Golden Era
top_10.address: 395 Golden Gate Ave, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials: Service was friendly and helpful. The inside is clean, spacious, and well decorated. Menu is entirely vegan. Food is amazing and the cost is phenomenal. Portions sizes are good. I ordered more than I normally would, but I spent several hours walking around San Francisco and was pretty hungry.

Golden Era is a rare find in the plant-based dining scene. While too many vegan establishments focus on ethical and environmental benefits but serve what is essentially non-meat junk food, this restaurant takes a different approach. The food here is not only good for the planet and the animals but is also good for your health.

The extensive menu encompasses Vietnamese and Chinese specialties that can be customized to meet specific dietary needs. The service was caring and family-like, filled with helpful advice. When we requested adjustments to our dishes, they were executed perfectly. Furthermore, when we mentioned that one of our party is a fan of spicy food, the staff responded not with a single option, but with three different sources of heat‚Äîa gesture that was highly appreciated and added significant enjoyment to the meal.

The cuisine is excellent and the service is commendable, but we must point out one significant weakness: the restroom. Unfortunately, we found the entire mirror covered with rude inscriptions. For a family-friendly establishment, this is out of place, and the management would do well to clean it up promptly.

As ordinary consumers, we are not paid or compensated in any way for this review. We appreciate the healthy, high-quality food and hope the facility maintenance matches the kitchen's standards in the future.

Oh my! My favorite spot when I'm in SF. The best Asian Fusion Restaurant I've had. The Spicy Sweet Potato Curry and Quinoa Salad dishes were mouth watering. Great spices on the curry dish. The salad is out of this world.

For dessert, I had the Mango sticky rice. I was hooked. I wanted seconds.

I can't wait to come back and try everything on the menu. Reasonable prices. Great service. A few blocks away from City Hall. Parking is sometimes hard to find.

top_10.name: Firefly Restaurant
top_10.address: 4288 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA
testimonials: Absolutely delicious. Mostly gluten free menu and very accommodating for dairy free needs as well. Our waitress was so wonderful, too. A little chilly in the parklet but they had blankets for us. 10/10.

such a cute place wit a good amount of vegan options! started off with the garlic butter parm brussel sprouts and the sweet potato! both were sooo yum (even better when combined lol). for the mains, I got the eggplant thing which was ‚Ä¶ interesting. the eggplant itself was crispy and crunchy but the soup/wtew it was on was ‚Ä¶ not my fav lol. interesting flavors kinda reminded me of goulash! wish it was a little more seasoned and hot, but overall pretty good experience and i would go again! also the sweetest and friendliest server helped us and 10/10 for service and ambiance!

Goddamn this place is a gem. If you‚Äôre gluten-free, Firefly will become your favourite restaurant in the city. If you‚Äôre gluten-full, I reckon it still will too :)

For starters, the atmosphere here is very warm and cozy. Perfect for a fall evening. The art and eccentric ornaments/details don‚Äôt go unnoticed. I really appreciate how this doesn‚Äôt just feel like a restaurant ‚Äî it‚Äôs almost like an extension of your own home (just with awe-striking gluten-free food.)

Which brings me to‚Ä¶ the gluten-free food.

Fried chicken?! I mean‚Ä¶ how?! This was my first fried chicken ever, and it did not disappoint. It also exceeded my boyfriend‚Äôs expectations (who loves the gluten) ‚Äî so you know it‚Äôs good.

The squash dish was exceptional ‚Äî so too were the sweet potatoes.

But the cherry on top of it all was the brownie with cornflakes and vanilla ice custard‚Ä¶ I haven‚Äôt stopped thinking about it ever since.

It‚Äôs a 99.9% gluten free menu, asides from 1 side of bread which can be swapped for cornbread (if I‚Äôm recalling correctly) so BASICALLY it‚Äôs HEAVEN ON EARTH

top_10.name: Casita Vegana SF
top_10.address: Pier 27, The Embarcadero, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA
testimonials: By chance I found this foodtruck and we ate with my whole family. We took Burger, tacos and hot dog and it was delicious. I would love to come back again. The service was very friendly and the perfect.

If you are looking for homemade, tasty and affordable vegan food around the wharf area, I do recommend this place! We took the two different plates options and we loved it! So happy to support small independent vegan businesses when travelling. Worth it!

I got the taco plate and the food was so flavorful and delicious.  Highly recommend.  I did have a lil trouble finding it, if you use google maps, it shows it is in the middle of pier 7 when in fact it is on the street by Pier 7.  Will definitely be back, whenever I'm in San Fran.  Thanks so much!

top_10.name: Rad Radish
top_10.address: 301 Hayes St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials: Rad Radish takes fast casual dining up a notch. Absolutely delicious, all-vegan menu. My husband and I went there twice on our most recent visit to the city. The chilaquiles and burgers were great.

Spicy chickn sandwich is actually spicy. I always want to try other things but the sandwich is so good I have to have it. Even the ketchup is ridiculously good.

When I first started coming here they were never too packed inside. Now if I come 11am or a little after lunch almost every table is full. Wish they had more locations.

I had dinner at Rad Radish yesterday and was thoroughly impressed by this 100% plant-based gem in Hayes Valley. The restaurant immediately catches your eye with its vibrant, colorful signage and welcoming storefront that perfectly captures the energy of the neighborhood. I ordered the Impossible Burger with avocado and fries, and it absolutely delivered. The burger was expertly prepared with a great balance of flavors and textures - the Impossible patty was juicy and satisfying, complemented perfectly by fresh avocado and crisp lettuce on a sesame seed bun. The fries were golden and crispy, served alongside a delicious ketchup that tied the meal together beautifully. What really sets Rad Radish apart is the atmosphere. The space is stunning with its modern industrial design, featuring exposed ceilings, warm wood floors, and an abundance of lush greenery throughout. The hanging plants and natural elements create such a fresh, inviting environment that makes you want to linger. The lighting is perfect for both casual dining and catching up with friends.
The restaurant strikes that perfect balance of being trendy yet comfortable, with a layout that feels both spacious and intimate. It‚Äôs clear they‚Äôve put thought into creating a space that‚Äôs as beautiful as their food is delicious. Rad Radish proves that plant-based dining can be both satisfying and stylish. I‚Äôll definitely be back to explore more of their menu - this place is a real winner in the Hayes Valley dining scene!‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã

top_10.name: Judahlicious
top_10.address: 3906 Judah St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA
testimonials: Walked in and was mesmerized by the aroma of fresh vegetables and fruit‚Äîkind and knowledgeable staff. The Nekked burrito and salad complemented each other. Wheatgrass is fresh. Coffee is good.

We love Judahlicious! I am not a huge raw food fan, but my son adores their acai bowls and we have frequented the spot afterschool with friends 1-2x/week for months. The staff is always welcoming of our wild kiddos, the service is fast and the quality is great. Highly recommend!
Had the Exodus bowl. Very flavorful and the veggies were cooked perfectly. Cute vibe with interesting wood work, books and plants. Friendly staff. Can't wait to try a smoothie next time!

top_10.name: a√≠so
top_10.address: 4068 18th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA
testimonials: amazing experience, love that it‚Äôs 100% plant based and cruelty free! great vibes and service. amazing mushroom skewers tasted like the grill and looked like chicken. Would def come back. strong drinks!!!

Delicious vegan food! Some were a little too sweet, too burned, but otherwise, it was such a hearty meal. Staff are friendly. Walk-in is fine for lunch. A reservation is recommended for dinner. It‚Äôs challenging to find street parking.

Where to start with the experience at aiso... Well easy meso happy I gave this place a try.  With no expectations and in company of good friends I was just happy to try a new place and hopefully one that could lift the average food experience in the Castro.
Well they didn't disappoint, pretty much every dish but one is a thumbs up.
Loved the beet tartare, the sliders, the yucca and the udon. Not so much the pesto rigatoni.  The rigatoni felt a bit on the dry side and the pesto overpowering.
The sliders were super balanced in texture and flavor and the beet salad was a pure joy , the cucumber just the right crunch and the beet adding that slight sweet and citrus flavor, beautiful.
The service was lovely and attentive.  I wish the restaurant owner would invest into a new door closer, the current one stops short and leaves the door open and the front of the restaurant a bit in the cold side.  Luckily our waiter added the frequent closing of the door to her duties .
Great experience, doesn't matter if your vegan vegetarian or love your meat, the dishes will appeal to your taste buds.

top_10.name: Arsicault Bakery
top_10.address: 397 Arguello Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
testimonials: There is definitely a wait but the pastries are worth it. The chocolate almond croissant was stuffed and the chocolate chip cookie was amazing! The kougin amann was flaky and not too sweet! So good! Highly recommend!

Amazing almond croissant ‚Äî super buttery, flaky, and totally worth it. Go early to get the fresh batch; we waited about 15‚Äì20 minutes in line, but it moved fast. Definitely one of the best almond croissants I‚Äôve had!

Of course the croissants are absolutely mind-blowing, but can we talk about the CCC? This has been elevated to my favorite chocolate chip cookie in SF (my previous #1 was Batter). The outer edges are ultra chewy and caramelized, while the inside is chewy, and there is a layer of bittersweet chocolate of the highest quality through the center. Truly perfection.

I tried the chocolate croissant and it‚Äôs an absolutely massive pillowy layered and buttery dream. The bittersweet chocolate inside was still a bit melted. I would share it unless you‚Äôre very hungry‚Äîit‚Äôs super large!

I went on a Wednesday morning around 9 AM and the line was about 6 deep but moved very quickly. I would happily wait longer and it would still be worth it!

top_10.name: Neighbor Bakehouse
top_10.address: 2343 3rd St UNIT 100, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
testimonials: Huge pastries at incredible prices!!! Got the chocolate twice baked croissant, top 3 bakery in the city for sure.

Hard to find parking but the pastries are incredible!!! Big fan of the spicy potato burek, pistachio blackberry croissant (a bit sweet but still amazing), and their pull apart savoury bread. Service is always pretty quick considering there‚Äôs a line every time I‚Äôve been.

Bring on the seeds!!! The pumpkin seeds pop on this  delicious bread. Why no pictures of the country bread, it was eaten too quickly!!! Right??? This is the perfect neighborhood Bakehouse and if you are at UCSF Mission Bay for a procedure or the children‚Äôs hospital, this is a 6 minute walk and well worth the effort. Theo shared a morning bun with the family who enjoyed it. The coffee was equally hitting!

top_10.name: b. patisserie
top_10.address: 2821 California St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
testimonials:
Came here for the review and it was indeed a decent bakery, but perhaps not quite what it‚Äôs hyped up to be.

We got a chocolate croissant, a regular butter croissant, a chocolate kouign amann, and a lemon tart. The croissants are pretty standard ‚Äî a bit dry, not too buttery (compared to other splendid bakeries in SF like Arsicault). The chocolate croissant doesn‚Äôt have a whole lot of chocolate in it. The kouign amann, on the other hand, was really good. It‚Äôs flaky and the chocolate is rich. The lemon tart was pretty nice too, but it‚Äôs about $8, which I don‚Äôt think is worth the price, either.

Overall, it was a nice experience. The staff were nice and helpful, the toilet was clean, and it wasn‚Äôt too crowded by the time we got there (around 11:00, no lines at all). But personally, I don‚Äôt think the pastry is what it‚Äôs cracked up to be.

Cute patisserie, the coffe is good the pastries wonderful. Rich flavors. Seating is tight. There was a lin to get in. The parking is difficult in the area but that the norm. Service was great and helpful. We would go back when we in town. The sign out front was a little hard to see to find the store. Cute place

Some of the best pastries I‚Äôve had.

Impossible to pick a favorite and wish I was able to try more. I had the Koign aman, a chocolate pastry, and a chocolate banana croissant. The croissant was one of the best I‚Äôve ever had with the inside a warm gooey chocolate chip banana bread and the outside still crispy and buttery.

The koign amans (probably misspelled) were amazing too, I was able to try the classic as well as the seasonal apple pear and those felt like a huge upgrade to a regular croissant for me.

The chocolate one I had was more dessert than breakfast but I‚Äôll remember that one for certain as it was fantastic.

top_10.name: Arizmendi Bakery
top_10.address: 1331 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA
testimonials: Line out the door, very busy, and for a good reason! Absolutely delicious everything! Fresh out of the oven,  and selling like the hot commodities they literally were. 10/10 would go again and every day if I lived close enough!

An absolute must-stop if you‚Äôre anywhere near Inner Sunset. Also totally worth it if you have go an hour out of your way.
Sourdough croissants! Brilliant. Flawless scones that are delightful crunchy and melt-away all at once. Memorable savory breadsticks and focaccia, perfect coffee-cake, cookies and exceptional bread loaves with daily changing variations that are, literally, all listed on a monthly calendar on the website.
Enjoy.

We love our local Inner Sunset Arizmendi Bakery...not just because it is worker owned, but also for the delicious baked goods and warm friendly atmosphere.

Howard and the rest of the baker/owners are super kind and are baking up some incredible daily and holiday treats! Try the ridiculous pear + cherry seasonal scone of the day or the Triple Mushroom Sour Dough Pizza with sesame, ginger garlic vinaigrette.
They serve TWO King Cakes for the Epiphany.
Galette des Rois, a puff pastry filled with a rich almond filling AND Rosca de Reyes, a brioche dough with a hint of orange filled with a sweet molasses and pecan filling, decorated cream cheese topping and dried fruit......5 Stars is truly not enough -JD

top_10.name: Schubert's Bakery
top_10.address: 521 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
testimonials: I‚Äôve been eyeing Schubert‚Äôs for a couple years now, so I probably had my expectations a little too high. Everything was good, fresh, tasty. Everything is beautifully prepared and packaged. I just wasn‚Äôt wowed, and I‚Äôm bakery spoiled. But the staff is helpful and they have an amazing selection! It really is a SF gem.

Nice little bakery. They do run out of the smaller cakes as the day goes by, so keep that in mind if you want to walk in and get one of the top seller items. They have a couple tables inside, but this is mostly a "take out" type of bakery. Huge selection of cakes, good prices. Want to come back and try some more!

I enjoy their delicate flavors and attention to detail. Ordering a cake was a breeze and every part of it was delicious! Yes, including the macarons and white chocolate signage. They make the best princess cake in the area. I had their mango cake as well, but I prefer it contrasted with the saltiness of a touch of cream cheese. Lovely local spot!

top_10.name: ONE65 Patisserie & Boutique
top_10.address: 165 O'Farrell St 1st Floor, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials: We could not resist stopping by this patisserie and trying their delicious baked goods when visiting San Francisco. If you'd like to try a good European-style patisserie,  visit them! You will not regret. Superior quality compared to the American baked goods.
Authentic French style desserts. The quality of the tarts and entremets are excellent. The pastries perfectly flaky!! This is not a cheap place but considering the location and the quality worth it.
Their lemon yuzu and pistachio cakes were incredibly delicious! Def want to go back and try more of their pastries!

top_10.name: Cinderella Bakery & Cafe
top_10.address: 436 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
testimonials:
Amazing store for Russian Food. We ordered the borscht, pelmeni, olivye, and medovik. It did take a bit for our main dishes to come out but its a family run restaurant so i was a-ok waiting. We had a tub of olivye and slice of medovik to snack on anyways so all good.

The olivye was quite salty but i do tend to like my food quite salty so it was very tasty to me. The medovik or honey cake was the highlight of the meal, not too sweet, super soft and filled with pieces of what seem to be walnuts and sour cream frosting that had a great tang (what i think is often missing from american cream cheese frosting)

the borscht was earthy and comforting and also vegetarian just fyi. the pelmeni tasted nicely rich from the meat and even better when dunked into the sour cream

Me and my partner went to this bakery on the 30th of December at around 11 AM. It got really crowded in like 30 min or so. We got the mushroom and potato piroshi, sweeet cheese and beef blinchiki, strawberry cream turnover, hazelnut financier, eclairs and napoleon cake.
The sweet dishes were definitely good. We also liked the Pirsoshki. For a group of Indians, blinchiki might not hit the spot very well (obviously because we wanted some spice/ onions and green chilies probably in the beef filling), but I would definitely recommend this place.
San Francisco prices-so not super wallet friendly.

A hidden gem in SF. Find this place and find a little slice of Heaven in the Richmond district.
Great huge selection of baked goods and Russian specialities like Peroshki, and dumplings, pastries and cookies great coffee and tea.
Nice seating area out on the sidewalk. I often stop here when visiting the city or doing an airport run. Fun place to take visitors to.
Highly recommended!

top_10.name: Arsicault Bakery
top_10.address: 87 McAllister St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials:
We've tried 4 different pastries, my top choice was plain croissant, it was sooooo tasty! Highly recommended it to try. Also the apricot monkey bread  was delicious  too!
The atmosphere was okay!
The price was reasonable for croissants!
Have fun! :)

It IS what it‚Äôs claimed to be ‚Äî they are one of the best croissant makers in the city. I got a chocolate almond croissant with a drip coffee and it was fantastic. It was buttery, creamy, plump, and flaky. The almond filling balances the flavor of the rich dark chocolate. Absolutely amazing.

I got there at around noon on a Saturday and there was still a line, but it went fast. I didn‚Äôt wait for more than 10 minutes before I got my pastry and coffee.

(2026 Feb 7, Saturday)

Delicious and fresh!!!
For all the vegetarians who don‚Äôt like egg washed croissants this is the place!!! None of the  croissants had that eggy flavor the baker aroma is so good you will walk in to this place involuntarily!! Will keep visiting during our stay. Must eat here. The savory pastry was so tasty!!!
Service was so charming, the girls working there were so lively and helpful.

top_10.name: Thorough Bread & Pastry
top_10.address: 248 Church St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA
testimonials: One of the best if not the best spots in this area. Delicious croissants, pastries, coffee, salad and sandwiches.

Just FYI ‚Äì this location does not serve iced coffee

Although their selection of pastries is quite delightful! I would definitely suggest this as a substitute for your usual donut. There are many sweet, jellied, breads, and chocolate desserts.

We visited on a Saturday around 8 am. The bakery wasn't busy and we happened to find street parking right in front of the bakery. We got an almond croissant and apple almond streusel croissant. The croissants were warm and DIVINE. They were very affordable too - $4.85 and $5. The bakery has indoor seating and a back patio too. Definitely enjoyed the two croissants we had.

top_10.name: Jane The Bakery
top_10.address: 1881 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
testimonials:
A lovely bakery with tasty breakfast options, delicious bread, and pastries that never disappoint. The prices are moderate, making it easy to come back again and again. Fresh coffee available.
Parking available

Warm, mouth savoring flaky croissants softly shattering with each bite, buttery buttery butter and buttery!, airy center that tastes freshly pulled from the oven. The coffee cake is rich and comforting, with that melts into a perfectly moist crumb. Every pastry feels thoughtfully made, indulgent without being heavy. Service was fast with no wait at all, and parking was easy and stress-free. Truly some of the best baked goods the city has to offer.

First time to try this bakery because of the reviews. We got the Asia Chicken Salad, chocolate croissant and vanilla sprinkle cookies. They were all ok, nothing to rave about. The dressing of the salad was good. If you want a quick breakfast, this place is ok. Prices are on the expensive though (spent about $33 for just 3 items).

We were not able to try their beverages because we brought our own. Maybe next time we can try their coffee.

top_10.name: Lapisara Eatery
top_10.address: 698 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: At first, we thought we would not get any seats because they said it gets busy after 11 am. But we did not wait too long, even after 11. The staff were very friendly. The food was as expected, very good. Might want a reservation a day in advance, just in case.

First time visit as we were actually headed for a nearby establishment.  We walked by and saw the menu out front, the cheery interior and decided to give it a try.  We lucked out on a weekend (arrived early) and were seated without a wait.  The staff was warm and welcoming.  Food came fast.  The variety on the menu was impressive and I loved the Thai additions.  Other than my Thai sausage being a bit gristly, everything was great.  The flavor of the sausage added a nice variation on the regular breakfast fare found elsewhere.  The lattes were adorable and post worthy in themselves.  Agree with other reviewers that the ube latte is beyond cute, if sweet drinks are not for you, opt for a regular or matcha latte.  The proprietor (or Management?)came to our table to check in which is always a nice touch.  We are really happy with this serendipitous stop for breakfast.  Don‚Äôt think twice about it, just go.

My husband and I came here on a Saturday morning around 10:30 and got a table right away. The staff was so friendly and the lattes and food were amazing. I can‚Äôt think of anything I would change about this place and I hope we get to try it again next time we visit San Francisco. 10/10. I had the Thai Panang omelette and it was like a cup of beef curry wrapped in egg. It was just the right amount of spicy and sweet. Reminded me of Khao soi which is my favorite Thai dish. The dressing on the salad was perfection and the potatoes were just a little crispy and so light and airy. My husband got the chicken and waffles and it was by far the best we‚Äôve ever tried. The chicken was perfectly crispy and juicy. And the drinks are so cute and delicious. Don‚Äôt hesitate to try this place out.

top_10.name: Wooden Spoon
top_10.address: 2172 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA
testimonials: Nice little breakfast spot near the Castro. Staff are very friendly and helpful during our meal. They had a decent selection of breakfast entrees. The ones we ordered were all delicious and good portion. We were nicely stuffed after our meal.

Got big spoon, potatoes were the best. Granola french toast was unique. Fresh orange juice was delicious and refreshing. Would not recommend the huevos. Portion sizes are decent. There was a waiting line but it moved quick. Service was quick too. Bar seating is more than table seating but bar seating is super cramped. Open kitchen and bar, good atmosphere.

Came in without a reservation mid day on a weekend and was able to get a spot at the bar without a wait. The bartender/waiter was incredibly friendly and helpful. In fact, all the staff were almost joyful and seemed happy to be there, which made this experience so pleasant. I ordered the grilled cheese and tomato soup and my partner had the standard breakfast. We both got mimosas as well, which the bartender was quick to ask us if we wanted refills. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was very relaxed and made for a nice afternoon. All of the eclectic wooden spoons that decorate the interior add to a their vibe and brand. We absolutely will be coming back. I saw quite a few things on the menu I‚Äôd like to try.

top_10.name: Eight AM Brunch
top_10.address: 1323 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: This brunch restaurant has a comfortable atmosphere, uses fresh ingredients, maintains high hygiene standards, and provides excellent service. I'll definitely come back here again.

Just over a year ago, my family and I visited 8 AM Brunchbin for the first time, and we walked away talking about two things: how good the food was and how genuinely kind and attentive the customer service felt. That combination stuck with us so much that on this trip, we made it a point to come back‚Äîand ended up eating breakfast here two days in a row.

The food is exactly as we remembered: incredibly fresh, simply prepared, and absolutely bursting with flavor. The lox bagel was perfect, and the waffle might be one of the best I‚Äôve ever had. We actually found ourselves debating how the cooks manage to make something so straightforward taste so exceptional.

The service is still top‚Äëtier‚Äîfriendly, patient, and welcoming in a way that makes you feel like they‚Äôre truly happy you‚Äôre there.

Highly recommended. This place has earned a permanent spot on our San Francisco must‚Äëvisit list.

I stopped here around 10 AM on a Saturday. It was busy so we had to wait a few minutes for a table. The service here was great and very quick. I had the open faced bagel with avocado, egg and ham - it was a great combo. The fruit cup that came with it was very generous and fresh. I also had a crepe with peanut butter and banana. It was delicious. I would definitely recommend stopping here.

top_10.name: Board and Drink
top_10.address: 1329 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials:
The place is small with few tables but it‚Äôs cute. Ambience could have been more aesthetic and cozy.

Menu options are very good for brunch. Food is great. French toast was the best! Especially the whipped cream. The fruits were also very fresh. Potatoes could have been more crispier. Omelette was average. Tater tots were very well seasoned and crunchy.

Service was perfect. Everyone was polite and nice and it was fast service.

Delicious brunch if you've got a sweet tooth! My friend and I arrived on a Sunday just past 1pm and were seated right away. We ordered the sweet board for 2 with brioche French toast, pancakes, and sausage. The board came with fresh strawberries, blueberries, blackberries and raspberries, eggs, and toppings of syrup, Nutella, and berry butter. We also ordered a side of tater tots as the board didn't come with any potatoes. The board was beautifully presented everything tasted delicious. My friend loved the Nutella and I was a big fan of the berry butter! We honestly didn't even need the tator tots as the board was quite filling. My Friend also ordered a strawberry matcha latte, which she said was quite good! Highly recommend!

Great coffee with generous food portion sizes. Unfortunately, there were a couple of letdowns; the bread served with the omelette was very hard and overcooked, and the pancakes didn‚Äôt arrive with the choc chips as ordered. The caf√© lacks a little atmosphere but is clearly very popular, so getting in early is recommended.
Note that an automatic 20% gratuity is added to the bill for groups of four or more.

top_10.name: Sweet Maple
top_10.address: 2101 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
testimonials: When we saw the line around the block we knew it was worth the wait! Lovely little brunch place! Because of the size of our group we were sat quite fast! Service was ok, food was delicious and tasty, portions were small, and atmosphere was great! My favorite was the citrus batter french toast!

Well worth the wait. Came on a busy weekend and there was a line ‚Ä¶ ended up waiting about 30 minutes for a table so not too bad. They make a good cup of coffee, and the service is pretty fast. I ordered the eggs with tots, and upgraded to the millionaires bacon, which was fabulous. Totally lived up to the hype. The omelette was also great, loved the multi color home potatoes. Will definitely come back. Yum!!!

Delicious food and friendly service! The line may look long but moves pretty quickly, especially if you‚Äôre willing to sit outside in cooler weather. The Bay Bottom Omelet is one of my favorites and comes with a generous serving of crab. Their bread is AMAZING. The fried french toast is good but tastes like dessert/fair food, so be prepared! The millionaire bacon is melt-in-your-mouth, sweet, and spicy. It‚Äôs worth trying at least once. The food is always quality!

top_10.name: Son and Garden
top_10.address: 700 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: I visited for my birthday 2021 and when I took my nephew to see the Warriors play in SF in 2023. Both times my experience was very good. The food and service were great. The food looked and tasted good!

The interior was nicely decorated and had a cozy vibe, but unfortunately the food was below average. The Benedict, omelet, and loco moco were all disappointing, and the customer service could definitely be improved. Overall, not a place I would return to or recommend.

Son & Garden is such a beautiful and dreamy spot! The interior is filled with flowers and pastel colors, making it perfect for photos. The food is not just pretty but also delicious. I loved corn pop and sticky rice tiger prawns‚Äì both were flavorful and well-presented. Service was friendly and fast. Great place for dinner with friends or a special date.

Highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a cute and cozy restaurant in the city!

top_10.name: Brenda's French Soul Food
top_10.address: 652 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials:
I tried this spot for Sunday brunch based on its great reviews. We had a reservation, but for parties of two, it seemed walk-in seating was readily available‚Äîseveral two-tops remained open during our meal. However, a group of five that arrived before us wasn‚Äôt seated until we were almost done. So, I‚Äôd definitely recommend a reservation for any group larger than two.

My main draw was the famous savory beignets. I ordered the crawfish beignets, and wow, they were dense!
