A set of three is served, and after about one and a half, I was surprisingly full, which impacted the rest of my meal. The tables are quite small, so the staff waits for you to finish appetizers before bringing out mains.

For my entree, I got the Creole platter to sample a variety. In hindsight, I wish I‚Äôd chosen the seafood gumbo. The catfish batter didn't adhere well and fell off, and the only side I truly enjoyed was the beans, sausage, and rice.

Parking: Some street parking is available, but the area didn't feel especially safe. I took public transit, walking from Civic Center Station.

Service: Was good.

Best Part: The beignets. I would return just for these.

Worst Part: The table size. I understand the need to maximize seating, but the tables are very small. With two plates, it's cramped, and the outer seat has to sit close to avoid the waitstaff.

Tip: Make a reservation in advance, especially for groups over two.

Return? Yes, but primarily for the beignets.

Echo all the great reviews here. Quick service at 10:00 am on a Saturday morning. Pork belly grits were delicious. Nice and hot. Great crisp on the pork. Lots of good cheese and poached egg too. Spicy onion jam was really good. Croque Monsieur and slaw was good. Got the 3 way (plain, apple, chocolate) beignets. My fave was the plain, just because I like a pure beignet, but the chocolate and apple were also good. Good place to go!

We had a wonderful breakfast here. The staff was friendly, warm, and on top of everything. Water service was great and I appreciated that they offered half orders for several items.

The Bananas Foster French toast was amazing, rich without being too sweet. The andouille sausage was fantastic and full of flavor, and the strawberry jam was truly heavenly. I also had an iced Grandma‚Äôs Coffee with black walnut and whipped cream, which was delicious and felt like such a fun treat.

We ordered the beignets too. They were a little dense, but the flavor was still very good.

Overall, a great breakfast spot with excellent service and food that really stands out. I would definitely go back.

top_10.name: Mymy
top_10.address: 1500 California St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: I love this small but mighty brunch spot on Nob Hill. The wait  is always there - expect 20-40 minutes in the line outside but you will be rewarded! Their main dish portions are huge and the food is great. I like to take miss Mymy with lemon ricotta pancakes, poached eggs and beacon. The service is friendly and nice despite the place being packed at all times. The prices are also fair for the amount and quality of food you get!

This was the best brunch I‚Äôve found so far in SF. I got the Baja California Benedict and it blew me away! It came with a very generous portion of dungeness crab. The hollandaise complimented the crab meat beautifully but didn‚Äôt overpower it. The pile of shrimp on the side was a pleasant, delicious surprise! And the crispy potatoes were everything you could ask for in a crispy potato. Perfect for scooping up the last bits of yolk and sauce.

Incredible meal and great service. I had no wait as a single diner on a Friday morning. Thank you so much! I can‚Äôt wait to come back!

MyMy serves brunch with a level of precision that makes every dish feel engineered. The French toast is the standout: the salted butter is the key, and the bread has a texture close to bread pudding without collapsing. The burger is solid, but it‚Äôs better with the side salad instead of fries because the greens are fresher and pair well with the rest of the menu. The lobster eggs Benedict is best ordered with low mayo, which keeps the dish balanced, and the potato wedges are the strongest part of the plate. They‚Äôre cooked evenly, crisp on the outside, soft inside, and best with a little extra salt and Tapat√≠a hot sauce.

top_10.name: Zazie
top_10.address: 941 Cole St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA
testimonials: Food was outstanding! Wonderful lite beet salad with avocado. Loved the hazelnuts on the salmon and risotto. Husband loved the baked chicken and noodles. Very clean and nice interior. Josh was an excellent server and the cr√®me br√ªl√©e was the best I‚Äôve had in years!

Stopped here for brunch with a friend and very much enjoyed the food and the service. I had the La Mer Benedict with two eggs which was a good portion and a tasty mimosa. The server was attentive and the food came out without much of a wait. The weather was nice enough to enjoy sitting outside.

Overall, a decent experience.
Highlights: the Albert eggs benedict was delicious and the buttermilk pancake was very good (way better than the gingerbread and french toast in the Sarah Jane's flight.)

Low points: the hot chocolate was really watered down. Also, I really worry about the sanitary conditions of this place. The bathroom, the dishwashing, and the pass where the finished food sits before being served is all right next to each other and it's also the choke point where patrons walk through to get to the back area seating. The floor was also really slippery in this area.

top_10.name: Sisterita
top_10.address: 669 Commercial St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA
testimonials:
Super cute Caf√© with friendly service.

We sat at the counter because the place was already packed, and that was our only option. Glad we did as we were served by the lovely April.

The coffee was amazing. So many other restaurants have incredibly strong and really bitter coffee and this was perfectly smooth and balanced. There are  lots of options for trying creative drinks and cocktails.

For breakfast I enjoyed the avocado toast with egg and tomatoes. My husband ordered the french onion soup which he gave thumbs up.

Will definitely return.

Came in on a Saturday without a reservation and got a table in about 30 min. It was well worth the wait. Everything on the menu looked good, but we ended up going with the classic Benedict and the country scramble. Both very good. The drink and cocktail menu was also very good. My favorite being ‚Äúthe secret‚Äù, a lychee cocktail. The interior is very cute and art deco style with a library wall. I will absolutely be coming back.

I was late to my reservation due to a BART delay and they graciously moved my time for me. When I arrived, I had my bag and my backpack for my mini vacation. They didn't treat me like an inconvenience at all. Some restaurants are very lacking in their customer service, and they would have given me subpar service. The waiters were attentive and the food was great, except for one small piece of egg shell. I have done that before while cooking. And I was coming in with 40 minutes to spare for their operational hours, so, they were probably rushed. I totally understand. I also understand that when I get eggshell in my food it is because I am not professionally trained. The atmosphere was very pleasant, so was the decor. The matcha latte and tiger stripe latte were both delicious, and every bite of the florentine eggs benedict, except that last bite, was delicious. I was kinda disappointed, but everything in life can't be perfect. Solid 4 stars!

P.S. Be careful with the potatoes they're lava inside. My mouth is burned. Let them sit for like 5 minutes plus before eating them. They may look OK to eat, but no, they're literally lava.

I looked it up and restaurants are supposed to tell you the food is hot, especially if it isn't visible. I came to San Francisco for a 3 day feast, with reservations at various restaurants around the city, and this 1st restaurant ruined it for me. It's day 2 and I'm settling for anything on the menu that isn't hot at my second reservation this morning. Kinda upset about it. I'll have to visit again, but I will avoid Sisterita at all costs. Even if it were free, I don't appreciate negligence.

top_10.name: Shizen
top_10.address: 370 14th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials:
Reservation required!

One of the best gems in the city for vegan sushi. Amazing ambiance, service, and decor.

Lot of great options - highly recommend the Boddy & Souli, and Candlestick sushi.

Don't skip their dessert of the day!

All vegan Japanese restaurant that has celiac-safe GF options - wow! Super excited to try this place so when I was in the area at 4:15 last Sunday, having missed lunch, thought I‚Äôd stop by. Was surprised to see there were already people waiting for it to open and the line was quite long when it opened at 4:30. Reservations are recommended but we were lucky enough to be accommodated. A charming dining area, albeit not a ton of elbow room. Seating options include tables up to four, up to two, and a small sushi bar.

The waitstaff were very friendly and responsive and helpful with recommendations.

Food wise, everything was good, including the miso soup and yuba salad, but the rolls are where the magic is. They‚Äôre all beautifully crafted and presented. We tried the California roll (great!), sweet tofu nigiri, Missing piece (made GF), and Boddy and Soul (recommended, and a winner by my dining partner, but not GF).

It was a real delight to enjoy such delicious food, carefully created, crafted, and presented, making it a multi sensory treat.

Wish there was a GF tempura option to make more of the rolls available to celiacs, but I loved what I had. Definitely recommend the fun, relaxed, down to earth atmosphere and uniquely Japanese vibe. Think stylish onsen, an indulgence where you leave feeling fulfilled, healthy, and happy!

Delicious vegan sushi that actually delivers on flavor! The Dynamite Roll (10/10) was the highlight, followed closely by the Roasted Bell Pepper Nigiri (9/10). The Shishito Peppers and Candlestick roll were also solid (8/10).

The price point feels high given the portion sizes, but the technique is impressive and it gives vegans a genuine sushi experience. Highly recommended for the execution, especially if you don't eat fish.

top_10.name: Kuma Sushi + Sake
top_10.address: 1040 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: The chili sauce in the local tofu is truly soooo amazing!!! And all the fish is so fresh and tasty; favor combo is fantastic too!! I‚Äôm in love with this place

In San Francisco for one night and wanted some great sushi and we lucked out finding this gem of a place. We grabbed a reservation which I highly recommend since it was packed. We sat at the sushi bar with a great view to watch them work their magic. I got the jackalope which was recommended by our sever and it was so good and I also ordered the Fresco which was also really yummy. My husband got sashimi of all kinds and loved it all. We also got a seaweed salad which was great too.

This was my second visit to Kuma Sushi within one month, and that alone says everything. Flew from NJ today and came straight here for lunch; After how incredible our first experience was, we had to come back and somehow, it was even better the second time.

The chef is truly outstanding. You can taste the care, skill, and passion in every single bite. The quality of the fish is superb fresh, clean, and perfectly prepared and the rolls are honestly out of this world. Every dish feels thoughtfully crafted, not rushed or ordinary.

Kuma Sushi has officially become one of those rare places you crave long after you leave. We will absolutely be loyal customers going forward. If you‚Äôre in San Francisco and love exceptional sushi, this place is a must.

Highly, highly recommend. üç£‚ú®

top_10.name: Saru Sushi Bar
top_10.address: 3856 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA
testimonials: This is a superb sushi bar. Everything was excellent, so nicely flavored that soy sauce was irrelevant. One of the best sushi meals I've had in a long time.
Our server was the best I‚Äôve had in a while. She was fun and a delight to talk with concerning my sake and sushi choices. I‚Äôll definitely be back again when I‚Äôm in SF

Excellent Sushi & Japan restaurant experience. Be sure to supplement with shiso leaf for some of the rolls that you order. They provide choice wasabi when ordering. Fresh natural Ginger!!! "Use the tiny metal tongs please."

top_10.name: KUSAKABE
top_10.address: 584 Washington St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA
testimonials: Visited for my birthday this past weekend! Kusakabe did not disappoint. We had heard lots of great things about the food and everything exceeded our expectations. The sake pairing was generous and delicious. My only hope is that next time I can sit at the sushi bar! Can‚Äôt wait to come back

We had a wonderful omakase experience. The chef, Mika, was very friendly and welcoming, taking the time to introduce each dish. The nigiri was absolutely delicious, the sashimi was fresh. My favorite was the scallop. Overall, the service was excellent, and we had a very enjoyable and memorable dining experience.

Took my sister for her birthday meal for an 8PM dinner seating!

Booking: book via tock...if you need to cancel, you can call them, I believe 1-2 days beforehand for a refund.

Requested for bar seating (did mention it would be $20/pp to guarantee) but seems like since i booked early enough and had a bday, so they were willing to accommodate without me needing to pay additional.

2 omakase $185/ea
asahi draft $9
genmai cha $8
sf mandate 5%

My sister thoroughly enjoyed the meal. I personally, probably because I wasn't that hungry, overall thought it was ok. In my opinion, the chefs here do put more sauce/extra flavors on the fish, which isn't my preference, as I like the fish to be the main highlight.

Chef Leo was friendly and attentive.

They deduct the tock deposit from the final bill. 20% auto gratuity.

Street parking only.

top_10.name: Ju-Ni
top_10.address: 1335 Fulton St STE 101, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA
testimonials: My wife and I went as our Valentine's date night, expecting maybe a quiet-ish time at the bar and some polite banter perhaps with our chef and maybe the couples next to us. What we got instead quite by happy happenstance was a rollicking good time chatting with the super friendly couples next to us at the bar, while our chef JK obliged with friendly comments within our conversation while still preparing the delectable courses of the omakase. Of course, the happenstance of the chatty friendly couples sitting next to us can't be replicated, but our chef JK really rolled with it and knew how to adjust the service to the cadence of our conversation -- our lucky accidental group ended up being the last guests at the restaurant, at which time the chefs broke out some japanese sake for us on the house, and we proceeded to chat another 20 minutes before leaving with the distinct conclusion that this was unquestionably the best time we have ever had at an omakase and that we shall return!

ju-ni focuses on the fish with some delicious nigiri pieces, but overall the ambiance & service was distracting and overpriced for the number of pieces served. overall, glad I tried it and loved the standout pieces, but wouldn‚Äôt recommend.

service: our chef wasn‚Äôt bad but the difference of service between our seating and the one next to us was night and day. ended up listening to the other chef more since he explained each dish with detail while ours mumbled his way through.

standout dishes: fatty tuna, red snapper, salmon roe with monkfish pate

Ju-Ni literally means ‚Äútwelve‚Äù in Japanese, a nod to the original 12-seat counter and the tight, timed omakase format. Service is mostly nigiri, paced one piece at a time, with a lot of torch work at the counter.  Ôøº Chef-owner Geoffrey Lee‚Äôs signature bite is the ‚Äúikura with ankimo‚Äù: salmon roe topped with shaved, deep-frozen ankimo (monkfish liver, often called ‚Äúfoie gras of the sea‚Äù). Lee has described it as ‚Äúour dish at Ju-Ni,‚Äù and it‚Äôs a standout.  Ôøº

top_10.name: Roka Akor - San Francisco
top_10.address: 801 Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials:
Very upscale lovely steak and seafood restaurant. The omakase offering is a variety of their signature and most sort after menu items. They are not small portions by any means, all meticulously crafted by the chef as a beautiful way to explore their menu.
Everything from A5+ Wagyu to lobster tail and a dessert selection. I won't tell too much as to give away the experience of being in the chef hands - but I can say they are good hands to be in. Thankyou for this special meal on our 20th wedding anniversary.

Contemporary, but excellent. I've been to dozens of omakases, but this one was super unique, easily in my top 3. Besides sashimi, nigiri, and the usual hot stuff, they had a huge lobster tail, wagyu, and an amazing dessert platter. I was so stuffed I had to take 20% of it home. Definitely recommend this unique experience.

Pros: the food was well prepared and promptly delivered. We sat in the downstairs area that was giving speakeasy vibes and I really enjoyed it. If you are sensitive to sound though, you may not like it during prime time because when it fills up, it is very loud in there. I didn‚Äôt mind it, but I know some people like a more peaceful surrounding in which case the upstairs would‚Äôve probably been better.

As you can see from the photos, we had a good variety of food and I particularly like my dessert to come out with my supper and they delivered on that request properly.

The coffee machine was broken, which was a disappointment so I ended up having green tea with my dessert, but was still enjoyable.

The crispy Brussels were perfect, and the dessert was the perfect amount of rich and flavorful. I do believe the dessert was a bit overpriced, but it was a work dinner that a client paid for so I can‚Äôt complain too much.

Cons: nothing significant. Our server was great and even got us a complementary hot plate to try. We only got delayed slightly with my tea, but it didn‚Äôt ruin the experience.

top_10.name: Nara
top_10.address: 1515 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: Very delicious sushi! It was all very high quality and the special tasted amazing! The service was also phenomenal- the waitress even gave us complementary sake on the house! However I will say the sushi is very pricy so be prepared.

Nara is an excellent sushi restaurant providing quality fish. The happy hour menu from 5-7 provides a great value.

Ordered the Tai, Sake, Hamachi and Hotate and the fish was flavorful and served in a hand rolls the fish portions were generous.
Delicious rolls and great service. Sushi chefs are friendly and skilled. They have uni from Hokkaido and Santa Barbara as well as great specials.

top_10.name: Hakashi Japanese Sushi Bar & Grill
top_10.address: 474 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
testimonials:
I have been meaning to check out this place, and I should have come SOONER!!!
We had Omakase- and it was the BEST in San Francisco. Every piece was perfect, and I really enjoyed conversation with the chefs at the sushi counter. Loved the unassuming vibes. Will come back soon!!üëçüèªüëçüèªüç£üç£

I took my boyfriend here for a date night, and it was absolutely perfect! The fresh sushi rolls stole the show. We started with the gyoza, which were nice and crispy, had a bunch of their sushi rolls and topped it off with their cheesecake. The vibe is very cozy kinda set the mood for a romantic evening, and the attentive staff made our experience even better. This place is definitely a hidden gem.

I cannot recommend this place enough! The omakase was a wonderful experience and all of the dishes were fresh, delicious, and beautiful! Chef Julio and Nelson did a fantastic job with the food! They did a great job accommodating our party‚Äôs dietary restrictions, offering substitutions for dishes that some of our party members could not eat.

top_10.name: Zentarou Sushi and Sake Bar
top_10.address: 1380 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA
testimonials:
I had an amazing experience at Zentarou Sushi and Sake Bar! The omakase here is truly impressive, especially for the price. Every piece of fish was incredibly fresh, well-balanced, and thoughtfully prepared. You can really feel the chef‚Äôs passion‚Äîeach course was explained with care, and the pacing of the meal was perfect.

The selection had a great mix of classic cuts and creative bites that made the whole experience memorable. The portions were just right, and I left feeling satisfied without being overly full. The ambiance is cozy and welcoming, and the staff were attentive, friendly, and made the experience even better.

For the quality you get, Zentarou offers one of the best and most affordable omakase experiences in the area. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back and recommending it to anyone who loves sushi!

Zentarou has outstanding tableside service, even when the restaurant is busy. The staff is attentive and genuinely takes care of your needs. I really enjoyed the umeshu plum wine, and the omakase is a must-try‚Äîthe fish is very high quality. The menu changes every season, which keeps things fresh and interesting. The cozy atmosphere makes the experience even better. Highly recommend.

The food is seriously top-notch‚Äîsuper fresh, beautifully made, and perfectly balanced. Every bite feels thoughtful, like real care went into it. This is sushi done right, with zero shortcuts.

The drinks deserve their own shoutout. They‚Äôre creative, well thought out, and pair incredibly well with the food. Definitely not your average sushi bar cocktails or sake list.

What really makes the place special, though, is the people. Chef Zen‚Äôs passion and creativity shine through at the counter, and Beach is one of the friendliest, most attentive servers you‚Äôll meet‚Äîwelcoming, genuine, and always checking in without being overbearing.

Great food, fun and inventive drinks, and warm hospitality all around. This is the kind of place you leave already planning your next visit.

top_10.name: Ebisu Restaurant
top_10.address: 1283 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA
testimonials: Sorry for not visiting sooner. Top sushi nigiri with such delicious soft sushi rice. No wonder there was a line for a seat. I will definitely be hitting this place up more often. No joke.

This is by far my favourite restaurant in SF! The quality of the fish, the service, the flavour! Everything was top notch. If you can, try to be seated at the bar so you can talk directly to the chef‚Ä¶ it adds to the experience!

Expect to wait 30min before getting seated. The restaurant is packed on Friday or Saturday nights!

You can't call to make a reservation here. You'll need to walk in and either be seated immediately or write your name on the list. Whatever happens as long as you get to sit down and eat at this establishment is your good fortune. I had the mackerel dinner, my son had the salmon dinner, and my partner had all types of sushi. I could barely speak because my tastebuds were too busy having a party in my mouth. Definitely worth any wait!!!

top_10.name: Sriracha Thai Cuisine
top_10.address: 1319 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA
testimonials:
As a fried rice lover, I‚Äôve had some of the best fried rice around the world ‚Äî and Sriracha Thai Cuisine easily makes my top three. The flavors are super well balanced, and the basil leaves leave such a fresh, delicious taste at the end.

Highly recommend it!

This is a really cute spot! Only had to wait 5 minutes for a table, but the area is filled. A very warm environment for a date night!

Food was amazing, we got a curry pan fried chicken pot sticker, grilled prawns, and pad se eww.

All the food tasted amazing, and I‚Äôll definitely come back.

Sriracha Thai is no frills, tasty Thai food with a cozy cafe like ambience.

The Thai fried rice was great with the sweet spicy and shrimpy.

The tom kha was mild and creamy. The green curry was very fragrant and on the thicker side.

The chicken wings were a tad sweet.

Service was great. And proximity to Golden gate park makes it a solid option for affordable tasty Thai food in SF.

Will be going back.

top_10.name: New Thai Elephant
top_10.address: 393 Bay St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: The food is average. Red curry is too sweet. The roast pork was above average and the pork with basil was the best amongst the dishes ordered. Their take away portions were of decent size and hence pretty fair pricing for local standards. Restaurant size is big but service a little slow in terms of food prep. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Great Asian cuisine with a solid menu selection. The food was delicious, reasonably priced, and the portion sizes were just right. The d√©cor really adds to the experience, with beautiful Thai artwork throughout the venue and an incredible elephant feature wall that really stands out.

However, the night I visited felt quite chaotic. The restaurant seemed short-staffed, and the waitress was clearly under the pump doing her best. Unfortunately, this meant long waits for meals, and even food delivery drivers were visibly frustrated by delays.

Overall, tasty food and a lovely setting, but the service experience would definitely improve with a few extra staff on shift.
5 star experience. We ordered red curry, mango shrimp salad, eggplant basil chicken sautee and all were flavorful and delicious. Piping hot entrees perfect for a cold day.

top_10.name: Zen Yai
top_10.address: 925 O'Farrell St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: Awesome food. And im picky about my Thai food  we ordered the green papaya salad, Silver noodle salad, the barbecued pork, and Tom Kah soup. Every single plate was excellent üëç Service was great, lots of space and very open with large windows. The area is a little difficult for parking, Service is fast. Overall EXCELLENT food and VERY good prices....much less expensive than other restaurants. We were a large group of seven, but everything went smooth and fast.

The new location is 1 block away from the old location which is great!

The interior is very homey, spacious and great for large groups, families and kids!! Large menu that accommodates all palates.

I sampled the two poplar boat noodles (small sizes). They were so unique, punchful and super delicious!!!

To top it off, the service was inviting and welcoming!! Definitely an A++ eatery.

They moved!  I like their new location A LOT better than the previous.  It‚Äôs in a better (safer) neighborhood.  I absolutely LOVE the boat noodle.  It‚Äôs what I get every time.  The beef version is fire.  The broth is so bold and full of flavor.  Tiny bits of fried pork rind top the noodle.  Yum!  This time though the pork belly with Chinese greens was not good.  The pork belly was dry and over fried.

top_10.name: House of Thai
top_10.address: 901 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: A very cute and family oriented Thai spot in Sanfrans. Service is quick and very friendly. The food is exceptionally seasoned.Every dish was balanced and flavorful.  The food is well portioned with reasonable prices. Some of the best Thai food I have ever had. Well worth stopping a visit.

I honestly loved this place! I must say it is in a weird neighborhood if you go at night, however the food was amazing! ü§© Portions were big and flavorful! Even my friend that‚Äôs gluten free chose something she liked. Would definitely recommend!

Great vegan options, and more authentic than I ever had in the bay area. Large portions and cozy atmosphere. The servers are very nice and willing to help but sometimes seem a bit lost - took quite a while to pay and pack our leftovers. But it could just be that they're new. Other than that the service was great, the food arrived quickly.

top_10.name: Farmhouse Kitchen Thai Cuisine
top_10.address: 710 Florida St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials:
As a new California resident, I've been loving the experience of exploring so many new restaurants across San Francisco and the Bay Area. I tried Farmhouse Kitchen Thai Cuisine for a weekend lunch, and overall, it was a great experience.

We started with Thai tea, which tasted good, but the giant ice ball added mainly for presentation was a bit of a mood killer--it looked nice but diluted the drink quickly.

The crispy egg rolls were delicious--perfectly crispy and flavorful, a great way to start the meal.

We  also ordered chicken tom kha. It was very tasty, with big pieces of chicken and vegetables, but it felt more like a stir fry than a soup. I personally wished it had a bit more soup

For the mains, we ordered the chicken red curry with blue jasmine rice. The curry itself was absolutely delightful--rich, comforting, and full of flavor. However, the blue jasmine rice didn't really add anything to the taste. It looks great for Instagram shots, but you can easily skip it and stick to regular white rice.

We also ordered the Thai fried rice, which was a total flavor bomb--so good that I actually forgot to take a photo of it!

Their Mother's Sauce deserves a special mention--it's incredibly delicious but very spicy, so be careful if you can't handle the heat.

The ambience is very cute, and the service was fast, making the overall experience enjoyable.

Definitely going back--there's still so much on the menu to try!

Delicious food, great vibes, and fun, friendly servers, it‚Äôs all there. The staff went out of their way to recommend some of their appetizers, which were incredible, crispy, flavorful, and perfectly seasoned. Every dish we tried had a perfect balance of flavors, from savory to spicy, and the portions were generous without being overwhelming. The curries were rich and comforting, the noodles had just the right texture, and the fresh herbs really elevated each dish. On top of that, the decor is playful and visually striking, making it a fun spot for photos as well. Between the flavorful food, welcoming service, and cool atmosphere, it‚Äôs definitely a place I‚Äôd recommend checking out.

This isn‚Äôt tampered down Thai food! I enjoyed our meal so much; the meat dishes are cooked and seasoned and spiced to perfection. We didn‚Äôt celebrate anything while we were there but we witnessed two birthdays: if you want a fun celebration experience, you should go there, it‚Äôs loud and vibrant! When I travel back to SF, I‚Äôm definitely coming back.

top_10.name: Lers Ros
top_10.address: 730 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials:
Best Thai food in the area that I could find for delivery.
Everything I ordered hit the spot for me. I think dine-in will taste even better.

Quiet night for dinner.  Ample portions. Asked for medium spice and was pleased that the flavor and spice were perfect. Also got a young coconut which was fun. Fried banana with pistachio ice cream for dessert. Leftovers were packed up beautifully and tasted great the next day for lunch. Sweet servers. Recommend!

Tried the place because of the recommendations and proximity.
Neither the surroundings nor the entrance seemed impressive. Simple decor and setup inside.
The crowd inside and continuous flow of the online delivery personnel does indicate its popularity.
Had a papaya salad with grilled prawns as a starter followed by Spicy Green Bean Chicken and Pineapple Fried Rice. All sumptuous though the salad was a bit spicier than what we are used to. Ample portions and we had to cancel another dish based on the serving size (which they cancelled without any issue).
Service was good but seemed understaffed.
Overall, a fulfilling experience. Definitely value for money.

top_10.name: Khao Tiew
top_10.address: 272 Claremont Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94127, USA
testimonials:
It's funny because we found this place from a random short in YouTube, but the food was really good - probably the top 3 best things we tried were the Moo Hong, the Kaya toast, and Khao Soi Pad Haeng.

We went right at open and lined up around 3:20 and we were 8th in line. By the time it was 4 PM the line was at the end of the block. And we were already being seated. I would wait at this place for maybe 30 minutes tops, but it definitely was a good experience.

Food wasn't really spicy enough would be my only complaint, but it mostly felt like Thai fusion which isn't a bad thing, but you shouldn't expect traditional Thai cuisine coming here.

Service was great with a kind and attentive team! Food was good with a particular shout out to the khao soi and duck curry (much debate as to which was a fav amongst friends). The Kaya toast was a clear winner out of everything. And pad see ew was a surprisingly good contender that one south bay area local said was the best they've had.

Tom yum was good but not the best I've ever had. Still a delicious dish on a cold, rainy winter day. The spicy wonton was decent, we enjoyed the sauce.

On a cold Wednesday evening in October, I was hoping for a delicious date night spot and Khao Tiew delivered. Though relatively new, this place has received a lot of acclaim for the food and because of that I knew I had to try it out for myself. After joining the waitlist (YOU MUST BE WITHIN 1 MILE TO JOIN), we had about 45 minutes to wait around 6:00. However we blew by that time by hanging out and checking out shops in West Portal, which unfortunately were mostly closed by that time. Anyways, after getting seated inside we decided on the Crab Fried Rice in a Claypot, the Khao Soi, the Duck Breast Red Curry, and the Crispy Papaya Salad. I enjoyed everything a lot. The crab fried rice was rich and had a really nice savory and subtle sweet flavor. The Khao Soi was probably the best I‚Äôve ever had and it honestly did not even need the meat add on. The Duck Breast Red Curry was surprisingly fresh and rich, while the duck was super tender. Finally, the Crispy Papaya Salad was really unique and I've never had a papaya salad in this form. What we ordered was more than enough for 3 people, so I wouldn‚Äôt do much more than that. Anyways, I am super glad we came and I will definitely recommend this place as one of the best thai foods I have had in the bay.

top_10.name: Basil Thai Restaurant & Bar
top_10.address: 1175 Folsom St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials:
Great Thai food. Curry was rich and would recommend the stuffed eggplant.

Pad see ew was good too, although serving of crab isn't worth the price.

Such a great vibe with good music and even better service! We had the pad kee mao, but the real standouts were the grilled pork skewers and the charcoal-grilled hanger steak. If you love meat, do not skip these. Already planning my next trip back!

Really solid Thai food. The papaya salad was crisp, fresh and perfectly acidic and spicy. Pad Thai was excellent‚Äîjust enough sauce without any sogginess. Lived the vegetable curry too. Everything was very tasty.

Staff was friendly and accommodated our stroller. Great restaurant.

top_10.name: Saap Ver Damn Good! Thai street food
top_10.address: 88 Division St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials: Picked up some takeout food from this restaurant and enjoyed everything we ordered. Flavor and spice levels were very good. All the dishes and a good amount of meat in them. Pick up was ready in a timely fashion. Looking forward to trying out more menu options next time

Tried a bunch of dishes here and everything was amazing and authentic!

The shrimp paste fried rice was great‚Äîsuper flavorful with lots of toppings (a must if you like bold flavors). The five spice pork leg, crying tiger, and salted egg yolk squid were all perfect, while the tom saap pork ribs tasted super authentic and spicy (just wished for a touch more lime). Even the wings and papaya salad were on point.

Drinks were great too‚Äîespecially the Blaco Margarita (smooth and tasty without being heavy on alcohol). Overall, this place nails authentic Thai flavors with great execution. Definitely recommend if you‚Äôre into bold, spicy, and savoury dishes!

This my second time eating in this restaurant. I did not take pic of my first visit but I ordered their spring roll and pork belly rice meal. Somehow, this is a so so food. For the second time, I tried their pad thai with prawns and fried fish cake. This is good better than food i ordered in my first visit. They take order and serve food fast. The price is on the expensive side but the food quality is good. The vibes in the restaurant is very good. They have large tv with a bar. Very good for drinking and watching sports.

top_10.name: Fin Thai SF
top_10.address: 2327 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: We were able to get few of their happy hot dishes and we loved them. We had fresh rolls, fish cake, crispy prawn rolls, fried cuttlefish, oyster shooter, one mojito, salmon coconut as curry and one shrimp pad thai. We loved that restaurant in special their friend cuttlefish, oyster shooter!

Love the interiors! Came in as a group of 13. We got there in time for happy hour, ordered a few things, but I didn't really find their happy hour menu worth it. The main dishes were, though. I enjoyed my catfish and my boyfriend loved his pad kee mow with seafood. Flavors were spot on.
Beautiful Thai restaurant with delicious  food. We went there for brunch club all amazing. Recommend to try Thai tea French toast10/10.

top_10.name: Dumpling Home
top_10.address: 298 Gough St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials:
Steamed dumplings (Xiao long bao) are amazing. We ordered one spicy and one squash/shrimp.
Pan fired dumplings are not the best in Bay Area, I‚Äôll give a 4.
A localized dumpling place in general. Good vibe and atmosphere.

Hands down one of the best soup dumplings / xiaolongbaos and shengjianbaos in North America!! Better than DTF IMO. The egg and chive packets were also really good and authentic üòãüòã

Be there before they open to beat the crowds.

The food was absolutely delicious and came out super fast. The staff were friendly and welcoming, which made the experience even better. The beer was really good too! It does get a little loud since the place stays busy, but that just shows how popular it is. You might not linger long, but every bite is worth it. I really enjoyed my visit!

top_10.name: Âæ°È£üÂõ≠ Z & Y Peking Duck
top_10.address: 606 Jackson St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials:
This restaurant offers excellent Beijing-style cuisine, with the Peking duck being the absolute highlight.
The duck is perfectly roasted, with crispy skin and tender, flavorful meat.
What pleasantly surprised us was their sea cucumber, which was exceptionally well-prepared and delicious.
The flavors were clean, balanced, and true to traditional Beijing cooking.
Each dish showed great attention to detail and quality ingredients.
We would definitely return and highly recommend it to anyone who appreciates authentic Beijing cuisine.

The food was excellent. Short wait to get in even though there was a line. Great vibe, modern decor. It looks like they have a downstairs. We were able to get their Peking Duck and we were able to get more pancakes. Overall, it was a good experience. We definitely would consider coming back. Just note they do charge an automatic 8% to your bill for a San Francisco service fee.

We had an excellent meal at Z&Y Peking Duck! The miso sea bass was incredibly tender with great flavor, and the fried Dungeness crab had a perfect crunch with bold seasoning. The Peking duck was delicious, and even the green beans were a solid side. Everything we tried was well-executed and flavorful. Highly recommend for anyone looking for quality Chinese cuisine with standout seafood dishes.

S/o to AiDa for great service too!

top_10.name: NORTHERN CHINA BBQ
top_10.address: 294 9th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials: Decent skewers. Good amount of seating. Service is quick. Wished they had the tray to keep the skewers warm.

5/5 SO SO YUMMYYY!!! This hit the spot üòçüò© We actually came here after another meal that we weren‚Äôt satisfied with. The best were 1. Chicken skewers and 2. Taiwanese sausage skewers. The seaweed salad was also excellent. Next time we‚Äôll come for a proper meal and get some much more!

Decent Northern China style dishes ‚Äî extensive selection of various barbecue skewers (meat, seafood, mushroom, veg) reminiscent of Mainland Chinese street food.

Lamb Skewer is slightly gamey, dusted with the classic cumin-paprika seasoning. Enjoy with cold side dishes such as the standard Smashed Cucumber. Sliced Beef in Chili Sauce is fragrant from Sichuan peppercorn and chilis.

top_10.name: Sohunan of Henry's Hunan
top_10.address: 674 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA
testimonials:
Got DoorDash.  Was warm and fresh upon delivery.  Packaged well.

Dumplings were good but beef dish lacked depth of flavor.  Was just ok.   Not sad about my meal but wasn‚Äôt wonderful, just average.

Great food and a lovely experience! We dined here on New Year‚Äôs Eve and were pleasantly surprised that it wasn‚Äôt too crowded. The staff was very friendly, attentive, and made us feel well taken care of. Would definitely come back!

Not delicious as what I expect for Hunan food and the flavors are quite bland. I'm not sure why the review score is so high, but my expectation for an authentic, flavorful Hunan food was definitely not met.

We went in during a weekend dinner and there were very few people - kind of already indicating the place is not so popular.

We tried House smoked beef jerky and house special tofu. Although both looked fine, they were really lacking the flavor. I can taste some saltiness but not much more. I was actually surprised because the smoky Beef jerky didn't have actually the smoke flavor.

Service was so-so. After we sat at a table, the owner asked us whether we needed water. When we asked to pack our leftover food, they were trying to give us fewer boxes and asked if we can stack different dishes together.

Suitable for a quick meal but not the nice vibe - The restaurant is small in a fast food style and not for large parties.

top_10.name: Hong Kong Clay Pot Restaurant
top_10.address: 960 Grant Ave, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
testimonials: After closure of Oriental Pearl Restaurant, we are still searching for a near close joint‚Ä¶ this place is on the first floor, just like Oriental Pearl, a bit difficult to carry a stroller upstairs‚Ä¶ restaurant was 70% full when we arrived at around 6:30 pm, the soup was very standard, nothing exceptional though, had to add condiments to elevate taste‚Ä¶Potsticker was stuffed with chicken, crab Rangoon was good, Chow Mein and Chicken Entree was great‚Ä¶the house noodles was also very good, but limited prawns and chicken in it‚Ä¶ the fried rice was again standard. It‚Äôs an all women run joint, very attentive and prompt in service.

My wife and I had dinner here last night while celebrating our Anniversary.

Parking is a little difficult to locate in this area, so we had to drive around for a bit.

The space is up a flight of stairs and there is no elevator. It us a family style restaurant so they have found tables with turntables in the middle for the sharing of food. They have about 10 tables. The restaurant itself is cute and very connected to the Asian culture

When my wife and I arrived, there were 2 free tables available. Yes, they are created for larger parties. However, many of them were. They placed us at a table to share with another 2 ppl party. We did not like this at all. As a guest at a restaurant, we deserved the right to have our own table. It was a totally inconvenience to the ppl that were already at the table. Btw.. one was a Trans. I keep wondering why they sat us at no other table with others that were also 2 ppl. Why this table?

We observed a YT couple walk in and placed at their own large table. We them observed 3 Asians walk in and they were placed at a vet large table.

My wife and I did not hold much of a conversation because it was weird!!

The service was accomodating until midway through even our waitress never came back up check on us or ask if we needed anything. Honestly.. we did not even receive water now that I think of it.

The food was hot when it came out. I was not a fan of the wonton soup. It lacked flavor. I enjoyed the House Noodles (shrimp, chicken and beef).. but it needed seasoning or more flavor. We ordered chicken wings. That was delicious. We also ordered fried string beans and pork. That was so good!!!

My wife had a Chinese beer and I had a cold Sake served in a bottle.

When we were ready to pack up the leftover food, it had to sit because or efforts to be seen by a waitress to receive a box and bag was ignored. When we finally got the attention of another one, they immediately brought the check. Did not even ask if we needed a box.

Oh.. prices are really good and cheap. You get alot of food.

I reccomend this place, with reservations depending on your race or appearing lifestyle.

I was so happy to go to San Francisco for my birthday. My husband treated me to dinner in Chinatown at Hong Kong Clay Pot. Everything we ate was thoroughly enjoyed. From the salt and pepper chicken wings to the Chicken Clay Pot with chicken, sausage, mushrooms and onions.This is a no-frills restaurant, but all the food is bursting with flavor.

top_10.name: Chinatown San Francisco
top_10.address: 855 Stockton St # B, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
testimonials: Absolutely beautiful.  First time here. There was so much food to choose from! You can buy fresh delicacies here. Great for walking..although parking was hard. Tuesday & Thursday are street  cleaning days..so parking was limited. The people were both friendly and helpful.

Chinatown SF is amazing. No matter how long I live in this city I am always gonna be in awe of Chinatown. I bought a lot of different dried mushrooms to make a rice with mushroom sauce dish, and it was delicious. You should challenge yourself and walk up any of the steep streets, like Jones St, get yourself a good leg workout. I ended up going up Jones and down California, and ran into Ossa Steakhouse, Grace Cathedral, and The Fairmont. Just GORGEOUS. Then you can go back down and get some good food on any of the streets running through Chinatown. My fave spot is Osmanthus for delicious dim sum. You can go into any of the dumpling restaurants too. There was one (forgetting the name) that had a super long line. There is just so much to see! The next time I go to Chinatown, I am going to buy a silk floral pattern robe from a store I ran into on Grant (I think).All in all, I had a great Sunday.

We had a nice time exploring San Francisco's Chinatown on our recent trip. As one of the oldest and largest Chinatowns in North America, it offered an immersive dive into Chinese culture right in the heart of the city. Walking around the bustling streets was a highlight ‚Äì from the iconic Dragon Gate entrance to the colorful murals, lanterns, and historic architecture, every corner felt alive with history and energy. We loved popping into the authentic tea shops, dim sum spots, and markets selling everything from fresh herbs to intricate souvenirs. The mix of locals and tourists created a lively atmosphere that made us feel like we were in a different world.

That said, it can get quite crowded, especially on weekends, which made navigating the narrow sidewalks a bit challenging at times. Still, the cultural richness and the chance to try some amazing street food more than made up for it.

Overall, Chinatown is a must-visit for anyone wanting to experience San Francisco's diverse side.

top_10.name: Mister Jiu's
top_10.address: 28 Waverly Pl, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
testimonials:
# Culinary Heights, Service Lows, and a Deafening Beat

Mister Jiu‚Äôs, occupying an expansive and pleasant space in San Francisco‚Äôs Chinatown, is rightly renowned for its take on Chinese cuisine. The kitchen delivers a formidable array of thoughtful improvements on traditional dishes alongside new creations that use familiar techniques in fresh ways. In purely culinary terms, it rises well past many similarly priced restaurants in the U.S. and abroad.

Unfortunately, that excellence is significantly marred by both ambience and front-of-house execution. Start with the ambience: while the space is meticulously decorated, the tables are comfortably spaced, and the restrooms are sparkling clean, the dining room is overwhelmed by incredibly loud electronic dance music‚Äîmusic better suited to a nightclub or dive bar than to a high-end restaurant where people come to taste, talk, and linger. The volume, which we estimate at roughly 80‚Äì100 dB, eliminated any realistic chance of conversation and forced us into shouting exchanges, including with the staff.

The staff, unfortunately, matched the chaotic energy of the room rather than the precision of the kitchen. Basic operational issues kept recurring: calls to the restaurant went to voicemail with a message stating that ‚Äúthis mailbox is full and doesn‚Äôt accept new messages.‚Äù At the table, utensils and sauces arrived slowly and only after reminders. Plates were not reliably cleared or exchanged between courses without repeat requests. Even the dining table‚Äîvisibly soiled‚Äîwas not wiped before dessert was served. None of these are ‚Äúsmall details‚Äù in a restaurant of this ambition and price point; they are core competencies.

The Michelin Guide reviewers would likely agree that excellence requires more than a great kitchen. It requires a functional, attentive front of the house and an environment that supports the dining experience. This is where Mister Jiu‚Äôs currently falls short.

As ordinary consumers, we are not paid or compensated in any way for this review. We hope management recognizes that the restaurant‚Äôs extraordinary food deserves equally competent service and a dining-room atmosphere that matches its reputation.

Came here almost by chance and left completely impressed. I didn‚Äôt even know it had a Michelin star, we came because my husband had seen a Spanish chef we love post about it on Instagram during his SF visit. What a find.

The place feels super hidden, right in the middle of Chinatown, and the second we sat down we both thought, ‚ÄúOkay, this place is different.‚Äù Everything we ordered was so good: lamb dumplings, sizzled petrale sole, fried rice, plus a cocktail for my husband, not a single miss.

Also, the service made the night even better. Big thanks to David and Jovi for being amazing.

1000% recommend. One of those spots you‚Äôre genuinely excited to tell people about.

Great vibes and great food with generous portions. While a bit pricey, I think it was worth the experience. I‚Äôd definitely order everything again except maybe the eggplant.

Everything off the snacks/classics portion of the menu (milk bread, turnip cake, beef tendon) were delicious twists on more traditional versions of the dishes. Make sure to dip the milk bread in the beef tendon oil for a different flavor profile.

The uni cheong fun was expensive but definitely one of the best versions of the dish I‚Äôve had.

The grilled pork chops were incredibly juicy but it‚Äôs not for everyone with its strong flavors and spicy bitter melons

The only thing I‚Äôd not get again is eggplant, which felt very average and nothing special.

top_10.name: House Of Xian Dumpling
top_10.address: 925 Kearny St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials:
I am visiting from OC and wanted a true Chinatown foodie experience. I am so excited I came here and got to experience this. Genuinely made me feel like Anthony Bourdain with the level of flavor. If you come here you're coming for the hand pulled noodles and the dumplings. We got the orange chicken and it was pretty mid but the Spicy Beef Noodle Soup and the Pork dumplings in chili oil were to die for. I would genuinely eat this everyday if I could.

The noodles were perfectly cooked. They kept their bouncy texture all through the meal and soaked up the dynamite flavor of the broth. The beef was so tender and flavorful. I'll be dreaming of the broth and noodles tonight for certain.

The pork dumplings alone were cooked perfectly and burst with flavor (literally) with every bite. The addition of the chili oil was chefs kiss. Best dimsum I've ever had.

Thank you San Francisco for stealing my foodie heart. I'll never forget this experience. Love love love!

My friend ordered the chicken and cabbage dumplings and I ordered the Shanghai pan fried pork buns and braised beef noodle soup. The pan fried pork buns were a bit dry and not that flavorful on their own, but with some chili oil, soy sauce, and vinegar it was good. The braised beef noodle soup was some of the BEST I‚Äôve ever had. The noodles seemed to be freshly hand pulled, the beef was so tender, and the broth was rich and very well/seasoned. Prices were good and they do take card/Apple pay, which was very convenient. Food arrived quickly and the atmosphere was very hole-in-the-wall Chinese restaurant.

We stopped by this little spot - more of a hole-in-the-wall than a full restaurant. Tried two kinds of shrimp dumplings: the first ones were great, kind of homemade-style with thick dough and tasty filling  - really hit the spot. The second ones, the shumai, were a letdown: tiny, same price, but the filling tasted more like fish, and the little shrimp on top felt more like decoration. So, one type was delicious, the other‚Ä¶ not so much

top_10.name: R & G Lounge
top_10.address: 631 Kearny St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
testimonials:
Definitely going back if I‚Äôm in SF. If you ever wondered what kind of Chinese restaurants are good and authentic this place is. You know it‚Äôs legit when a group of Chinese family  are waiting to be seated.
Food wise no brainer get the eggplant and shrimp. Only if you like eggplant. On a cold night get the beef winter melon soup. Warms  you up instantly. Dungeness crab may be a miss you dont mind dinging in for the meat.

It had been about 17 years since I last ate at R&G lounge, because I was kind of boycotting due to receiving poor service so so long ago. With so many other restaurants to try, I was never interested in coming back until a friend told us that he loves R&G lounge so much that he eats here almost once a month, and convinced us all to have dinner there, after we were turned away from 4 Kings. R&G has been around all this time, and lots of people seem to love it, and of course I can forgive poor service nearly 2 decades ago.
Has R&G always been so big? They put us in large table tucked away from the commotion. They have multiple floors and even have options for private dining. I can see why large parties plan events here so they can eat the usual Chinese banquet dishes.

$65 Salt & Pepper Dungeness Crab - whole crab battered, deep fried, sprinkled w/ salt & pepper seasoning:
great! fresh & succulent fresh crab meat piled high with crispy garlic

$50 Chilean Seabass (small) - marinated and baked in a glaze:
okay! nice and tender, but due to personal preference I don't love glazed fish that much. Our other friends loved it though.

$24 Roast Squab - whole squab roasted, crispy skin, w/ seasoning salt on the side
good! crispy skin indeed and quite juicy. Are we calling MSG = seasoning salt now? It does look quite like MSG, which I have nothing against. To me it's just another form of sodium. The tough thing about squab is it is not always easy to split up. Who gets the leg, the best part?

$26 Steamed Clams & Eggs - steamed with beaten eggs:
good! steamed to a silky consistency

$20 Eggplant w/ Garlic Sauce - eggplant, black fungus, bamboo shoots & scallions sauteed in hot garlic sauce:
good! silky, spicy and flavorful

$8 for 4 bowls of steamed rice, which we shared among 6 people, because we're too cheap to get one bowl of rice per person, but we never finish our rice anyway.

3% SF Mandate is annoying, but nothing new

I guess I am due to let go of the past and admit that R&G has some pretty good dishes. In fact, service this time around was pretty good. Who could remember that nearly 20 years ago, they took nearly an hour to return our credit card, so we can just conclude payment and leave, as if they were holding us hostage? Oops, I guess I do still remember. We're moving on!

R&G Lounge gets two stars from me because the Peking duck experience was really disappointing. For the price and the restaurant‚Äôs reputation, the way the dish came out felt careless.
What went wrong
‚Ä¢	The Peking duck arrived at the table with several pieces already missing, so it looked like a half-finished platter instead of a whole, impressive dish.
‚Ä¢	The duck was not deboned, which made it hard to eat and took away from the enjoyment, especially since Peking duck is usually served in neat, easy-to-wrap slices. Also, the duck arrived at our table as shown in the photo. There seems pieces were missing, I asked our server and was told that this is the way the duck is served. I have never been served a duck in such a way.
‚Ä¢	Given how well-known this place is for special dishes and banquet-style meals, the quality and presentation of the duck fell far below expectations.
Why it‚Äôs two stars, not one
‚Ä¢	The restaurant is a long-standing Chinatown spot with a big menu and a busy, lively dining room, so it clearly can do better than what we were served.
‚Ä¢	Service and other dishes may be fine for some guests, but the mishandled Peking duck turned what should have been a highlight into a letdown, and that‚Äôs hard to overlook.

top_10.name: Spicy King
top_10.address: 65 Waverly Pl, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
testimonials:
Got the mapo tofu and scallion pancakes to split between two, the serving size was large enough we were both sated at the end :)
Food was absolutely delicious

The best Szechuan Chinese we‚Äôve had outside of China! So authentic and full of flavour. It was so good we had lunch once and dinner 3 times over 3 days. If we are ever back in San Francisco we will be back.

The atmosphere was great and the staff were very friendly. However, I was disappointed with the Mala Xiang Guo. It felt like they used low-quality ingredients to save on costs even basic vegetables like bok choy were missing.

top_10.name: Nepa Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 507 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA
testimonials: Jd was the best server, the energy was great love the whole team! One of the best Pokora I‚Äôve had in my life and the balls oh my God, one of the best desserts I‚Äôve had in my Iife!

The food is flavorful, fresh, and well-balanced - rich without being heavy or overly oily. The curries are aromatic, the naan is soft and perfectly cooked.

The service is warm and welcoming, and the atmosphere is relaxed, making it a great place for a casual meal or dining with family and friends.

Their naan breads are huge! Tasty!
The chicken korma is very good, with a lot of chicken.

The spicy level is higher than most Indian restaurants, I ordered super spicy and feel it is a bit too hot for me but I cannot complain üòÖ

top_10.name: Sunset Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 642 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA
testimonials: If you want to feel a family atmosphere with healthy authentic Indian food, this is your place! I ordered the lentil veggie soup with some Dahl. It‚Äôs simply delicious, healthy, comforting to my soul. Namaste
the food was amazing here! we got the chicken chilli and the salmon curry and both were well cooked and flavorful. service was really good! this might just be my new spot for indian

Sunset Indian Cuisine on Irving Street in San Francisco is a welcoming spot for authentic and flavorful Indian dishes. The food is freshly prepared, with well-balanced spices and generous portions that stand out for both taste and quality. The restaurant is clean and casual, the service attentive, and the menu offers a great variety‚Äîperfect for both dine-in and takeout. The waiter here doesn‚Äôt understand English well, make sure you ask them to repeat the order before confirming.

top_10.name: Himalayan Cuisine SF
top_10.address: 1412 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: Came here by chance, and came again two days later because we were so delighted! Such delicious food, very well-priced and generous portions. We sampled quite a bit and can‚Äôt pick our favourite dish! Very friendly and attentive staff! Can‚Äôt wait to come here again üòãü•üü•òü´ì

Good taste, great portions. Had the vegetable samosas which were perfect. The biryani rice included bursts of flavor from chopped vegetables and very tender lamb chunks. Tandoori chicken was tender and juicy. Great mango lassie.

This place has decent prices, but it‚Äôs still slightly higher than you would pay at most Indian places, especially if you compared to other cities with large amounts of Indian restaurants. The food portions are pretty decent and I have to say the food is tasty so at least you get good quality food for the price you pay. The place is a little bit dated, but it is nice overall and the service is pretty good. It‚Äôs nice because it‚Äôs in the neighborhood where you can get other food as well and walk around.

top_10.name: Sewa Nepalese and Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 815 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
testimonials: Beautiful family owned restaurant with authentic dishes. In particular the kale chaat, daal, garlic naan, momos and paneer tikka masala were amazing. The service is great and reminds you of being treated like family. Highly recommend!!

I absolutely love this restaurant. The food is incredible, especially the chili chicken momo‚Äîso delicious and flavorful. My friend took me here, and I‚Äôm so glad she did. The cozy, warm atmosphere makes it even better

The combination of cultural food here is great. Some of the best Indian food I've ever had combined with some unique items from Nepal such as dumplings that seem similar to something you would find at a dim sum restaurant. Overall, the food was outstanding, including high quality sag lamb and great naan bread too.
This is a family restaurant and clearly the people running it care very deeply about providing great service and great food.
Prices are very reasonable too. We had an appetizer, two main courses, and one drink each for a total of $68 before tip.

top_10.name: Trisara
top_10.address: 211 Kearny St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
testimonials: We ordered paneer tikka masala which tasted more like paneer butter masala. We ordered garlic naan and jhol momo which were good in taste. Overall average food taste.

Super friendly service and delicious food! They will do non-spicy if you want, but will add the spice if you do. I stopped here randomly and will be back. They were also super quick with the food which I appreciated.

The food at Trisara Indo-Nepalese Restaurant was overall okay. The fried rice was good, but the noodles and Manchurian had a slightly sweet taste, which took away from the authentic flavor. The mango kulfi didn‚Äôt taste very fresh, which was a bit disappointing. On a positive note, the service was good and attentive. Overall, an average dining experience with room for improvement in authenticity and consistency.

top_10.name: Noe Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 4166 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA
testimonials: The food was too good and the service was also great (Bibek)the server was doing his job so well, the environment in this restaurant is incredible and comfortable I‚Äôll suggest you to go and check once I bet you gonn love their food , service and environment ü§ü

The food was amazingly delicious I ordered momo chili chicken and garlic naan it was very delicious, naan were very crispy and big, staff was cooperative and friendly overall I had very good experience.

Came here without a reservation on a weekend for lunch. We were seated quickly. The samosas were really good. The breads were huge. The curries definitely packed heat. The ice cream cubes to top off the meal were cute, milky, and sweet.

top_10.name: COPPER CHIMNEY INDIAN RESTAURANT
top_10.address: 489a 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
testimonials: Phenomenal all around. Some of the best Indian food I have ever had, best food in general. The Samosas, butter chicken, and lamb curry were amazing. The service is also very wonderful. Will definitely be back!

Copper Chimney offers an authentic taste of Indian cuisine. The flavors were deep, aromatic, and perfectly balanced. The staff was courteous and knowledgeable about the menu. The restaurant has a welcoming vibe. I truly enjoyed every moment of my visit.

Copper Chimney has quickly become one of my favorite Indian restaurants. The flavors are bold yet balanced, and every dish feels thoughtfully prepared. The service was excellent, and the staff genuinely seemed to care about our experience. It‚Äôs a perfect place for both locals and visitors.

top_10.name: Taj Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 5701 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA
testimonials: Finally giving this new(ish) spot in the neighborhood now that they have some time to settle in.  Went with a Chicken Tikka Masala, Rice and some Garlic Naan. Instead of my usual go to Mango Lassi I went with a Salted Lassi. The Salted Lassi was nice and a good balance to the Masala (just know it‚Äôs a salted plain yogurt drink and not sweet like a Mango Lassi is).  Overall impressions of the food and experience is decent. Great Masala Sauce, but unfortunately the chicken was a bit dry and chewy on the day I had it. The Garlic Naan was great and very tasty with the sauce.  Value was ok, but note you have to pay $4 for rice to go with a $16 entree as rice is not included with the entree.. All in all it was a bit of a pricy lunch for one at $32 before tip. My suggestion is to go with a group to share different dishes family style. Decor is pretty basic, but very clean and nice service by staff.

8/20/2025- update:
Still as good as the first time!  The  chick pea veggie fritters were amazing!   So is the curry!  Super yummy!

First time here and I was pleasantly surprised!  Food is very good!   I was wondering why my tea took a bit to get, they brew it and it‚Äôs milk chai.  We had the tandoori salmon and the veggie basmati rice and it was amazing!  Service is good, they are  very nice and the prices are good!  Will definitely be coming back!

We were looking for a good Indian spot before heading home and Taj looked pretty solid so we gave it a shot. Had the lamb chops, Saag Paneer, coconut rice, and garlic Naan. Everything was great the lamb was cooked and seasoned to perfection! They asked about spice level for the Saag Paneer. Very tasty.  They also have a yummy Chai. Really good spot. Ill definitely come again. The service was awesome as well. Really attentive and the vibe and music is great. Loved the fresh flowers on the table.

top_10.name: Diwali Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 1499 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials:
We found this place on a whim and had the most incredible meal at Diwali! The menu showcases a variety of dishes with something for everyone ‚Äî beautifully crisp dosas, tons of flavorful vegetarian options, and plenty of delicious meat dishes for the carnivores in our group.

The dosa was the star for me: paper-thin, perfectly crispy, and served with chutneys and sambar that tasted unbelievably fresh. Every dish we tried was layered with spice and aroma without ever being overwhelming.

Service is warm and welcoming, and the staff really cared about explaining dishes and helping us choose. Portions are generous, prices are fair, and the atmosphere is cozy without feeling crowded. The owner, who is incredibly passionate about sharing the flavors she loves, is so kind and attentive.

Whether you‚Äôre craving comfort food, exploring new flavors, or dining with a mixed group of dietary preferences, this place nails it. We enjoyed it so much that we came back for my husband‚Äòs birthday and tried some new things which all were a hit.

Quite a surprise. Wasn't expecting much given the very generic Indian name, and unusually high ratings on Yelp and Google. However, every single dish was tasty. The service was professional and the ambience, nice.

- Goat chukka dry: Mild spicy, goat was excellently cooked to the point of shredding
- Shrimp curry leaf masala: a little bland to our liking. Could be spiced up a lot with crushed black pepper, and shallow fried onions
- Egg dosa: nice texture, the egg is noticeable, batter felt fresh, chutneys and sambar were above average
- Spicy Bullet Naan: generous dose of butter, soft, and tasty

Street parking can be challenging to find based on time of the day / week.

Overall, works as an option to come back, but likely wouldn't go out of my way to repeat.

AMAZING food, even amazing service. The hosts are so friendly, sweet and welcoming. The chicken 65 and vijaywara chicken biryani is our favourite. We have been here 5 times in 3 weeks already!!
Also the music here is so beautiful, full old Indian songs - reminds me of home every time.

top_10.name: Ocean Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 6127 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA
testimonials: Showed up on a busy Saturday with a full house of people and pick ups. I had the most delicious mango lassi, tandoori mixed plate (salmon, chicken and lamb) and my boyfriend had butter chicken masala. The garlic naan was HUGE! Prices were amazing.

A hidden gem in Richmond neighborhood.  Food is great and price is reasonable.  Service is superb and quick.

Highly recommend the lamb chops. 10/10

Samosa is a little tough.  8/10

They gave us complementary crisp thin Indian bread as appetizer and sweet soup as dessert.

Restaurant itself is very clean and nicely decorated.

Very friendly staff, I have been coming here for a few years already. Food is consistently good, they have the best Butter Chicken Masala and Garlic Naan of every Indian restaurant I have tried! To the point that's now, how I measure if the food is as good at other places. Hands down, best Indian food! The location is not too busy and they stay open later than most restaurants, always a good bite, especially for dinner, when parking is easy around Geary.

top_10.name: La Oaxaque√±a
top_10.address: 2128 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials:
Super yummy and filling meal! As is typical for mission burritos, you get what could honestly be two meals for the price of one.

I got the California burrito with carne asada. The tortilla was excellent. The first few bites were okay but it got better midway through as I got to the cheese and the juicier meat. Unfortunately there was very little pico and avocado, but they didn‚Äôt skimp on the meat at all so I guess it balances out.

The chips and salsa were just okay. I thought I had to pay for them separately but they ended up bringing them out with my burrito anyway.

The Mexican hot chocolate was a winner. Huge size in a stylish cup. Just make sure you don‚Äôt burn your tongue so you can taste the rest of your meal! :)

Service was quick and easy. Pay at the counter. Credit card is fine. Music and atmosphere are great. Probably too loud if you want to have an intimate conversation but just right if you‚Äôre hoping to kick back.

I absolutely loved this place. I went there for lunch on a Saturday and when I got, I was able to find a a table, but just after 15 minutes, it got filled up completely, and there was a line to get a table.

The restaurant itself is pretty small and intimate, and it has a lot of very colourful decoration, which makes you feel like you in some carnival.

I want to try a bunch of things. Everything was fresh and they told me that it would take up to 20 minutes to make my food, which was such a refreshing change from places that pre-cook your food. I was more than happy to wait.

I got the tamales first. This was my first time having a actual tamale outside of the trader Joes frozen one, and it was so good. I was taken a bag by the beans and potatoes with the chicken filling, but it was so hot with the two salsas. Also, it was steaming hot.

I also got the quesa birra as that is one of my favourite things to get, and this one was honestly above average. The taco could be Chris up better, and the feeling could be a little more generous, but the taste was on point.

The last thing I got was the papusa and again, this was my first time trying one, so I am not sure if this was a good one, but it was very tasty. It was hot and hearty went well with the pickled vegetables.

The host was so nice and welcoming and made me feel really comfortable with the menu that I was largely unfamiliar with.

I will definitely be back and bring more people.

Hands down the most delicious food ever. Super burritos that were giant and tacos that were absolutely beautiful.  I can't eat tortillas so I asked if I could have lettuce wrapped tacos and the happily accommodated me ! The guacamole was tasty too ! Everything was so delicious we went back and got more before heading to the airport. We might fly back just to get more food. I really want to try the jackfruit tacos.

top_10.name: Cantina Los Mayas
top_10.address: 431 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
testimonials: Loved everything we ordered. The quesadilla was slightly under-seasoned but the meat was incredibly tender. The flan was also delicious.

I came for brunch 10a- 1:30p Sat and Sun- wonderful food, everything is made in house.
Theyre open for dinner with a really nice quite extensive Mexican wine menu.  Come eat and enjoy.  5th Ave & balboa across from Cinderella

Cantina Los Mayas was really good. The waiters and chef were genuinely kind, friendly, and welcoming, and the overall vibe made the experience even better. Portions are big and the prices are very budget-friendly, so it felt like great value.

We started with the ceviche‚Äîit was spicy, but super balanced with a fresh pineapple-lime flavor that made it bright and refreshing. We also ordered the queso fundido, and it was a highlight: a creamy, milky blend of cheeses with chorizo, and I loved the little candle underneath that kept it warm the whole time.

For my main dish, I got the mariscos served in a pineapple. It hit that perfect sweet-and-spicy combo, and the two roasted shrimp were honestly so delicious. I just wish it came with a few more shrimp, but overall the rest of the seafood was filling and satisfying.

The only thing I was expecting a bit more from was the salsas‚ÄîI hoped for stronger flavor and more heat. That said, they were still good.

Also, the location is great and easy to find, and parking nearby was pretty easy, which made the whole night even smoother.

top_10.name: Taqueria Los Mayas
top_10.address: 331 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
testimonials: First time here, definitely not my last! Enjoyed a delicious super breakfest burrito with chips. Salsa bar provides variety and convenience. Reasonably priced, the burrito itself was $15! To top it off the staff is super friendly and respectful!

The 2nd and 3rd visits were as satisfying as the 1st. We tried Taqueria Los Mayas several months ago. We ordered different dishes but both had mole which was memorable. Months later, I remembered how delicious the mole was and ordered it in the burrito bowl.

The dish was aesthetically pleasing and colorful: against the dark mole were crumbles of queso surrounded by purple pickled onions, red rice, greens, black beans, and sprinkles of sesame seeds.

On the 3rd visit, I tried the breakfast burrito. The eggs were perfectly scrambled and the potatoes were comforting. My hubby ordered the tortilla soup - fitting for a cold day - and the fish tacos, which he enjoyed very much. The fish was fresh and sauteed with a slight crisp.

Almost every dish came with tortilla chips. There's a salsa bar with 3 salsas, one green (mild), one orange with mango (mild and our favorite), and one hot.

Will be back soon to have something with mole.

This was our second time visiting Taquer√≠a Los Mayas, and we had a great experience. Lupita, who was working the cashier, greeted us with a big smile and made us feel very welcome from the moment we walked in. She was incredibly friendly and took the time to explain a few dishes we had never tried before, which really helped us know what to expect. She even let us sample the aguas frescas so we could choose our favorite‚Äîsuch a thoughtful touch.

We visited on a Tuesday, which happened to be Taco Tuesday, and we ordered four carne asada tacos, a burrito, and a panucho. Everything was absolutely delicious. We also ordered a michelada, and we highly recommend it‚Äîthe mix was super tasty and well balanced.

We also appreciated how clean and well-maintained the restaurant was. Overall, we had a wonderful experience, thanks in large part to Lupita‚Äôs excellent customer service. We will definitely be coming back!

top_10.name: El Buen Comer
top_10.address: 3435 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials: Our lunch was incredible! Highly recommend the torta and the huarache. Everyone who works there is great too. Cant wait to go back!

We are lucky this place is just a short walk from our house. It‚Äôs as good as it gets. Mole and chile relleno are my favorites but never had a bad bite. This place deserves all the recognition it gets. Consistently great every time we go.

My wife and I come here whenever we‚Äôre craving truly authentic Mexican food, the kind you‚Äôd find in Mexico City or Oaxaca. We usually split the Tacos de Tinga to start, then go for Mole con Pollo, Enchiladas, and/or Pozole Verde. We‚Äôve tried plenty of other dishes, but these are the ones we always come back to. They are amazing!

top_10.name: Tacos El Patron
top_10.address: 1500 S Van Ness Ave #100, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials: One of the best Al Pastor Tacos I‚Äôve had in all of California! The meat quality and proportion of the tacos are üíØ and the free sides (grilled onions are our fav) are cherries top! Amazing local gem!

When I say these are the BEST birria tacos I have EVER had I am not exaggerating. The beef was cooked perfectly and was tender and juicy. Consomme had a lovely umami and rich flavor. The salsas were made in house, cold, and refreshing. My agua fresca was definitely a bit too sweet but that‚Äôs probably how it‚Äôs supposed to be. Will absolutely be back next time I‚Äôm in the Mission district.

I‚Äôm born and raised in Boston, and I thought we had some pretty decent Mexican food here, but boy was I wrong. I was visiting SF and a coworker recommended Tacos El Patron to me. I‚Äôm glad I made the journey here because I think it‚Äôs the best Mexican food I‚Äôve ever had. I think it‚Äôs ruined my enjoyment of Mexican food at home, because now I know what I‚Äôm missing out on‚Ä¶I will forever compare everything I eat in MA, to this restaurant in SF.

Of course, in MA we don‚Äôt have the same choice and variety as you do in CA, but still! Everything was 10x more flavorful than what I‚Äôve had at home in Massachusetts. The portion sizes are also great - usually I‚Äôm used to having to order 2 or 3 tacos or a couple tamales to be satisfied. But just one taco or tamale here is a pretty big portion (for me at least!). The horchata was also incredible! The birria tamale is so cool - it‚Äôs a must try for sure! I also had a birria taco and a taco al pastor with carne asada - also very good choices. The salsa that comes with the chips is also very flavorful, and actually a bit spicy. Nothing too hot for me, but I was surprised because in Massachusetts the free salsa is always zero spice hahaha. What a great place - I can‚Äôt wait to come back here again on my next trip to SF.

top_10.name: Lol√≥
top_10.address: 974 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
