testimonials: Their sauces and dressings are good. Fried avocado tacos are great with the habanero aioli. Young coconut appetizer was good if you like sour lemony sauce. Sweet Potato would have been better if it were baked or maybe bbqed - the dressing is good. Cauliflower tacos were good. Chiles Rellenos was okay - it felt too oily.

This is the second time we visited and definitely loved it like the first time. The ambiance is great, food excellent and the servers warm and welcoming. The tacos are very fresh and tasty. The enchiladas well prepared and heat salsa options to go along with it. The churros were perfect with the chocolate dip. Usually very busy so made a reservation before heading there. Definitely recommend the place for a cozy dinner.

This is the second time we come and unfortunately we were rushed out in slightly over 1hr.

We had a reservation at 7:30pm on a Friday night, got seated at 7:40pm and by 8:40pm we were out.

The server didn‚Äôt even offer dessert or other drinks. The check was on the table as soon as we finished our plates and they checked every 2min if we had put our card. The whole service dynamic felt off.

Ambiance is fun, margaritas were great.
Fish tacos were very good, the mole enchiladas lacked flavor.

top_10.name: Papito
top_10.address: 1457 18th St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
testimonials:
Stopped by after dropping off a friend at airport. Guacamole ü•ë was fresh with great added flavor. The shrimp üç§ enchilada WOW. Amazing flavors that cream was over the top.

The only thing I didn‚Äôt like what the too tall stools lol üòÇ don‚Äôt you hate that!

Papito in San Francisco is a cozy, welcoming spot with a menu that balances flavor, freshness, and creativity. The overall service was attentive and friendly, making the dining experience smooth from start to finish. The staff checked in often enough to make sure everything was good, but without being overbearing, which always makes a difference.
When it comes to the food, everything we tried was impressive. I had the Vegetariano, which was hearty, flavorful, and satisfying without being too heavy ‚Äî a great choice for anyone looking for a tasty meat-free option. The chicken tacos were another favorite, perfectly seasoned and well-portioned, not greasy or overloaded with toppings. Their quesadillas stood out as well: they had the right amount of cheese and filling, balanced and not overly stuffed, which kept them delicious without feeling overwhelming.
The drinks complemented the food perfectly. The spicy mango drink had just the right kick of heat to balance the sweetness, making it super refreshing and unique. Along with a few beers, the overall mix kept the meal fun and flavorful.
Papito does a great job of keeping things authentic yet approachable, offering a dining experience that feels both elevated and casual. Between the good service, satisfying food, and unique drink options, it‚Äôs definitely a spot worth revisiting when craving Mexican food in the city

Great place to bring friends, family or even a date.  Most of the food and drinks my friends and I ordered were delicious. The only entree that I didn't enjoy was their fajitas, they were under seasoned and lacked flavor. Definitely have to order the calamari, that red sauce is soo good üòÅ. The Al Pastor torta was packed with flavor and the fried chicken nachos were different in a good and delicious way. Service was good, but keep in mind that the restaurant is on the small side so there may be a bit of a wait for larger parties. Definitely coming back again!

top_10.name: La Taqueria
top_10.address: 2889 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials: I‚Äôm from NYC and I‚Äôve had a lot of great Mexican food at home but this was unlike anything I‚Äôve tried before and very delicious and filling. The carne asada tacos were tasty and the chicken quesadilla was so flavorful! Would highly recommend checking it out if you‚Äôre visiting SF

Came here twice, two different times on a weekend. Always a long line. There is a long long wait. Average about an hour long. Easy set up. Pay for what you want and seat where they tell you. No seats if you ask for to go. Remember that!  You may sit with others if you are on a long table. There are some big group tables but might have to wait a bit. They do serve beer but no cocktails. Their portions are very generous. Had their regular taco carne asado. Can't image how big the super tacos are?? I love their burritos dorado style. No rice in their burritos so it doesn't make you super full. Love it! Crispy in the outside of the tortillas. Can't really ask to customize anything. Love their green spicy sauce and it's available on the table when you eat. You can buy the bottle as well. Very decent prices. Service is decent. Would come here again but can't come here when I am starving.

I finally had the chance to taste what is arguably the most famous burrito in all of SF. I went close to noon on weekday, and the queue was about 15 minutes long. The line moves incredibly fast, and before I knew I was already placing my order. I got the burrito they are known for which is their carne asada super burrito. I got it toasted. You place your order at the front, and then you go inside and pay your bill, and then you wait for them to call your number. The inside of the restaurant is packed, and often you will be sharing your table with other Diners, making it a very communal form of dining. My burrito took about 10 minutes to arrive, and it was probably the best burrito I have ever eaten. It wasn‚Äôt as hefty as other burritos, given the lack of rice, which gives it volume, but the meat was so tender, the beans were so well seasoned, and the sour cream, and the guac was so creamy. This was such a satisfying burrito and also the perfect portion size for one person.

I will definitely be back, but I also want to try some other burritos in the neighbourhood.

top_10.name: Taqueria Cancun
top_10.address: 2288 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials: Excellent tacos and quesadillas! The outside looks a bit like a hole in the wall but the inside is super colorful and lively, and the salsa is always a little bit more spicy than you think. The portion sizes are also pretty generous- a single taco is really heaped enough for two tacos

First time coming here and it was great. Service is fast and to the point. Its a little on the spendier side for a burrito but it's 2025 so im not mad. The chips are thicc bois and the salsa is too. Can't wait to come back and try more meat options. Also the tortillas are like... crazy good.
Clean food, decent quantity. Taste could be better. Didn't like guacamole, came like a green fine paste. Tried Super Veggie Burrito. Limited seating.

top_10.name: Puerto Alegre
top_10.address: 546 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials: Had a great burrito here. They did a great job keeping the chips and salsa available on the table as well. Margs were expensive, expected in SF, but still tasty. The live band played some fun music as well were eating.

Puerto Alegre has been around a long time and with good reason. The food is solid, service is excellent. Had the Chile Verde Pork House Special. Comes with 3 warm tortillas, beans, rice, salad and stewed pork. Everything was delicious, good portion of the pork meat. Service was really spot on, didn't have to ask for anything. The atmosphere is definitely old school Mission District. First time I ate here was in 1995, other than the prices it hasn't changed at all. Did I mention they serve big pitchers of margaritas! People go bananas here with the margaritas. When it's really busy it can be difficult getting a table. You might have to wait 30-60 minutes to be seated. Overall great experience at Puerto Alegre, I highly recommend this business

The customer service is A+

I personally can not agree and enjoy a meal with dogs in the booths next to me, under the tables, sitting in the doorway - it feels uncomfortable unsanitary.  The dogs were quiet except one barking one.

Differently Pet Friendly

Glad I came once.

I took the food to go.

top_10.name: Daeho Kalbijim & Beef Soup
top_10.address: 1620 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
testimonials:
We went here on a Friday night at 7pm and waited roughly 1hr 15mins for a table of 2.

Ordered the Regular size premium Kalbijjim and it was amazing!  The portion was huge and they do not skimp out on the beef. We love that there was also stewed radish, potato, carrot and rice cakes inside. The flavour was delicious and very much worth the wait!
The banchan was good and free refill. Kimchi, radish not too spicy or salty. Service was fast and efficient give how busy they were.

Delicious galbijjim with a modern twist and some showmanship. I always bring visitors here as it‚Äôs a great spot to have a family style meal. The galbijjim is delicious, keeping true to the classic dish while adding melted cheese on top for richness and a fire torch show for your IG story post. The banchans are good, and the other dishes are good too, but get the galbijjim to share between 2-4 people. It‚Äôs not the cheapest though so expect to spend $50 per person and potentially a wait during busy hours.

I‚Äôve gone tomorrow Daeho a bunch of time and my last trip there was really did me in.  I‚Äôm probably not going back to this location because it‚Äôs really gone downhill.  The only thing good was we were seated immediately during a Thursday night dinner.  After that everything was really lackluster.  Sure it‚Äôs hustling and bustling with people but after ordering a large kalbijim with squid and extra meat, cheese and glass noodles that should have been more than enough for 3 we waited a long time for our food.  Our side dishes came out quick along with our rice. The food didn‚Äôt come out for about 20 mins so our rice was cold by the time we started eating.  They were trying to be efficient but timing was way off.  When our kalbijjim arrived it was full of potatoes and a sad amount of meat was in our pot that should have had extra meat.  The whole dish was over sauced and salty and really not enjoyable.  I tried to flag someone down but they were all so busy hey just kept saying one minute or be back.  I gave up.  I was so disappointed that I couldn‚Äôt wait to leave.  I have been to Daeho numerous times and even to the San Mateo location.  I didn‚Äôt think it could have been so bad.  Time to move on.  Others can continue enjoying Daeho but I‚Äôll go to other locations and restaurants who offer the same but at better quality and service.

Posted the video of our meal where looks can be deceiving.  Piled high with veggies under there.  Squid rings and a few pieces of beef, no bones included.

top_10.name: SAN HO WON
top_10.address: 2170 Bryant St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials:
We‚Äôre very excited about this place, and it didn‚Äôt disappoint!

We sat at the bar counter which you could see the kitchen, it‚Äôs kinda cool and has that chill vibes perfect for a date night.

We had beef tartare and egg souffl√© as appetizers, I wish the beef tartare has a bit more acidity in it, also lacks creativity in the seasoning. Egg souffl√© was pretty impressive, the spicy anchovy broth that goes with it was really good.

We ordered galbi and beef tongue as main along with rice. Meat texture was excellent, yet it would be better if there are some variations in marinate.

Dessert was impressive, it‚Äôs structured like a tiramisu but with korean ingredients and flavors in it, very well balanced and perfect end to the meal.

Service was okay, for a Michelin restaurant I expect more interactions with servers. Several servers also seemed not very knowledgable about the menu and dishes.

Overall pretty good value for the quality of food, recommended!

The food was amazing! We were celebrating my partner‚Äôs birthday, and the team made the experience even more special. We also have shellfish and dairy allergies, and they went above and beyond ‚Äî they modified dishes and even provided us with a separate menu to fit our needs. Everything we ordered was delicious. We had the glazed short ribs, BBQ prime ribs, white rice, and the beef potstickers ‚Äî all SO good! They also serve a lovely tea at the end, which was such a nice touch.

And I have to mention ‚Äî the bathroom is insane. So beautiful and such a vibe.

Overall worth the hype, definitely amongst the top KBBQ spots in the US, and the price reflects the food quality and good service. Definitely love to go back and try the very popular galbi and egg souffl√©
+ Amazing food. I absolutely loved the tofu banchan, and the other 2 banchans were also quite nice. Jebi churi and kochi skewers were both flavorful and cooked to perfection. And the housemade samjang sauce was a great pairing with the grilled meat. Kimchi jjigae was tasty but a little too sour for me. And the black sesame soft serve was an incredible end to the dinner. The sundae looked simple but there were bits of chocolate, black sesame and huckleberry jam buried underneath the soft serve, making every bite super interesting and different (with minimal mess at that!)
- All the food was mostly fatty, salty and sweet forward. It‚Äôd be great to have something fresh and/or sour to cut through. I‚Äôd absolutely recommend ordering ssam/salad and more sour kimchi to eat with the grilled meat
+/- Decent service and atmosphere. They were quite busy so it might take a while to flag down a staff. Loved that they have hooks and cubicles to place belongings right next to your table
= Definitely try to make a reservation, or wait like 2+ hours for a table as they are very popular

top_10.name: Cocobang
top_10.address: 550 Taylor St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials: Food was delicious. Service was excellent. Place is small, three booth and about five 2 seat tables. Kiosk waiting list when it gets busy.

Delicious food, amazing atmosphere and great service. Highly recommend. The food was sweet and spicy and savory just made you happy to be there and experience what Korean food can offer to your tastebuds.

Super tasty late night dinner place! No reservation so we waited around 30 minutes to get a table. Service and atmosphere was okay, very busy vibes around the time we ate (8PM).

Food was so delicious and filling for the price! The corn cheese was so good and cheesy, it went well with everything. The kimchi fried rice was also delicious and all the ingredients came together perfectly. The BBQ combo is the best deal for the price and the meat was flavorful and tender, with an extra bowl of white rice to go with it. I would recommend ordering any of these items because they were all so tasty! We still had leftovers too.

Overall, I would definitely recommend coming here for a cheap, tasty, late night dinner. I do wish there was some dessert on the menu though!

top_10.name: Brothers Restaurant
top_10.address: 4128 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
testimonials: A great Korean restaurant in the city! They make their own fermented soy bean, so their stew is amazing. The best quality marinated KBBQ place I‚Äôve been to around town! Owner is also super friendly.

We got the tasting menu for 2. Perfect portion size and really good quality meat. The spicy tofu soup and the spicy pork were a standout. The wood used in the barbeque is also excellent. Amazing staff and amazing service.

I knew from the moment I stepped into this restaurant it was going to be awesome. The air was smoky, the food smelt incredible and the atmosphere was lively.

We cooked the meat at the table on coal, and there were heaps of complimentary sides that were amazing. Everything was delicious, I can‚Äôt wait to go back!

Highly recommend this place!

top_10.name: Surisan
top_10.address: 505 Beach St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials:
Wow! Everything hit the perfect note

The Galbi-Jimm Benedict was succulent and melts in your mouth

The ricotta pancake might be the best pancakes I've tried in the city, and the Vermont maple syrup is chefs kiss

But mostly importantly, everyone is extremely friendly, amazing service
Pleasant experience and very accommodating staff. The food was fantastic, filling, and reasonably priced. I strongly recommend the Korean tacos and ube latte üëåüèΩ

Went here for brunch. Ordered millionaires bacon - nothing special, candied bacon. Beef short rib benedict, braised pork belly rice, 1 americano, 1 cappucino  - total 110 including tip. I enjoyed my meal, i found the experience overpriced.

top_10.name: Mashita Galbi Jjim
top_10.address: 2123 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: I had a really nice experience. Everything was fast and delicious, even during rush hour. The atmosphere was super chill, and the bathroom was very clean!

It‚Äôs my first time here today, my mom and I are both very satisfied with our impromptu dinner. We ordered the Galbi Jjim in medium spicy. The portion is very generous, the standard serving already included cheese, rice cake, glass noodles, and plenty of radish-carrots-potatoes! The meat was tender and flavorful, perfectly cooked and served on a cold winter night. We had leftover for another meal. ‚úåüèº

Genuinely excellent and a serious rival to Daeho( without the crazy wait times!). The short ribs are braised to "fall-off-the-bone" perfection and served in massive, bubbling portions. Comes with a standard, generous cheese topping that is torched table-side for that signature smoky, gooey finish.

top_10.name: 707 Sutter
top_10.address: 707 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: I‚Äôm in town for a convention and came to 707 Sutter for some late night dinner. It‚Äôs a cozy little place with nice ambiance and great service. I got the Fried wings w/soy garlic and Beef dumplings. Everything was incredibly fresh and delicious, even an hour before closing. They brought this delightful appetizer platter out and it was ALL delicious! Then the dumplings were crispy but tender inside and the wings were crunchy and perfect. 10/10 loved it! üòã

Overall, the food was decent and the prices felt reasonable for what you get. The bibim mandu had a lot of vegetables, so it felt light and refreshing‚Äîalmost like eating a salad, which I liked. The stir-fried squid was pretty good too. I ate half there and took the rest home to turn it into fried rice, and it actually tasted even better that way.

The gamjatang hot pot, however, was a bit disappointing. Instead of sigeumchi greens, it had kimchi in it, and the broth was oddly thick and gritty because there was way too much perilla powder. The pork also had a noticeable smell, probably because it seemed to have been pre-boiled and refrigerated before serving. It almost felt like they added extra perilla powder to cover that smell.

Hellllll yea! This place is great. The food is delicious the service is very friendly and pleasant. Highlight for me was the seafood pancake and the soft tofu soup ü§§. Also the soy garlic wings we loved and the corn cheese! The banchans were great too!

We stumbled on this pace while on the area and hungry and we will definitely be back!

top_10.name: Manna
top_10.address: 845 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA
testimonials:
You may need to wait in line in the evenings, but it‚Äôs absolutely delicious.
I also recommend having classic soju with the food.

Great food, good for family style and decent portions. Overall I‚Äôd recommend the dumpling soup and soft tofu soup. Decently prices but it‚Äôs walk in only. Expect a wait! There‚Äôs indoor and outdoor seating.
Tofu soup is bomb - so soft and soup is so soothing. Definitely my place for comfort food. Ordered their grilled beef too, it was nice.

top_10.name: Han Il Kwan
top_10.address: 1802 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA
testimonials:
The best Korean food I had in the Bay Area. Great portion for the BBQ, every dish is so flavorful, I absolutely love everything including the free small dishes.

Just be aware it‚Äôs kind of hard to find parking in the residential area.

The food was great‚Äîespecially the Korean BBQ, which I really enjoyed. The service was good overall, but I wish we had a bit more attention from the waiter. At one point I wanted to order more food, but the waiter wasn‚Äôt around. I‚Äôd recommend ordering everything you want right away. Still, the food itself was very good and worth it.

I have visited here many times, usually when I am in the area where I am craving for some good Korean food. Most of the times when I arrive there is a wait with multiple parties ahead of me, but I do not mind since I am a very patient person. The food and service is good here, so I understand why it is always busy and packed here. You can choose to have either their Korean barbecue dishes or their traditional authentic Korean items. Their menu consists of shareable items, soups, stir fry dishes, and much more delicious items. The staffs here are welcoming, well trained and understanding where I never encountered any issues during any of my visits. If you are not in the mood in waiting then I recommend you making a reservation if available. I highly recommend this place to all Korean food enthusiasts, to all Korean barbecue lovers, or if you just want to try something new. I definitely will be back to tryout the other delicious options they have to offer.

top_10.name: The Korner Store Bites & Vibes
top_10.address: 4516 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94112, USA
testimonials:
Such a unique place to enjoy best class delicious Korean food & drinks with music & dance lounge vibes. I enjoyed both authentic & creative Korean dishes and lesser-known premium Korean drinks.
So much fun!!!

The Korner Store is a private event space now. I sent an inquiry in for a Saturday night booking, and received prompt response with a quote and some options. There's a minimum food and drink amount. I coordinated a walk through of the space and made a deposit!

The hosts and owners (Ina and Nick) are incredibly helpful throughout the booking and night of the event. My ~40 guests enjoyed the Korean food and full bar. We had a fantastic time in the private space. The venue has tv screens, music inputs, DJ and dance area,  karaoke, and an optional photobooth. I highly recommend considering The Korner Store for your next event.

So I was lucky enough to give this place a try during a closed event hosted by the Seoul sisters and the Hoo Lee Gans.    Pretty cool vibe and atmosphere when you walk in.  Extensive drink list and pretty skilled bartenders tend to your thirsty soul while the home cooked Korean style street food dishes caress your belly.  As it was a closed event , the food was a buffet style, help yourself and gubble it up style.  Regardless the food was spot on.  I really enjoyed the onion pancake.  This dish is as simple as it looks it is actually rather tricky to make.  The popcorn chicken was tender, the kimchi zesty yet firm and tender.
I suggest you give it a try and work yourself through their menu.

top_10.name: Piccolo Forno
top_10.address: 725 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: I was lucky to grab an outside table before the lunch rush fully hit. The restaurant quickly got busy but felt I still received good service. Food was delicious and staff was responsive. Would definitely stop by again when I‚Äôm in SF.

After our trip to Alcatraz and an afternoon of shopping at the Wharf, we worked up quite an appetite and decided to try Piccolo Forno. The restaurant is small and cozy, and as many have mentioned, there was a bit of a wait since we arrived later in the evening, but we didn‚Äôt mind at all. The incredible aromas coming from the kitchen made it worth it.

Our table ordered a great variety of dishes including pizza col salame, lasagna classica, ravioli di zucca, pappardelle al rag√π, and ravioli di aragosta. For dessert, my friend enjoyed the cannolo siciliano. Overall, the food was delicious, comforting, and clearly made with care.

Service was friendly overall. There was a small hiccup when I was initially served the wrong dish. When I mentioned it, there was some confusion as I was told it was what I had ordered. However, my group did hear my order, and as a vegetarian, the dish I received wasn‚Äôt something I could eat. That said, this didn‚Äôt negatively affect our experience. The rest of the staff were very accommodating, and the owner handled the situation
wonderfully, which we truly appreciated.

I don‚Äôt enjoy confrontation and never want to make an issue, but I felt the way the situation was resolved spoke volumes about their professionalism and care for guests. We left full, happy, and satisfied and would absolutely return.

This place was fantastic. When there are so many solid options for Italian in this area, piccolo doesn‚Äôt disappoint.
My wife has a pine nut allergy and they were confident in making sure she didn‚Äôt get cross contamination.
We got pepperoni pizza, dough is amazing. Pizza sauce is top notch. Lasagna was so good. The bolognese was what dreams are made of.
Food was excellent service equally matched. Will totally visit again.

top_10.name: Seven Hills
top_10.address: 1896 Hyde St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: This restaurant deserves five stars‚Äìand then some. Between the dim, intimate, lighting, attentive service, and truly fabulous food, there was nothing more we could have asked for. The complimentary bread arrived warm and pillowy soft. The autumn breeze mocktail was a beautiful study in balance, with ginger delicately offset by pomegranate. The agnolotti was playful and smart; when I punctured the cheerfully green pillows of pasta, the chicken filling revealed itself ‚Äì creamy, inviting, and every bit as delicious as it looked. The market fish was earthy and impeccably cooked, fresh and silky with a gorgeous char. Its tender texture was perfectly balanced by the comforting starchiness of the rice. The squid ink lobster pasta was bold, unexpected, and deeply satisfying. The affogato seemed to evaporate on the tongue, leaving behind nothing but pure flavor. Our server, Kim Thi , was animated and graceful, adding warmth and ease to an already exceptional evening. This is a place that deserves to be lavishly praised!

In writing this review, my only disappointment is that I can‚Äôt give them six stars! From the moment we walked in, we were welcomed as if we were old family friends from our hostess. She gently showed us into a waiting area and showed us the previews of the menus. Less than three minutes later on a very busy Saturday night,we were seated at a very comfortable table.

Once we are seated, our wait person Dereck brought us still and sparkling water. we ordered a bottle of bubbles to start our dinner adventure.

After reviewing the menu with us and explaining the specials, we moved onto the first course. To in our party shared the meatballs, which they raved about‚Ä¶ My wife had the prosciutto salad, which was a very generous portion‚Ä¶ And I had the raw fish crudo of amberjack from Hawaii. Marvelous!

Our main courses were an assortment of their housemaid pastas‚Ä¶one pappardelle, one tagliatelle, one maccheroncelli and The squid ink pasta with lobster special. These were prepared and presented with perfection. Dereck did a wonderful job in guiding us through our dining experience.

We did score a couple of delicious desserts, one of which being a chocolate budino and the other was the bread pudding.. I had a hard time sharing the budino..It was so good.

Thanks to Alexis For stopping by and greeting our table.

Comfortable atmosphere, attentive service, some of the best pasta we‚Äôve had this side of Italy‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs hard to beat this. Our family was thrilled and couldn‚Äôt stop talking about it.Thanks again to all the staff, and we look forward to coming back to sample more items of your menu.

My friend and I made a reservation for here, it was mid. Our waiter was nice. They informed me that I wasn‚Äôt able to modify my meal. I tried their food anyway. The presentation of the food was boring and the pasta my friend had was watery. Their lasagna has no unique flavor. How can you tell me I‚Äôm not able to modify my meal and your meal still lacks quality and flavor? If you like bland food with low vibrational energy this is the place for you. When you walk in the door you should leave an impression on your guest. This place needs to do better. How do you have an Italian restaurant with no Caesar salad?

top_10.name: Trattoria Contadina
top_10.address: 1800 Mason St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: Service was spectacular and the food was great. Esteban is an amazing bartender and the staff make you feel right at home!
Had a very yummy dinner here. The service was good, the food was excellent. I enjoyed all the dishes I ordered. The affogato at the end was a great way to end my night.

I had a great experience at this cozy Italian restaurant. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with a charmingly rustic feel, complete with a well-stocked bar and string lights that give it a homey, comfortable vibe. The service was friendly and attentive without being overbearing, and our waiter was helpful with the menu.

The real standout of the meal, and something you can tell from the photos, is the sheer size of the portions. They don't mess around! I ordered a pasta dish topped with a generous amount of fresh basil and what looked like burrata or a similar creamy cheese. My friend's spaghetti with a huge, impressive-looking meatball was also massive, and the clams in white wine sauce were abundant and delicious. You definitely get your money's worth here, and you'll likely have leftovers.

For dessert, we had a simple but delicious bowl of vanilla ice cream with chocolate syrup. It was the perfect way to cap off a very filling meal. I highly recommend giving this place a try.

top_10.name: The Italian Homemade Company
top_10.address: 1919 Union St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA
testimonials: Excellent service all around. Delicious pasta and so many great choices of sauces to choose from! Thanks to all the staff. Everyone was super friendly. 10/10 would come again! Thank you!

I always love coming back to The Italian Homemade Company for their amazing lasagna and excellent coffee. Every time I‚Äôm in San Francisco, this is my go-to place for a great meal. The food is consistently delicious, the atmosphere is warm, and the service is always friendly. Highly recommended!

The pasta here was excellent. I ordered the pappardelle with a white cream sauce, which was good, don‚Äôt get me wrong, but after a few bites, the heaviness of all the cheese started to weigh me down. The meat ravioli with Bolognese, on the other hand, was fantastic. The richness of the filling was perfectly balanced by the slight tartness of the tomato sauce, which cut through the heaviness beautifully. I‚Äôd love to come back to try their pesto sauce next time, it sounds like a lighter, flavorful option.

top_10.name: Acquerello
top_10.address: NEAR VAN NESS &, 1722 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials:
Fantastic experience! And considering what we have paid for other Michelin experiences, the value is here- especially for a 2-star restaurant in San Francisco.

Overall, every dish hit the mark except one diner didn‚Äôt care for the Ridged Pasta (too sweet)- though this diner happily finished it for them.

Service was impeccable and the atmosphere was fun yet relaxing.

Wine pairing was on point as well with an extremely knowledgeable sommelier.

Overall- just an excellent experience and well worth a visit.

We came here to try out its tasting menu.  The cooking is excellent.  These dishes exceeded our expectations and left a long lasting memory to us: Wolfe ranch quail, Ridge pasta with faux four gras, Millbrook venison and Pear crema.   The restaurant environment is traditional and classy.  The service is outstanding.  I would recommend it for special occasions or you just want to enjoy a spectacular Italian dinner at San Francisco.

ok TLDR super lovely vibes & main courses were BOMB but dessert and service disappointed for a 2 michelin.

i‚Äôll start w the positives.  fav dishes: the amuse bouche was so unique and i loved.  hokkaido scallop was so fresh and had a decadent sauce.  foie gras pasta is probably the best pasta ive ever had in my life.  so creamy rich and the freshest truffles.  and the quail was so tender and caramelized and idk how they made the parsnip so flavorful. crudo was also v fresh and good.  the duck caramelle was super unique and i didnt know fig could pair w pasta so well

i personally wasnt super impressed w the venison.  they said medium rare but the inside wasnt warm but the flavor with the jam and stuff was actually pretty good.

the pear crema literally tasted like pear apple sauce with a cream on the outside idk not my cup of tea.  the tiny tiramisu they brought for pedros bday was infinitely better.  the bon bon cart was super fun but i tried 5 of them and they were all just bad except the black sesame caramel was fire.

the service‚Ä¶.i actually really like a long meal but it toon them 30 mins to bring the first course which is a bit excessive.  4 hour meal for 9 courses is kinda wild like ive had 22 course meals be shorter.  ALSO i think we just got a new server but he was so nervous, stumbling over his words and we caught that he explained a lot of stuff completely wrong bc he brought out the cheese plate and after tasting them we were like uhhh whatever he said was the goat cheese was clearly the pecorino and the jams tasted nothing like what he said and after listening to the other server explain at the other table, we realized that a lot of the things he said were very different.  we laughed about it but thinking now like when ur paying $750 for a meal part of what youre paying for is the excellence of service which just wasnt there (i feel like a snob but).

overall, the food is 2 michelin level but im surprised theyve kept both stars w the service we received

top_10.name: La Ciccia
top_10.address: 291 30th St, San Francisco, CA 94131, USA
testimonials: Excellent time. Service was nice - tried very hard to keep up, place was a little understaffed. Food was authentically Sardinian which was awesome. Delicious seafood. Great time overall. Loved the food

The food is quite good, especially the octopus stew and gnocchi. I would strongly recommend making a reservation in the main dining room. We ate at the back patio and it‚Äôs not a similar experience. We had to scrounge up our own utensils, ask for plates, and try to find someone for water refills.

I rarely leave negative reviews because I understand how important positive feedback is for small businesses. However, our recent experience was disappointing.

The server‚Äôs attitude felt disrespectful from the start. He questioned whether we were comfortable with the wine prices in a way that made us feel uncomfortable. He also described a special as having a ‚Äúbolognese-like sauce,‚Äù but when I referred to it as ‚Äúbolognese pasta,‚Äù he abruptly stated that they did not have bolognese pasta, which was confusing given his earlier description.

What concerned me most was his behavior toward my daughter. She was quietly drawing on the back of the receipt when he took the pen from her abruptly, without asking. She was visibly embarrassed by the interaction.

We spoke with the owner, whom we like and respect, but unfortunately the experience left a negative impression. For that reason, we will not be returning.

top_10.name: The Italian Homemade Company
top_10.address: 716 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: Cozy restaurant. Can see the stove and the cooks making the pasta as it is made. Happy hour for house wine and beer is good. Was a little pricier than I thought it was gonna be (pay for pasta and sauce separately, closer to ~$20).

I have been here a few times before. The food (and the vibe!) is always good and the staff is always nice. They make their pasta from scratch next door, so it tastes fresh and tasty. The gnocchi are just chewy enough.

HOWEVER, I personally think it‚Äôs a bit pricey for the portion you‚Äôd get. That‚Äôs why I don‚Äôt come here too often. But it‚Äôs definitely a must try in North Beach!

The food is fast and delicious, and the prices are really good for homemade pasta. The sauces were tasty. I did not love the oven baked tomato salad, it was just okay, but the pasta for that price and quality is definitely worth it. There is limited seating inside, but outside there are plenty of shared tables.

top_10.name: Cotogna
top_10.address: 490 Pacific Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials:
Had lunch at Cotogna and ordered gelato for dessert. For the main course, we had the Agnolotti del plin and the tortilla with sunshine and rosemary‚Äîboth were amazing and full of flavor.

The ambience was great and the restaurant felt kid-friendly, which was a plus. However, the service was not satisfactory for the price point. Everything took a long time, from placing the order to receiving the food, and even getting the check took about 10 minutes.

If you have ample time and don‚Äôt mind waiting, the food and atmosphere are excellent‚Äîbut be prepared for slow service.

This is honestly some of the best pasta I‚Äôve ever had. Went for lunch and managed to get seats at the bar without a reservation which felt pretty lucky, since getting a table here isn‚Äôt easy. The outdoor seating is super cute. the pastas are absolutely fantastic. Service was excellent, the drinks were lovely, and the fresh salads were great. Definitely recommend this spot for a special celebration or any fancy treat-yourself meal!

Cotogna is an absolute gem in San Francisco‚Äôs dining scene, a perfect balance of warmth, sophistication, and unforgettable flavor. Every dish we tried was a masterpiece, both in presentation and taste.

The prosciutto puff pastry was the perfect start, light, flaky, and beautifully balanced with the savory richness of the prosciutto. Then came the raviolo, which was pure heaven on a plate, delicate pasta filled with creamy perfection and that luscious egg yolk center that makes every bite feel indulgent.

The agnolotti pasta was another standout, with perfectly al dente pasta and a filling so flavorful and comforting it almost defies description. And the lamb pasta, wow. The depth of flavor, the tenderness of the lamb, and the subtle herbs made it one of the most memorable pasta dishes I‚Äôve ever had.

Cotogna doesn‚Äôt just serve food, it creates an experience. The service was warm and professional, the atmosphere cozy yet refined, and every bite reminded us why this restaurant is so beloved.

If you love Italian cuisine done with heart, precision, and creativity, Cotogna is a must-visit.

top_10.name: Bella Trattoria
top_10.address: 3854 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
testimonials:
Went later in the night since they close at 10pm. Nice ambiance with dim lighting. Service was pretty good.

Appetizers:  I thought the complimentary bread felt nice and soft, but the gf felt it was old and cold compared to hot & buttery bread served at other restaurants. Next, the Bruschetta ca' pummarola tasted the best out of all the orders.

Main: We went with the three course prix fixe meal:
1. Swordfish Carpaccio Antipasti tasted... interesting; like salty dried fish, maybe not our taste?
2. When the Squid Ink Fettuccine and Salmon Fettuccini came with "a lot of plate", the portion initially looked small, but there was actually a good amount of pasta there. But flavor for both was lacking and quite salty;  we could not finish it due to the sodium.
3. Panna cotta - it was okay.

Overall 3/5 for the food. I bookmarked this place awhile back and was glad to try it, but will likely not return.

First off, the food was absolutely incredible. Every dish was bursting with flavor and beautifully prepared, easily the best Italian restaurant I‚Äôve been to.

The service was just as impressive, if not better. Our waiter delivered true five-star service, offering complimentary tastings, making thoughtful recommendations, and striking the perfect balance of attentiveness without being overbearing.

The ambiance was a perfect blend of classy and fun, with the charm of an upscale Italian restaurant and the energy of a lively bar. They even have a free pool table, which adds a playful touch.

Highly recommend. I‚Äôll be making it a point to return to San Francisco just to dine here again.

Bella Trattoria ‚Äî Solid carb-load spot in SF

First time in California‚Äîand San Francisco‚Äîas an adult. We booked a same-day reservation for a group of five at Bella Trattoria the night before my half marathon (Bay Breeze Half Marathon), specifically to carb-load.

Because it was the day before Valentine‚Äôs Day, the menu was prix fixe only‚Äî2 or 4 courses, no √† la carte. I went with the 2-course option ($45), fully vegetarian:

Antipasto
Tricolore ‚Äî arugula, mixed greens, chopped artichokes, olives, balsamic. Fresh, simple, and did the job.

Entr√©e
Spaghetti all‚ÄôArrabbiata ‚Äî fresh spaghetti, San Marzano D.O.P. tomato sugo, garlic, onions, shallots, Calabrian chili peppers.
This was the standout. I was slightly worried it‚Äôd be bland (bad pre-race pasta experiences in the past), but this had real depth and heat. Bright tomato flavor, noticeable spice, and well-seasoned throughout. Not a ‚Äúblow-your-mind‚Äù dish, but very solid and exactly what I wanted before a race.

For the table, we also had complimentary garlic bread, polenta di Bella with mushrooms, and a smoked salmon pasta. The bread with tomato sauce was especially good‚Äîslightly sweet, rich, and felt authentically Italian.

Dessert
Chocolate pistachio gelato (excellent), and they kindly threw in a panna cotta with berries on the house. I mostly stuck to the gelato since I had a race the next morning‚Äîno need to gamble with GI issues.

Verdict:
Good food, generous service, and impressive that we snagged a late, same-day reservation. Bonus point: I placed 3rd overall and 3rd male the next day‚Äîso yes, I‚Äôm giving the pasta partial credit. üòÑ

A dependable Italian spot in the heart of SF. Would return if I‚Äôm back in the area.

top_10.name: Roma Antica
top_10.address: 3242 Scott St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA
testimonials: Absolutely phenomenal! Everything was on point. The service was excellent our waiter was charming, friendly and helpful. The food was wonderful.  I ordered pizza and others ordered lasagna. They ate it quickly so no pictures of the lasagna. We dined outside under the heaters. It was relaxing and pleasant. Definitely will be back.

THE BEST RESTAURANT EVER!!!!! I couldn‚Äôt recommend more. This is by far the best Italian restaurant in San Francisco. Everything on the menu is so good and the customer service is so so so amazing. David is the best person ever and he makes you feel so at home and heard. If you are in the city you simply must go here. The best chocolate cake and tiramisu!!!!!!

This Italian restaurant is easily one of the best in the Bay Area. The service was excellent from the moment we walked in, the staff is super friendly and all Italian, which adds an authentic vibe. The food arrived fast and everything tasted incredible, from the fresh bread they serve when you sit down to the main dishes with really fair prices for the quality. They also offer a great non-alcoholic white wine option for people who don‚Äôt drink but still want that dinner vibe. The place has a cozy atmosphere, amazing food quality, and overall outstanding service. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back many times and highly recommend it.

top_10.name: North Beach Gyros
top_10.address: 561 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: This restaurant is awesome! Me and my boyfriend had a really great time on Valentine‚Äôs Day. The food is delicious and the service is amazing. The owner is really kind and he even gave our dog chicken as treats. It‚Äôs definitely worth trying in north beach and the atmosphere is so cozy and romantic. I like the fish and the soup, they‚Äôre fantastic Mediterranean food!!! Baklava is amazing, definitely worth trying as authentic Turkish desserts:))

North Beach Gyro is a clean and cozy spot with a welcoming atmosphere. Tje dining area was well kept and clean. The staff were friendly and polite, and a special shout-out goes to our waiter, Jose, who was super friendly, kind, and genuinely attentive. His positive attitude made our experience more enjoyable and truly unforgettable.
We ordered several items and were very satisfied with the food quality. The feta fries were crispy and delicious, with great texture and flavor. The salmon wrap really stood out, juicy, well wrapped, and generously portioned, with no unnecessary spices overpowering the natural taste of the fish. The cilantro sauce served on the side added a fresh and flavorful touch that elevated the dish even more. The falafel wrap was also good, solid and satisfying.
Overall, North Beach Gyro is a nice casual spot for a flavorful and filling meal, especially if you enjoy wraps done right. A bit more attention to restroom cleanliness would make the experience even better.

Absolutely phenomenal! This was easily the best Mediterranean meal I‚Äôve had in San Francisco and I‚Äôve eaten at a lot of places. The flavors were fresh, rich, and perfectly balanced. I ordered the duck, and it was so good I didn‚Äôt leave a single crumb on the plate.

The owner was hilarious and genuinely friendly, which made the whole experience even better. You can tell he really cares about his food and his guests. The atmosphere was warm and relaxed, and the service was fast without feeling rushed.

If you‚Äôre anywhere near the area, this place is a must-try. It‚Äôs the kind of spot you leave already planning your next visit.

top_10.name: Presidio Kebab Mediterranean Restaurant
top_10.address: 3277 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
testimonials:
Great service and delicious food!
The staff was very friendly and attentive, and it was nice that the waiters spoke Turkish too. The food was full of flavor, and my favorite was the Iskender - absolutely delicious! Definitely a place worth visiting again.
Superb food and service. Great local, low-key atmosphere. Turkish wine (both red and rose) was surprisingly good! Turkish coffee and baklava for the desert made my day. Thank you!
Amazing. Order combo platter, Adana kabab, lentil soup, baklava, and Greek salad. Especially enjoyed the housemade hot sauce. Wine prices are great.

top_10.name: Milos Meze
top_10.address: 3348 Steiner St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA
testimonials: This restaurant is fantastic! The dishes are so flavorful, fresh, and taste very authentic. Really good portion sizes, good variety to choose from, and welcoming atmosphere. The service was also great. Overall would highly recommend this restaurant for a nice night out.

Our first time at Milos Meze and we absolutely loved it! The staff was very kind, friendly, and attentive.

We tried the spicy hitipiti, saghanaki, horiatiki salad, beef souvlaki, and lavraki. The saghanaki stole the show - reminded me of an Argentine provoleta. Delicious melted cheese with lemon. We also loved the beef souvlaki - it was very tender, smoky, and perfectly cooked. For dessert we tried the baklavaki which was super yummy and very generous portion.

Very cozy, family feeling great for all ages and occasions. Cant wait to come back!

Just had an amazing meal at Milo‚Äôs! We live pretty close by but finally made the trip over and are so glad we did. The service is great and they make you feel right at home.

Our server had some great recommendations for both food and wine. We got a bottle of one of the Semeli wines that was perfect for a chilly day.

For food we had the dip platter and saganski both which were phenomenal. In addition we ordered the beans and a souvlaki. Everything was delicious with tons of flavor!! We finished with a baklava that was Amazing!!! Not too sweet, loaded with walnuts and the right amount of honey.

Plus the outside is dog friendly which was perfect. I can‚Äôt wait to go back!!

top_10.name: The Bite
top_10.address: 996 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials: Absolutely fantastic restaurant with great service and fantastic food. If you are looking for fantastic Turkish | Mediterranean food, this should be your first choice. We will definitely be back soon and every time in San Francisco!
Delicious vegan options (clearly indicated) and friendly service. I ate this gyro so quickly bc of how good it was (see second pic)I‚Äôm definitely returning for moreüòå

Been a rough week and The Bite made sure I end it on a high note. I just ordered late night delivery for tonight's dinner, and next two days of meals. Entr√©es are high quality ingredients. Made fresh to order. Meat was not dried out. Lightly seasoned to enjoy the fresh natural flavor of the foods.

Bonus points for the careful packaging of my delivery order, especially the protective wrapping for the soups.

Highly recommend!!!

top_10.name: Kokkari Estiatorio
top_10.address: 200 Jackson St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA
testimonials:
GET THE PITA it‚Äôs thick and chewy and buttery!

Cozy upscale dining. We sat at the bar. Bar seat is better than table seat. Better lighting and you can sit closer together.

Waiter said bar seats you can get by calling to reserve two days in advance. Table seats you can get by calling two weeks in advance. Unless you‚Äôre a party of one - we had a person walk in and sit next to us

Fried cheese - waiter drizzled lemon juice and it sizzled nicely. But it cooled too quickly and became boring to eat

Babaganoush - good but not the best in the city. I liked the pickled veggies that came with it though

Tzin spritz - ok, too much volume. I liked eating the berries. Waiter called them British boba üòÇ

Hibiscus mocktail - tart and delicious!

Squash - forgettable, did not taste the pistachio butter

Octopus - ok, did not come with tail

Chicken - yummy and enough to feed two people

We over ordered and could not finish the chicken. The waiter packed the chicken for us

Food not worth the $200 total, you are  paying for the ambience. Nice place to dress up for. Would be nice to just get drinks here also. There‚Äôs a fireplace with real fire and the overall volume is not too loud, you don‚Äôt have to strain to hear.

I saw other reviews recommending the appetizer lamb chops over the entr√©e version, and I did enjoy the appetizer one, they‚Äôre delicious, with a wonderfully crispy surface. The octopus dish is very tender, and both the whole fish and the zucchini cake are perfectly crisp on the outside. Overall, great textures and flavors!

First and most important.
The Host was not welcoming  and had a stern demeanor.
Secondly the atmosphere was very noisy.
Third the food which is very crucial lacked high standards for being a San Francisco gourmet restaurant. The flavor of the food and texture was off.
I ordered the ravioli plate it was drowned in a highly salty sauce and the ravioli was not al dente it was raw, it needed  more time. Also the tiny pieces of sweet potatoe and zucchini in it were over cooked.
My husband ordered the lamb chops plate, it came with 2 chops and 3 russet potatoe wedges the lamb chops were bland with no seasoning and a lemon, the potatoes were fried and dry from the inside.
It was disappointing to spend $160.00 dollars on the type of service and food. It did not meet my standards regarding customer service, food presentation, flavor, texture and quality.

top_10.name: Mezze and Mooore
top_10.address: 198 Guerrero St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials: The food was absolutely delicious. Everything we had from the menu was flavorful. The halloumi cheese and chicken Shawarma were exceptional! Also a must try is the mint lemonade. Definitely coming back again

It was decent.

I didn't like how firm the falafel was but Boi did I enjoy the eggplants on the falafel platter - definitely worth adding it to you platter.

The House pita was.. Decent.

All in all, was a good place to be. :) super friendly staff though.

I bookmarked this spot a year ago, so after a nearby walk, we finally jumped at the chance to have lunch at Mezze and Mooore!

From the moment we walked in, we were greeted by the owner, Nabil, whose million-dollar smile sets the tone for this charming corner caf√©. We were pleasantly surprised by the prices ‚Äî especially in a time when lunch fare has climbed everywhere else.

The interior is bright and welcoming, with beautiful tiled floors and plenty of windows that fill the space with natural light.

When we heard the mint lemonade was made in-house, we had to try it ‚Äî and it did not disappoint. I ordered the falafel platter, which was generous enough for two meals. The falafel were crisp on the outside, perfectly green and flavorful inside. As a self-proclaimed hummus snob, I can say theirs was outstanding ‚Äî smooth, rich, and creamy.

My friend ordered the lamb shawarma wrap and raved about how delicious it was. We finished with a piece of baklava, which was just the right amount of sweet and flaky.

We‚Äôll definitely be back ‚Äî this spot is a true gem!

top_10.name: Lokma
top_10.address: 1801 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA
testimonials: Been at Lokma 3 times and its the most memorable times, delicious authentic food and great service along with intimate atmosphere. Menu always have something new to try and is always a hit! Really enjoining the interior of not a big space but it‚Äôs very functional!

Authentic Turkish Flavors with a Cozy Vibe!
Lokma is an amazing spot in San Francisco for authentic Turkish and Mediterranean food. The ambience is warm, modern, and inviting ‚Äî perfect for brunch or dinner. The dishes are beautifully presented and full of flavor ‚Äî from the juicy kebabs to the freshly baked bread and delicious mezes. The service is attentive and friendly, and everything tastes fresh and homemade. Their Turkish coffee and desserts are a must-try! A perfect blend of great food, great service, and great atmosphere ‚Äî highly recommended!

I've never seen so many headless turkeys in my life. Bless that one server that is singlehandedly carrying the entire restaurant.  She must be able to deadlift 1000 lbs without breaking a sweat. I've never had it so difficult to grab a waiter's attention. No one is working????

Service aside, food is comforting and simple. Nothing wild. Probably not worth the price tag.

Overall, my experience that day was horrible and I'm never coming back.

top_10.name: Golden Mediterranean Cuisine
top_10.address: 3611 California St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
testimonials: Everything was amazing! The food was absolutely delicious, beautifully presented, and full of flavor. The atmosphere is warm, cozy, and very inviting. You can really feel the care and effort put into every detail. Highly recommended!‚ú®
Food was amazing, the interior clean and lovely, and the staff even lovelier! Best Mediterranean spot in the area for sure!

The food here was so delicious. The restaurant is super clean and accommodating. They have a very cute place and a lot of seating. We ordered the combo platter for two and the combo appetizer and I can‚Äôt say I disliked anything honestly. The meat was juicy and cooked to perfection, the bread was warm, and the appetizers were so good. They don‚Äôt skimp out on the portions and the quality is definitely there.

top_10.name: Dalida Restaurant
top_10.address: 101 Montgomery St Suite 100, San Francisco, CA 94129, USA
testimonials:
Oh my. We came here for brunch and we were pretty impressed by overall experiences including the quality of foods, service and architecture of the place.  I am not sure if this is Turkish or Greek and I am supposed to be cautious about this bc I can‚Äôt offend either one of them but regardless all of the dishes we had were delectable.

We came here for brunch and ordered Turkish flatbread, Octobus and Sujuk and baklava . I don‚Äôt think I had better baklava . It was so dreamy and melting inside of my mouth. It‚Äôs not the traditional baklava but it had perfect mixture of sweetness, texture with tanginess from raspberry.  We really loved Octopus and Sujuk as the spices with Sujuk were so unique and flavorful. My daughter loved flatbread .

I recommend also getting pistachio coffee if you love pistachio and coffee.

We will definitely come back for diner !

Dalida is elevated Mediterranean food and a stunning view from the outdoor patio onto presidio's tunnel tops park.

I ate at the bar and got the breaking bread which includes humus, muhammara, labneh and other assortments with a pit bread baked with zaatar. A great dish for the table.

Also got the tapsi kebab that came with shoestring potatoes and egg. This was delicious and meaty, and with the runny egg yolk was üî•. The potatoes were crisp and the kebab was like a juicy, mildly seasoned chaapli kebab.

For desert I had the chocolate hazel nut tart. Not super on brand like kunefe but this was stunning. It came with some chocolate crisps and anise ice cream. I loved this!

To finish I got the ottoman coffee which was a good Turkish coffee.

The server was super helpful and made sure we didn't over order. I think I will go back for brunch.

A marvelous meal with a remarkable ambiance. I started off with oysters which were thankfully up to my expectations. The tamarind based cod entree was super smooth and silky in texture and taste and I found myself unable to stop. It was that good however the baklava with raspberry sauce felt like a culinary joke. If my dessert experience was up-to par I would‚Äôve given it full stars. Either way I will still come back for another seasonal meal beside I love the bay! And trust me, when I say today was an absolutely beautiful day with Golden Gate Bridge my view and a delicious meal fascinating my soul to write, I am filled with gratitude and bliss.

top_10.name: Old Jerusalem Restaurant
top_10.address: 2966 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials:
Outstanding middle eastern food. Awesome ambience and service. Falafel and Kunafa were amazingly fresh and tasty. Other dishes we ordered were also top notch.
Good atmosphere and great service. Thanks!

We had an absolutely fantastic family meal here.
This place is a real gem.

We focused on the shareable plates and loved everything we tried - the flavors are truly authentic and delicious. Make sure you don't skip the complementary pickles; they're a standout! And the mint tea is the perfect, refreshing end to the meal.

What makes this place special is the service. The host and the entire staff are wonderful people who make you feel right at home. Great food, great people - we highly recommend Old Jerusalem for a top-notch dining experience!

Old Jerusalem is an absolute must-visit. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, but the food is the real star of the show.

Here‚Äôs what we had:
Chicken Shawarma Plate: The chicken was perfectly seasoned and tender. It paired perfectly with their fluffy rice and hummus.
Lamb Chops Plate: These were the highlight of the night! Cooked perfectly - juicy, and incredibly flavorful. You can tell they use high-quality meat.
Kunafa: You cannot leave without ordering this. It arrived warm, gooey, and sweet with that signature crunchy topping. It‚Äôs easily one of the best versions of this dessert I‚Äôve ever had.

top_10.name: Anchor Oyster Bar
top_10.address: 579 Castro St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA
testimonials: We visited on a weekend evening and waited over an hour, as they do not take reservations and the space is small. It is a popular spot and still worth trying, though a less busy night may be more enjoyable. We ordered the Caesar salad and the large cioppino. The Caesar was a generous portion for two and overall good, though the dressing was lighter than expected. The croutons were excellent and easily the standout of the salad. The large cioppino was the highlight. The broth looked tomato based but leaned more toward spiced flavors than tomato. It was filled with crab, crab legs, shrimp, fish, clams, and mussels, all well prepared, and bibs were provided since it can get messy. Overall, Anchor Oyster Bar is worth a visit, especially if you can go on a quieter night to avoid the long wait.

We finally arrived at this cozy, welcoming, and authentic restaurant. There were a lot of people there, but we were the first. Everyone waited patiently, and it was worth it. The food was delicious, everything was fresh, and perfectly prepared. The oyster selection was excellent. The staff was incredibly polite and attentive. It was a great day.

Went at 2:15 on a Saturday afternoon. No wait when we showed up, but a line up formed around 2:30.
The food was unbelievable. Had a dozen oysters and the full size cioppino. The cioppino was outstanding, very large dish my wife and split. Absolutely worth the hype and any wait a person chooses to do.
The service was great, super friendly. We brought a bottle of champagne for corkage, and some places are miffed when you bring a bottle in, they were happy and very accommodating and brought an ice bucket to place it in.
Short review is definitely recommended.

top_10.name: Scoma's Restaurant
top_10.address: 1965 Al Scoma Way, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials:
Scoma‚Äôs Restaurant absolutely lives up to its reputation. From the moment you walk in, it feels like a true San Francisco classic warm, welcoming, and effortlessly charming. It‚Äôs the kind of place that reminds you why certain restaurants stand the test of time.

The food was outstanding. Everything tasted incredibly fresh, especially the seafood, which was prepared perfectly and full of flavor. You can tell quality and care go into every dish, and nothing felt rushed or overlooked. This is seafood done right simple, elevated, and memorable.

What truly set Scoma‚Äôs apart, though, was the service. Hands down, it was the best service I‚Äôve experienced since moving to San Francisco. Attentive without being intrusive, knowledgeable, and genuinely kind it made the entire dining experience feel special and relaxed.

The atmosphere adds to the magic. Classic yet comfortable, lively but never overwhelming, it‚Äôs an ideal spot whether you‚Äôre celebrating something special or just enjoying a great meal out. Everything flows seamlessly, which is a testament to how well this place is run.

I‚Äôll definitely be back, and it‚Äôs a place I‚Äôll happily recommend to anyone looking for an unforgettable dining experience in San Francisco.

This restaurant is PHENOMENAL. Came here for date night with my boyfriend and it was all around such an enjoyable experience. Make sure to get a reservation beforehand, as they can get pretty busy. The food here was amazing, it was all so flavorful and just delicious. My boyfriend got a steak dish and he said the cut of meat was really high quality and that it was cooked to perfection. I got the clam linguine and it was also amazing. Finally the service here is just amazing, all the waiters are extremely kind and respectful. I will be coming back once I am back in SF!

We had a really enjoyable experience at Scoma‚Äôs Restaurant, and I‚Äôd definitely recommend it if you‚Äôre looking for a special meal on the water in the San Francisco Bay Area. The location right on the bay gives you great views and a relaxing atmosphere, which sets the tone for a memorable dinner. The space feels open and inviting, perfect for sitting back with a drink and appreciating the scenery while you wait for your food.  Ôøº

We tried a few different dishes during our visit. The steak was excellent ‚Äî cooked just right, flavorful, and rich. It‚Äôs the kind of dish you hope for at a waterfront restaurant, and it definitely delivered. The seafood soup was also very good, with generous portions and fresh ingredients that gave it depth and authenticity. The risotto was decent, creamy and satisfying, though not as standout as the steak. The pasta, on the other hand, was fairly ordinary ‚Äî enjoyable but nothing compared to the other dishes we ordered. Overall the food quality leaned toward the higher side, especially considering the location.  Ôøº

One of the highlights of the evening was the drinks ‚Äî both the wine and cocktails were tasty and nicely poured, which paired well with the food and setting. Be prepared that this place isn‚Äôt cheap; it‚Äôs definitely more on the upscale side in terms of pricing, but for a special night out or a celebratory dinner, it‚Äôs worth it.

The service was pretty good, attentive without being intrusive, and the staff seemed experienced and confident. They helped guide us through the menu and made solid suggestions based on our preferences, which made the ordering process smoother. In summary, if you‚Äôre looking for great steak, solid seafood options, good drinks, and a lovely waterfront environment, this restaurant is a strong choice ‚Äî even if a few dishes like the pasta don‚Äôt quite reach the same level. Highly recommended for a scenic and satisfying meal in the Bay Area!

top_10.name: Swan Oyster Depot
top_10.address: 1517 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: Delicious seafood. We came around 10am and we had to wait 3 hours to be seated. The raw oysters, Sicilian sashimi and cracked crab are worth trying. Service was great!

There‚Äôs a reason this spot is Anthony Bourdain‚Äôs favorite spot in SF. It‚Äôs pretty straightforward good seafood spot that serves fresh catch! It can get a little pricey but the coziness of the place and the attentiveness of the staff makes it worthwhile.

I specifically liked the sashimi platter and the oysters they have are flavorful, briney and fresh ‚Äî we had it for breakfast and didn‚Äôt have any tummy issues!

Note though they serve Boston style clam chowder so it‚Äôs runnier than the typical chowder you find in SF

Stepping into Swan Oyster Depot is like stepping back in time to a place that has perfected the art of fresh seafood. This is a no-frills, counter-seating-only institution, and its charm is in its authenticity and, of course, its incredible food.

The menu is a dream for any seafood lover. We ordered the combination seafood salad (often called the Sicilian Sashimi), and it was a stunning plate of fresh-off-the-boat tuna, salmon, and white fish, perfectly accented with olive oil, capers, and a squeeze of lemon. The smoked salmon was equally amazing‚Äîbuttery, delicate, and served with fantastic sourdough bread.

The guys behind the counter are true professionals, shucking oysters and preparing plates with incredible speed and skill. The atmosphere is loud, busy, and full of happy customers. It's more than a meal; it's a true San Francisco experience.

Essential Tips:

‚Ä¢ CASH ONLY! The sign in the window isn't joking.
‚Ä¢ Arrive early (even before they open) to get a spot in line.
‚Ä¢ Be prepared to stand, but know that the reward is one of the best seafood meals you'll ever have.

top_10.name: Hog Island Oyster Co.
top_10.address: Ferry Building, #11, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA
testimonials: Not a tourist trap and worth the hype. Oysters were extremely fresh and delicious. The fish and chips were great--the batter was crisp, the meat was moist and tender. The fries were delicious too. There's no reservations, but the lineives pretty fast and there's also bar seating.

This is a great place for seafood in SF. There was a short line at dinner time but it moved fast. I personally like that they don‚Äôt really take reservations. The oysters are tasty and fresh. The wines we had were delicious. Service was friendly and attentive the entire evening. The server even washed the abalone shell that the ceviche was served in for me to take home. The location is fantastic. It doesn‚Äôt get much better than waterfront dining along the bay.

Absolutely outstanding seafood. We tried the oysters and the mussels, and everything was incredibly fresh and delicious. The oysters were very tasty‚Äî exactly what you hope for. But the mussels were the real highlight: the sauce they come in is unbelievably good. We ordered bread and butter on the side, which made it even better.

I also highly recommend the house-made shrub drink ‚Äî it reminded me a bit of kombucha, refreshing and full of flavor.
Overall, this place exceeded all expectations. I‚Äôm genuinely impressed and would come back anytime.

top_10.name: Hook Fish Co
top_10.address: 4542 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA
testimonials:
First time trying this place. Went there on a Monday early evening (5pm). Little wait, but there are couple of people enjoying their food.

I orderd Fish and Chips, and it was good! Crispy batter and juicy fish. The included chips are seasoned perfectly!

Overall, I want to try them again and enjoy the atmosphere :)

Hook Fish Co is a very good place to eat a good fish and chip with excellent fries that are well done and seasoned. The wating time is about 20-40 min on rush hours but is is worth it. There is limited parking in front of the restaurant so you will need to find street parking. There are only outside seating that is good. On the menu we highly recomend the fish and chips and the burrito. In conclusion we will definitely come back.

Hook Fish absolutely lives up to the hype. We ordered the ceviche and chips, poke and chips, poke tacos, and grilled fish tacos‚Äîand everything was sooooo fresh and incredibly delicious. This is the kind of seafood that tastes clean, bright, and straight from the ocean.
The restaurant is entirely outdoors and super charming, with quirky tables, tons of plants, and a laid-back neighborhood feel. It was a beautiful saturday, which made it the perfect setting to sit outside and enjoy fresh seafood for lunch. It‚Äôs counter service, but they do have beer and wine, which is a nice bonus.
That said, this place was absolutely slammed. Seating was tough to come by, and since it‚Äôs counter service, you‚Äôre on your own to find a spot. We ended up eating the ceviche and poke with chips while standing (no photo because we were starving), but honestly, it was still totally worth it. One small downside was that our food came out in chunks (20 mins apart) since my friend and I ordered separately, which was a bit of a bummer.
Still, the food is so good that it‚Äôs easy to see why this place is always packed. A little patience is required, but the freshness and flavor make it more than worth it. I‚Äôd happily go back‚Äîideally with a little more time and luck snagging a table.

top_10.name: Betty Lou's Seafood & Grill
top_10.address: 318 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: Cioppino is my favorite dish and I order it every chance I get. This one is hands down the BEST I've had in San Francisco. This place is consistent with their dishes and never fail. The calamari was not too greasy and perfect to the crisp. I always enjoy introducing friends to this spot!

Absolutely love this place. My wife and I found this hidden gem last summer on a weekend trip to SF. So when I was in town one night for business, we made a drive intro eh city for a great dinner before our flight.

Lucky for us it was a rainy Tuesday night and we didn‚Äôt have to wait for a table.  The service here is so good! They had fresh bread (and I mean piping hot fresh sourdough straight out of the oven) on the table in a couple minutes.

I had the clam chowder and it was so friggin good! Amazing taste and chuck of clams spread out in almost every bite. Then I ordered the same thing I got last time, linguine with seafood üç§ üç£! The pasta is done of the best homemade pasta I‚Äôve ever eaten. They literally pack this full of clams, mussels, calamari and a giant scallop and shrimp. I love that they don‚Äôt scrimp on the seafood.

Definitely a hidden secret but my first choice for authentic Italian In little Italy üáÆüáπ!

This visit was unfortunately very disappointing.

We ordered two lemonades, but both were undrinkable from the first sip. They had a strong tap-water taste, along with what seemed like poorly filtered or contaminated ice, so we were unable to finish them.

The pasta and ravioli were noticeably overcooked and kept breaking apart on the plate, which made them unpleasant to eat. The biggest disappointment, however, was the cioppino, which is advertised as the restaurant‚Äôs signature dish. The broth had the same unusual watery taste, several clams were not properly cleaned, and the seafood overall did not taste fresh‚Äîespecially disappointing for a seafood restaurant in San Francisco.

For two people, ordering two pasta dishes and drinks (without alcohol), the bill came to over $140. Given the quality of the food and drinks, this felt significantly overpriced.

We chose this restaurant because it is often recommended as a well-known spot in San Francisco and expected much better. However, despite it being a Saturday lunchtime, the restaurant was already quite empty. We also noticed that all nearby tables were filled with tourists and no locals, which gave us the impression that the restaurant‚Äôs quality may have declined over time‚Äîpossibly due to changes in ownership or kitchen staff.

Overall, this experience did not meet expectations, and unfortunately, it is not a place we would choose to return to.

top_10.name: Sotto Mare
top_10.address: 552 Green St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: Such amazing Italian food!! Ordered a half dozen of east + west oysters. I personally prefer east cuz it‚Äôs sweater. Absolutely favorite is the seafood risotto, so much seafood and fresh. Same with their signature seafood soup(?) forgot the actual name of the dish. But it‚Äôs served with so much fresh seafood. Crab, shell, squid, mussel. Seasoning is absolutely spot on. Not too heavy or creamy. Such delicious food for amazing price! Def a 10/10!! Server was so nice. Just be aware they have added a 4% service fee. I didn‚Äôt take it out because I feel they deserve that and to better survive in sf as such an amazing Italian restaurant.

Located in the heart of Little Italy, North Beach San Francisco.  This is my favorite place for classic cioppino, fresh oysters and marinated Dungeness crab!  They offer raw oysters either on the half shell or as shooters, west coast or east coast species with a spicy red sauce.  Be sure to ask for their fresh horseradish.   For starters, we also love their bay shrimp Louie salad, which is big enough to share with 2-3 people.  I also recommend their marinaded, cold whole Dungeness crab, which comes in an olive oil, lemon garlic sauce.  Be sure to order their marinaded‚ÄùBest Damn Cioppino‚Äù , which is served in a large bowl:  Dungeness crab, mussels, clams, squid, and scallops.

Such a local gem! Our good friend took us here for my partners and i's pre engagement lunch! We got the signature crab seafood soup and tye risotto and omg, was it heavenly! My partner also tried some oysters. You can tell the quality of the seafood in one bite! I highly recommend going there for small or moderate size groups but I think they have a banquet space in the basement.

top_10.name: Pacific Catch
top_10.address: 2027 Chestnut St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA
testimonials: Awesome fresh seafood. Everything we ordered was great, but the fish (Cod) and chips ( Sweet potato) was the best. Friendly vibe and service!

We ordered the Seared Ahi tuna sandwich ($20) and the happy hour Original Ahi poke ($10), it was so good I couldn't take a picture fast enough before it was eaten. Absolutely amazing service, they checked on us a few times throughout our meal to make sure everything was good, and he was very helpful. Blown away by our experience and can't wait to come back

I was really excited to try this location. I've eaten at Pacific catch on 9th once before and wasn't impressed. But I came with an open mind and an empty stomach.
I ordered the poke duo, the presentation was beautiful. I love that there was a little bit of everything. Unfortunately as I dug in I noticed the poke was not very edible. The connective tissue was not removed and was very chewy, getting stuck in my teeth with every bite.
And the "fresh greens" were not so fresh. They were about a week past fresh.
There were quite a few people working but every time someone came through the door customers had to search for an employee to help them.
At least I gave them another chance. Now I know for sure what to expect.

top_10.name: Angler
top_10.address: 132 The Embarcadero, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA
testimonials:
We came here for their Valentine‚Äôs Day dinner prix fixe menu. It was $265 a person. We also got the caviar service for $140. I want to start off by saying that our experience started out great. Most of our dishes were phenomenal and probably one of the best meals we have had. There were a few downsides which I will list below, but I don‚Äôt want that to take away from the good potion of our experience, which is why I only took one star away. Keep in mind that this is a hefty spend, but could be worth it.
Our dinner started out great, waiter was attentive and had suggestions we really liked for drinks, we started with the caviar service which was bites of banana bread with a spread that I think was also banana flavored. The idea was to eat the caviar on the little bread bite with the cheese spread, I think all of the ingredients were great on their own, caviar was great, and bread bites were great with the spread as well, but together the banana flavor took away from the caviar taste in my opinion.
Moving on to the courses, the salad that was on the menu was bitter which was fine but it just not what you would expect from a restaurant in this caliper, the lobster risotto was good but lacked some flavor. The rest of the dishes were pretty phenomenal, the steak may have been one of the best steaks I‚Äôve had, the down side was that we waited 30-40 minutes to get our final entree (the steak and potato) before the dessert. All tables around us had gotten theirs and were already done. Within this waiting period, the waiter didn‚Äôt check in at all and we had no drinks or food for that 30-40 minute period.
Dinner started at 8:30 and we left around 11pm, that‚Äôs how long it took.
Outside of that I still think it was one of the best meals we have had and would recommend. I just wish we left with an exceptional experience after spending $900+ for two people.

Really enjoyed the food and dinner experience here. The service was outstanding.

We opted for the tasting menu where the food was chosen by chef, each course arriving was a nice surprise!

The oysters were nice and fresh, the scallops were massive and tasty. The other dishes were equally tasty and well cooked.

Unsurprisingly there is a very comprehensive wine list. We had a couple of bottles of Californian white selected by the sommelier, both were really good.

Angler is an awesome spot for seafood in SF. Everything tastes super fresh, and the flavors really pop. The oysters are especially good‚Äîsome of the best I‚Äôve had. Even the non-seafood items, like the bread with butter and the salad, are surprisingly tasty.

The dishes are creative but still let the seafood shine, which I really appreciate. Service is excellent‚Äîfriendly, attentive, and never stuffy.

It‚Äôs definitely a high-end restaurant, but the vibe isn‚Äôt overly formal. You can relax, enjoy your meal, and just have a really good time. If you love seafood, this place is absolutely worth checking out.
