top_10.name: Fog Harbor Fish House
top_10.address: 39 Pier, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials:
The food is great. Served quickly.

I love the cioppino and my baby‚Äôs clapping for their clam chowder!

Our server Pedro is so sweet & attentive. But everyone there are friendly.

Kids friendly.
They have a high chair & gave us a large paper bib, wet tissues, without being asked.

Clean restrooms.

Really good atmosphere,  food was good (although I prefer the chowder from the crab house) the shrimp appetizer was really good, spicy and savory. The pasta was phenomenal as well. The only thing that I would point out would be the service,  our server never gave us his name, and he seem like he didn't want to be there.. other than that food was great.

We enjoyed the friendly service. Food was good. Love the clam chowder in the sourdough bread bowl. Everyone seemed pleased. The view is incredible. They have happy hour menu at the bar. Drinks were not that good. We still enjoyed our meal. We have been here many times over the years and will continue to come back .

top_10.name: Limoncello
top_10.address: 1400 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials:
Early January 2026 Authentic Italian deli and general store that serves both cold and warm meals and handmade sandwiches ü•™ üòã üëå as well as serves other food provisions, while offering a wide range of regional products.

Tucked in one of the streets near Van Ness is a more than 10 year establishment with a varied and well displayed set menu deli combining fresh and well choice cuts of meats.  The adjoining store offers the visitors ample alternatives for gourmet and European products including the alcohol.

Sandwiches and pizzas are served in generous and well balanced portions.  Desserts üç® ü•ß üç¶are also available at the goods section.

We were fortunate to share a few moments with the kind owner while waiting for our order.   The service was quick and our takeaways were well packaged.

The interiors and displays are reminiscent of European delis.  Bright, colorful, tasteful, and beautifully stocked.  The elevated deli with a small counter provides a wonderful perched to wait or enjoy your meal.  Al fresco tables also outside can be used during fair weather.

Much care and attention is evident in how much the establishment has been maintained which is a gem üíé of a place ‚ú®Ô∏è within its neighborhood

Ideal for quick bites, takeaways and very small groups or dates.  All around the general store is also a great place to shop for supplies and provisions.

Great sandwiches! The portions are huge and the ingredients are high-quality. The prices are very reasonable, and I think it‚Äôs a great value for the money. The sides in the sandwich are very flavorful, and there‚Äôs a generous amount of meat. However, the bread is on the firmer side, so you might want to consider that if you prefer soft bread. The shop is well-organized, and the staff are all very enthusiastic. Definitely worth a second visit!

Was exploring Union Square area when I found this cute, not-so-little Italian Bakery.

I had 2 hours to kill before my dinner so dived in for a quick bite here. The menu had good selection of s'wiches, Pastas (pre-made) and some Salad. I went for their no.17 (Grilled Chicken sandwich). Came out fairly quick and was good though I wish it had a bit more flavor to it.

It's a good little mini-mart of Italian food products - perfect if you're craving Italian & want to grab a quick meal.

top_10.name: Submarine Center
top_10.address: 820 Ulloa St, San Francisco, CA 94127, USA
testimonials:
If this place hadn‚Äôt used miracle whip, the sub I ordered would‚Äôve been incredible. Instead, it was covered with it and really killed the vibe.

In general, the service was great and the customers in the shop mentioned visiting for years. Unfortunately it just wasn‚Äôt for me.

My boyfriend was craving a sandwich, so I looked up a few spots and decided to give this place a try ‚Äî and I‚Äôm so glad we did! It‚Äôs a small space but super efficient and well-run.

We ordered two subs, and they were absolutely amazing. I had the avocado with turkey, and my boyfriend went with the pastrami. Both were fresh, flavorful, and packed just right. We devoured our subs ‚Äî definitely hit the spot!

Great little gem for a satisfying sandwich fix.

One of the best subs I‚Äôve ever had! The pastrami, Swiss, bacon, and avocado is simply incredible. The staff recommended it as it was my first time there.
Sandwich was incredible. Perfectly cooked pastrami, delectable bacon, huge chunks of avocado, melting Swiss cheese, balanced mustard, and topped with a crispy bun toasted to perfection.
I want to go back and get this again.
A+ will be back.

top_10.name: Q's Sandwich Shop
top_10.address: 258 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA
testimonials:
I can‚Äôt say enough positive things about Q‚Äôs Sandwich Shop. Beyond making incredible sandwiches (my favorite is definitely the turkey pesto, but I‚Äôve learned you can‚Äôt go wrong and they are happy to make recommendations!), they offer wonderful service - the owner will always greet you with a smile, knows his regulars, and makes sure to pay every person who comes by special attention. This place should be on the SF best sandwich list radar - no question. They are also always innovating - trying out new sandwich ideas and new sides, so every time you go back, you can discover something new!

Admittedly, I‚Äôve been coming here for years, but I always eat my sandwiches so quickly that I forget to take a picture‚Ä¶
Love this place.

Great little sandwich shop. I had the roast beef and split it with my husband. They were nice enough to cut it in half and serve it in two separate baskets, which was a thoughtful touch. The sandwich was very flavorful and delicious. I honestly was not expecting much from a simple sandwich place, but this far exceeded my expectations.

Wandered by and was drawn in by the aroma. Ordered the special written on the calk board because it was a bolognese grilled cheese and OF COURSE I‚Äôm going to order that. Oh‚Ä¶..mygod‚Ä¶.that sandwich was a pleasure tour for my mouth. The sauce was so savory and meaty. The bread buttery and toasty with parsley and everything delicious. And chips?? What? Yes, chips, and they were perfect. What a treat to have happened upon this place.

top_10.name: Molinari Delicatessen
top_10.address: 373 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: Authentic Italian delicacy Deli! Amazing sandwiches with a wide selection of deli meats and ham as well as cheese and pickled vegetables and salads. Very neatly organized and friendly service. Would definitely stop by again to grab a bite when exploring the neighborhood.

Vising SF and had to try the sandwich. I waited for 30-40 minutes. Good thing that I got to chat with a nice woman behind me so the wait felt quick. I got the Lucca Special. It was really delicious. For the price of $16.25, it is a huge sandwich and totally worth it. Highly recommend!

This sandwich requires a full hour of patience before you even order. Once it lands, though, it‚Äôs huge- I ate it for two days, so the $20 price tag almost behaves.
One star off for the attitude toward delivery drivers. Feed people, not egos!!!üíî
I‚Äôd be back‚Ä¶ just emotionally prepared

top_10.name: Le Sandwich
top_10.address: 752 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: Chef Elias was extremely friendly and whipped up two absolutely delicious (and huge) Italian sandwiches for us. We‚Äôd been wanting to go for a while and it absolutely lived up to the hype. Order the Primo!

Great sandwich. I have the Viking which is around $15 something after tax but it‚Äôs loaded. The sandwich is big so I have to save half of it for later. So worth the visit!

You can call and order by phone to pick up which I did and it saved me waiting time!

Will return to try other options!

Updated: I‚Äôm now an avid customer of this sandwich shop. The owner's thoughtful and funny personality also his creativity to make the best sandwich fill me with joy every time I swing by. This store is not close to my place but I‚Äôm willing to travel far for the owner‚Äôs creation! Not to mention with the sandwich is packed with fillings. My mom and I were so full after finishing only half of the sandwich!
got the Viking to go; well-balanced flavours and generous portions! saw lots of regulars that‚Äôs a green flag right there; shop is small but cozy & playing vintage label music.

top_10.name: Saigon Sandwich
top_10.address: 560 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials: The sandwiches were amazing! The cost of the portion sizes are insanely good. It‚Äôs a cash only place but definitely worth having. I had the pork sandwich & it was fantastic üòã

It's cash only, so make sure to have that before coming. There's a few ATMs that are nearby, if you didn't know like I did. This is probably¬†one of my favorite banh mi sandwiches that I've ever had. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but it had a small line going outside of the restaurant, which is usually a pretty good sign the place has good food. Sort of a sketchy area. The line moved pretty quickly. I heard people ordering a¬† combination sandwich and was intrigued¬†by that, but I decided to just keep with a pork sandwich.¬†The bread was soft and crispy, and I think they made it right in the back! The ingredients¬†were very fresh too. It had everything I look for in a banh mi sandwich. The ingredients were very fresh, and the jalape√±os gave me a good punch across the face. The sauce really complimented the pork¬†too, and crunchiness from the carrots is always great. Last but definitely¬†not least, the value is crazy. It is such a good deal for a sandwich this good to be less than 8 dollars. I'd eat these far too often if I lived nearby. I see why the Infatuation holds this place in high praise.

Best Vietnamese sandwich in San Francisco! The sandwiches are not as good as the San Jose one, but in term of the prices, quality of bread and the portions, it‚Äôs worth to give it a try even though it‚Äôs located in Tenderloin. Combo and pork are just ok. Chicken is the best. The bread is fresh. I like how soft it‚Äôs, not too hard as others. Cash only. Open at 7am.
Be cautious to be there because there are many homeless around.

top_10.name: Sandy's
top_10.address: 1457 Haight St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA
testimonials: After spending the morning Slingshoting nonconformists out in the panhandle with One Eyed Jack and his son Little Peeper we walked up Haight to Sandy's for one of those world famous sandwiches.  Probably the most underrated sandwich joint in the city!   5 stars  ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ

Food was not bad...maybe i dont usually have this style...I think if you like more meaty tastes ..you will like it. I like a more balanced sandwich. Egg sandwich was a no frills type of sandwich. Service was nice and small eating area...we were treated well.

It's a heavy lift to live up to one's childhood memories of having a muffuletta in New Orleans - taken there by my own Sicilian family, but Sandy does so and improves on it. Starting with the most important thing, the sandwich (I had 1 slice of the Meat version with a side of slaw and chips). the meat and cheese is  layered neatly and generously, the paste and juices are flavorful without being overwhelming, and the bread is the major improvement having put it through a press it is lightly crisp on the top keeping it a reasonable thickness for even the most modest mouth.

The service was friendly, accommodating and passionate about their product. You feel welcome.

The atmosphere is simple, unique and cozy. Less hole in the wall and more a comfortable spot to sit and enjoy. Unique stickers, flags, and the like give you a sense of the roots of those working there.

I noticed they sell to-go versions neatly boxed up - more stylish cannoli box than a pizza carton. I am scheming on a chance to buy a full sandwich for a party or anything.

My only want is a second shop further south on the peninsula so it'd be easy for me to eat at Sandy's regularly.

top_10.name: Deli Board
top_10.address: 1058 Folsom St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials: I went with a friend and stood in line for about an hour. The staff were quick and kind in getting our order. It is a tall sandwich rather than a long sandwich. The food is amazing, but I'm not sure if I'd wait the line for a sandwich again. It is a treat and less of a staple kind of sandwich shop.

The Mick and the Rach are my solid go to's.   Never had a bad sandwhich and the line is worth the wait!     Beats Ike's , he even was there eating on my latest trip into the city for great food!

Another trip has me trying the Bradley! Amazing these guys dont miss!   Love this place!

The 49er is the best sandwich I've had in SF. Sooo delicious! One caveat is that it's a 1/2 sandwich cut in half, pretty much 6 inches. All the photos make the sandwiches look like they're stuffed with meat, and they are stuffed in the middle, but the ends are basically bare. I would need two of these to be satisfied, so it ends up being a $60 lunch after a drink and a tip. Is it worth it? Absolutely. Would I do it regularly? Probably not, but the line is down the block so they can charge what they want!

I like that you have to show up - no online or phone orders, keeps it moving. Staff was friendly and efficient.

Also had the breakfast sandwich. Definitely one of the best around except for the Dutch crunch. Just a horrible bread choice. After a few bites I actually picked the bread off and ate the majority without bread. Next time will go with sweet french and omit the bacon. However, at $21 and no possibility of ordering before 11am, not sure I'd bother in the future.

I really like the counter service atmosphere, but wish they'd clear off the benches and standing tables in the windows so you could enjoy your sandwich on-site. Having to immediately leave and find a place to sit down nearby is difficult unless you don't mind the smell of urine while you eat.

top_10.name: Parkside Market Sandwich & Liquor
top_10.address: 1600 Hayes St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA
testimonials:
The BEST Deli Sandwich I have ever had!!
If you are in San Fran make your way to these guys you will not be dissapointed.
Loved the sandwich!! The owner, Anil, was super nice and very friendly. Highly recommended

I live nearby and have seen the ownership change multiple times. Even after multiple changes the corner store remains friendly and affordable. Never have an issue with finding anything. There is a chill vibe in the store that makes it ideal if you need something quick.
Negatives: they close around 9:30 which is a little early but not much of an issue
Positives: friendly and welcoming clean store and good selection of products.

top_10.name: Bite
top_10.address: 912 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: This is the first time I've captured photos of all food items for a review. Normally, I don't hold out on the grub down. This was a late night order (after midnight) ‚Äî so I wasn't expecting to receive their best work. I am blown away by the freshness, quality ingredients, and careful preparation of the food received. Let's keep it real, when ordering food so late I come across end-of-day stragglers that sat awhile, dried out, becoming stale, and quickly thrown together before closing. The food I received from Bite was made to order, and the rotisserie chicken was fresh (did I already mention this was after midnight!?). Bite won another customer for life! Thank you for serving hearty and nutritious food of this quality, especially for night owls. Keep these folks in business!!!

Ordered a recommendation from the employee behind the counter, it was a good sandwich with plenty of fillings, slightly over sauced hence the 4 stars. Prices are in line with other deli sandwich shops. Whilst visiting the shop wasn‚Äôt busy and the sandwich didn‚Äôt take too long to make. Would recommend if you need a quick bite after touring SF

I was staying at Hotel Julian next door and fell in love with this place! The girls were so sweet and made the best sandwiches and wraps. The Cuban should be permanently on the menu! It was delicious. The California Hillbilly was phenomenal as well with a little kick. I had that with spinach tortilla. The cookie, pickle, potato salad, and humous were all amazing as well. Highly recommend!

top_10.name: Lush Gelato
top_10.address: 520 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
testimonials: Great gelato! Their flavors are unique and it‚Äôs very rich. The sorbet was so creamy for a sorbet. I loved it! I got the chocolate pomegranate and it had chunks of delicious chocolate and the pomegranate brightened it up.
I almost forgot to take a picture, it was so cream and delicious. I got dulce de leche and raisins flavor. I wish they had the passion fruit flavor when I was there.
Visited SF out of town to celebrate a milestone birthday. Some of the best gelato I've ever had the dulce leche and black/white trio was creamy and delicious üòã!

top_10.name: Philmore Creamery
top_10.address: 1840 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
testimonials: Their pistachio and gianduia crunch gelatos are to die for! Probably, the best gelato in SF! Pro tip: Visit this small business if you're in Fillmore over Salt n Straw!

Really outstanding gelato that essentially taste like the European version I live. It‚Äôs very hard to find good gelato in the states but Philmore comes very close. The salted caramel is particularly wonderful as well as the pistachio. They are generous with their scoops and prices are reasonable unlike my experience with salt and straw where I paid for the ‚Äúkitchen sink‚Äù for $16 and got three tiny half scoops of ice cream!! This is a hundred times better!!!

Quality ice cream and great flavors- signed up for their rewards program and will be coming back! They let you try samples. Run if you want the strawberry shortcake flavor bc I was told it‚Äôll be gone soon. Went with a friend and we both got a small cup with half matcha blackberry and half strawberry shortcake. Surprisingly, I liked the strawberry shortcake the best though both were good.
The insides are small and though there‚Äôs some seating inside, there‚Äôs not much so be prepared to take your ice cream for a walk.

top_10.name: Garden Creamery
top_10.address: 3566 20th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials: Tried the Vanilla Lilikoi, a delightful blend of creamy vanilla and tangy passion fruit, and absolutely loved the flavour. The place has a fantastic vibe, and as a dog lover, I really appreciated the dog themed decor.

Delicious ice cream.   When it comes to scoop generosity, at the least it's delicious.

Parking is non existent.   During the day or during the evening hours,  forget about finding a spot.   Scooter?  No parking problems.

Still one of my favorite ice cream spots in the City.

good selection of flavors! its a lil crazy for two scoops of ice cream to cost 7 dollars tho üòÖ tried four flavors: thai tea, salty kaya, biscoff, and black sesame. the thai tea is incredibly good, so creamy, and its vegan! the salty kaya's unique, almost reminiscent of a salted cream foam with a subtle hint of pandan/coconut. def recommend those two flavors!

top_10.name: Marco Polo Italian Ice Cream
top_10.address: 3886 Noriega St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA
testimonials: I‚Äôve heard of this place for a long time. The interior was very clean and bright with some space to sit. Their flavors were amazing. They‚Äôre definitely unique and tropical. The staff let us tried a couple flavors and all of them were really impressive. They were like juice burst in your mouth. The price was also very good. We were able to get three flavors with the medium cup and he gave us a decent amount. I would definitely recommend trying the pandan leaf and mangosteen. And I can‚Äôt wait to come back to try more.

We‚Äôve been here about four times and everytime the staff is sooooo genuinely nice and helpful. I always love the black sesame, taro, pandan, and coffee. Tried the mangosteen for the first time and it was great after a heavy dinner!! Flavors are all good and made with fresh ingredients. The best part is their staff though, they always have a big smile from the moment you walk in and recommend flavors that you may like or want samples. When talking to friends they say the same thing about their customer service and how above and beyond they always go with such great energy. I wish i could rate them higher than 5 stars!!!

My fiance and I love this since we were growing up. Some of the best ice cream you have and tons of asian flavors like Guava, thai tea, red bean or durian. If you are not from SF and you want to see where locals come for ice cream, this is literally it. Get some ice cream and stroll down the beach and enjoy the sunset. It'll make you want to buy a whole tub to bring home. This is worth it.

top_10.name: Mitchell's Ice Cream
top_10.address: 688 San Jose Ave, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials: The best ice cream I've had. The creaminess and smoothness of it all is next to none. Unlike other ice cream varietals, store bought or not, thejr ice cream does not ice out when put in the freezer because of it's fat content. The place is popular enough that they use a ticketing system. You should ignore any line you see and grab a ticket expeditiously. I've tried most of their flavors and I can tell you, their rum raisin is supreme. It's made with two rums. Their lychee is amazing too but I could just be a harlot for lychee. The avocado is novel and amazing to eat in-person. Getting a gallon of it loses a significant amount of the strong avocado flavor found in the fresh version. None of the other flavors I've tried have experience this. Their gallons are strong but the the kids are prone to break by the time you're about 90% done with them. The place has a stickiness to it but they do actually clean it so it's probably a mental stickiness. They're really patient with you as you try all of their flavors and the workers are pretty straightforward with you too about hand-scopped vs. pre-scooped. Honestly, the only thing I would get hand-scooped now is probably the avocado if the batch you just tasted was good.

Mitchell's is in my top three for ice cream brands/spots. They somehow make the perfect ube ice cream (for my tastes). It's not too sweetened that it overbears the taste of the yam, but not too bland, and with the right milkiness. I think there are actual ube bits in it, too. That's the flavor I've been getting ever since I first came, because it is just so good. What's even better is being able to take tubs of this stuff home. It's the best. They don't just offer ice cream, but also halo-halo, sundaes, floats, other treats and sweets. Their menu is so varied and even has vegan options!

The only issue I see with Mitchell's is its limited space. There's hardly any room to stand during busy hours, both outside and inside, and there's no real seating. I guess it adds to its charm, though. Overall, 4/5.

I loved that they have parking in the back because that‚Äôs a huge deal in SF. Their flavors are very unique, I tried the Thai tea which was amazing as was the espresso toffee crunch. My wife really liked their chocolate caramel crunch flavor too. I was excited to try their ube but unfortunately I sampled it and tasted pretty much no ube flavor it was just purple lol. But I‚Äôd def recommend Mitchell‚Äôs for anybody that wants good ice cream in the area or wants to switch up from the usual flavors

top_10.name: Salt & Straw
top_10.address: 586 Hayes St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials:
Got two flavors split scoop: Cinnamon Snickerdoodle and Sea Salt w/ Caramel Ribbons. I think the value is decent and it was definitely a lot of ice cream for a me.

Got to sample a ton of flavors that were very interesting, including: Strawberry Honey Balsamic, Goat Cheese Marionberry Habanero, and pickled cucumber Sorbet.

It was kinda dirty in this area (streets/sidewalk) and also dirty inside (tables and floors). But it seemed clean behind the counter, so I wasn‚Äôt worried about the ice cream being contaminated.

We love this ice cream place not just because of their delicious flavors. They always have, or because of the monthly new flavors that they cook up all the time. But we also love it because they always have vegan options. We don‚Äôt do well with dairy, so we‚Äôre always willing to take dairy pills to have these delicious flavors. But we also love that they are vegan flavors are also high-quality! It‚Äôs nothing fancy, it‚Äôs just ice cream. But they do it very well.

I had one scoop of the goat cheese berry habanero and the coffee and nuts (half half). They were good. Not overly sweet at all. I also tried (sample) olive oil and pear blue cheese. They were good but not distinct flavors for the names. Def come back. Love it. Have outdoor seating. Perfect for a warm sunny day.

top_10.name: Salt & Straw
top_10.address: 2201 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
testimonials: Joey was amazing! My group was large but he took the time to explain the flavors and accommodate us with all the samples we asked for. So incredibly kind and accommodating of all of us. I‚Äôd come back here for sure!
Good ice cream, simple shop, it is more of a "buy and walk" kind of place, with very limited sitting. They have about 3~4 sits, that's it! So don't expect to be able to sit.

Ice cream is a whole experience for us, not just a scoop.  The Salt and Straw staff is friendly and concerned with fixing glitches‚Ä¶.but management isn‚Äôt.  That‚Äôs why you‚Äôre reading this review.  I reached out to avoid talking about our repetitive ripoffs in purchasing the pints of Salt and Straw at 3 locations:  Hayes Street, Fillmore Street, and Burlingame Avenue.  Since the same problem has been pervasive from November 2024 through October 2025, we‚Äôve concluded it‚Äôs an operational problem with packing.  The quality oversite sucks.  Here‚Äôs the story:  we‚Äôre an ice cream group, who loves Salt and Straw.  I met the founder at the Ferry Building years ago, and became ultra impressed in the youth business model.  I‚Äôve promoted Salt and Straw countless times.  Our ice cream group meets monthly and has fun with ‚Äútastings‚Äù.  Our family also has pints in the freezer because we‚Äôre hooked on some of the vegan selections.  In our group, We always have 2 Salt and Straw flavors.  Our surprise discovery each month was finding a huge gap, hole, whatever you want to call it in the pint.  The ice cream is not packed to full density.  And in some cases, no wonder it felt half empty because it was‚Ä¶in the middle.  What a ripoff.  Our group finally moved on.  Suggest Salt and Straw gets some packing training from Bi-Rite and others.  It was even clear that one of our containers had melted ice cream that had reformed.
When I dropped by Fillmore street a couple weeks ago to let them know this long-term issue, our hope was that they‚Äôd listen and be thankful for the heads up.  Plus, correct the situation.  Then, we‚Ä¶.and subsequently others, could return for pints.  The manager did reach out and ask what date and time (singular) we had the problem.  Whatta joke.  Was this AI ?  We‚Äôve sent  ‚ÄúCharlie‚Äù two emails since.  No response.  Who wants to in effect pay double the price for a fraud pint of ice cream that is only half that, in several cases.  Stick with the single scoops that are assembled nicely by the hardworking, enthusiastic,  front-line employees.

top_10.name: Swensen's
top_10.address: 1999 Hyde St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: Excellent ice cream and fast service. I loved the strawberry flavor and we also had the swiss ice cream and orange. This shop is old and looks vintage!

We tried the banana and Turkish coffee, would recommend either! Not too sweet. There was a line of about 10 people on a weekend afternoon, but it moved quickly and we were served within 5 mins. Fair price for the quantity and quality.

I was zooming around (or pushing) my uber scooter around SF and stumbled across this ice cream parlour. Such a lovely place, historic I wanted to try all the flavours. A genuine and historical place to visit, so glad I was up in the hills to be able to visit.

top_10.name: Amorino Gelato - San Francisco
top_10.address: 338 Grant Ave, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
testimonials:
A must visit if you are in the neighborhood. The flavours are delicious. They create the ice cream flowers with perfection, seemingly effortlessly, but surely with lots of patience and expertise. I went twice in 3 days!
Thank you.

Delicious gelato indeed!
I loved the natural flavors of pistachio, blueberry and coconut. The macaroon was amazing too!
They did tell me to come back after an hour to taste mango gelato but I couldn't wait that long. Hopefully next time! üòâ

The best gelato I have tried. I feel like I hadn't had real gelato until I came here. The texture is  smooth and the gelato doesn't melt fast. The flavors are natural, balanced, not too sweet and no nonsense additives as far as I can detect. The price is very reasonable. I will come back.

top_10.name: Polly Ann Ice Cream
top_10.address: 3138 Noriega St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA
testimonials: Line moved quickly and when it's your turn they're very nice and helpful. They have AMAZING flavors and a variety of sizes. Best cotton candy I've had in my life. Something for everyone! Definitely check out this neighborhood gem.

Polly Ann has the best black sesame ice cream (imo) and I'll keep coming back for it when I visit SF! It's nutty and creamy - super sesame-forward which I like.

I also appreciate the huge variety of flavors they have. The wheel is also super fun.

stopped by for a treat on my way to the beach & it didn‚Äôt disappoint! they have a lot of different ice cream flavours- some common, some a little less common, some unique to this shop. they also have cookies & coffee plus cakes & pints in the freezer. i got a single scoop of pandan in a waffle bowl & it was just what i wanted. very nice & helpful staff too :)

top_10.name: Pacific Cocktail Haven
top_10.address: 550 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
testimonials: I liked the ambiance of this place, the combination of sitting and standing room plus the outside space was nice. Cocktails were really creative and I liked that wait staff came around to take orders so you're not crowding the bar area.

I stopped in on a Monday evening for the Miracle pop-up and had such a great experience. I hadn‚Äôt been to this bar before, but the staff made me feel welcome right away ‚Äî friendly, attentive, and honestly superior service. The cocktails were creative and really well made, and even though I came alone, I felt completely comfortable and taken care of. Such a fun spot with great energy. I‚Äôm so glad I checked it out and would definitely come back!

What a beautiful bar - bumping on a Saturday night. My favorite thing is the beautiful gated front patio seating, on both sides, there‚Äôs seating for groups and or small groups. The don‚Äôt patio is surrounded by living plant walls, which is gorgeous! Inside is very lovely but depending on what your scene is, it can be too crowded. The 3 of us enjoyed the fresh air and gated front patio. Fun crafted drinks and attentive service.

top_10.name: Smuggler's Cove
top_10.address: 650 Gough St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials: Very fun place. Definitely my favorite stop for the night. Very crowded, but we got our drinks fast and they were delicious!!

A solid tiki bar and ambience is great. Good classics, strong spins on new drinks, and a great place to enjoy with a few friends. This was the first place my wife and I went to after we got engaged. POETIC

I don‚Äôt understand what the 1-star reviews talking about. The service was amazing. After telling the barkeeper once my name he called me after my name. Our drinks were done under 10min. Very friendly stuff.
I can recommend to come before the rush like around 9pm. It‚Äôs easy to spent there 3-4h.

top_10.name: Blackbird
top_10.address: 2124 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA
testimonials: One of my favorite spots! Great happy hour and all the drinks are delicious. Friendly bartenders, quick service, good ambiance (lighting that‚Äôs moody but doesn‚Äôt make you feel like you need an eye exam), and plenty of seating. What‚Äôs not to love?
We went to this bar for a business mixer. The atmosphere is incredible. The staff is super friendly. The drinks were spot on. We will definitely go back!

Came in at 7pm on Saturday night - lively crowd. Great atmosphere and good service.  Even have a pool table in back. Eclectic design combined with cocktail lounge atmosphere. Drink menu are seasonal with interesting ingredients. The drinks are solid and flavorful.

top_10.name: Cityscape
top_10.address: 333 O'Farrell St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials: This is a beautiful rooftop bar with beautiful views of San Francisco. I ordered a drink and it was really good. The staff was very friendly and the atmosphere felt calm and comfortable. The chips were a bit overpriced but the dip was good.

Best rooftop of SF, and don‚Äôt say this lightly, I have been here for 10 years.! It is really the only one with real 360 degree views. It‚Äôs spacious and really well set up. Decor section is a bit old but I‚Äôll say that‚Äôs part of the charm.
Service is great. Max was hilarious and super helpful. Made us remember what good American service used to be.
Good drink selection (very reasonable prices for SF, specially if you go by the bottle!) and not crowded
Will be back and really enjoyed it.

General vibe isn‚Äôt bad for a first time experience. They did play random hip hop music that didn‚Äôt seem very fitting for this kind of setting. Only got 2 things and for $60 in total, isn‚Äôt worth it. The drink didn‚Äôt hit at all, not even a buzz and I‚Äôm a lightweight. $35 for 3 slices of cheese and meat and stiff bread is crazy work. Mind you, in my photo we had barely started picking at it. I‚Äôm looking back at another person‚Äôs photo of the charcuterie board in previous reviews, and it definitely did not look the same as what I received. No one was attentive the entire time we were at our table. We had to ask some random worker, not even sure if he was a server, to give us our bill which he also had the audacity to ask for us to leave a tip. But why tip when the bare minimum and expectations weren‚Äôt met and literally no one worked for it. There was minimal interaction with any employees so I‚Äôm not sure what‚Äôs there to tip for. I would only recommend to stop by just for the view cause that‚Äôs the only selling point. Other than that, don‚Äôt bother wasting your money on food or drinks.

top_10.name: Owl Tree
top_10.address: 601 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: Classic SanFran bar atmosphere. Don't pass this one up. The Manhattans are great

The bartender recommended the lychee martini & the cucumber mint gimlet. Both were absolutely delicious. Music was on point the whole time. I really liked this place! Walked here from the Hilton no problem.

The Owl Tree is such a hidden gem in San Francisco that I almost don‚Äôt want to share it! We hosted our wedding welcome party in their upstairs space, and it was perfect. Adrianna, the events manager, is wonderful‚Äîshe‚Äôs incredibly responsive and so easy to work with. She and the entire team took such great care of us, and everything ran smoothly from start to finish.

The space itself is private (including a private bathroom), full of SF charm, and incredibly reasonably priced for what you get. Our guests had a great time, and we‚Äôre already thinking of excuses to host another event here in the future.

Pro tip: order the cucumber gimlet and the espresso martini‚Äîyou won‚Äôt regret it.

Can‚Äôt recommend The Owl Tree enough!

top_10.name: Bourbon & Branch
top_10.address: 501 Jones St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials: My husband and I have been coming here since we were dating and it is always the most perfect way to the end the night. Service is always fantastic. They have an extensive drink menu, and the staff know it well, offer recommendations and guide you through it. The cocktails are excellent, with classics on the menu, as well as very unique combinations. You can tell there is quite a bit of craftsmanship in each drink. The cocktails are also priced well.

If you're looking for a fun, immersive experience that transports you straight back to the 1920s Prohibition era, this speakeasy-style bar is a must-visit. From the moment you arrive, it feels like you are stepping into a secret world. There's no sign - just a mysterious door and a doorbell. Ring it, give the password, and you're in.

Reservations are required, and the exclusivity adds to the charm. Once inside, you're seated at a cozy table and handed an impressively large cocktail and spirits menu. My friend and I went on a Saturday night around 9:30pm and were surprised by how relaxed and uncrowded it was.

The seasonal drink menu is incredibly creative, ad the staff were fantastic - patient, knowledgeable, and happy to walk us through the options. The service was top-notch, and the ambiance was spot-on for the era. Dim lighting, vintage decor, and a vibe that makes you want to stay awhile.

I tried a few cocktails, but the standout for me was the Heavy Artillery - bold, balanced, and unforgettable. There are a few house rules that help preserve the experience: 1. Be discreet with cell phone usage 2. No flash photography and 3. Remain seated and enjoy the era.

Overall, we had a fantastic time and would absolutely go back. It's not just a bar - it's an experience!

One of the more well-known speakeasies in SF. you‚Äôll need a password to get in (just make a reservation to get it). Cool concept, but honestly, I was expecting more.

The drinks were average, the decor didn‚Äôt stand out, and the service was just okay. It feels like the hype is mostly around the ‚Äúsecret‚Äù entrance, not the actual experience.

It‚Äôs a quiet spot, which makes it good for date nights, but there are definitely better bars in SF if you‚Äôre going for standout cocktails or atmosphere.

top_10.name: The House Of Shields
top_10.address: 39 New Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA
testimonials: Ver cool old-school bar. It was very quiet at 3pm on a Thursday. I had a Manhattan, which was delicious. Recommended!

One of the oldest bars in SF, very interesting drinks and good vibes.
Much smaller than I expected.

Great place to grab a drink after work or after a visit to SFMOMA.
Classic San Francisco vibe that takes you back to post 1906 earthquake San Francisco when the city was rebuilding.
You wouldn‚Äôt be surprised to see Sam Spade and a bunch of guys in fedoras nursing their drinks here.

top_10.name: Trick Dog
top_10.address: 3010 20th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials: Between my cousin and I, we tried 8 cocktails ü´£and all were SOOOOO good. The bartender KB was also fantastic. We also got the fries which were divine! The only thing is that after 4 cocktails you‚Äôd think I‚Äôd be hammered and I was barely buzzed.

Trick Dog is such a fun and creative spot! It‚Äôs a themed bar that switches things up every six months ‚Äî last time I went, it was a poetry theme, and yesterday they had a space  theme. The menu is always super inventive, with cocktail names that match the theme perfectly. Drinks are delicious, the vibe is lively, and the music adds to the energy without being too loud. Definitely one of those places that keeps things fresh and makes you want to come back just to see what they‚Äôll dream up next.

Trick Dog was super fun. The menu was circus themed, with each drink printed on its own postcard. The drinks were extremely creative and interesting.

Our server was funny, playful, and even pulled a tablecloth out from under some glasses at the table next to us when nobody was even watching - I just noticed out of the corner of my eye as it happened. Just a quirky dude being a quirky dude. Love to see it.

The food was great, though the menu is limited, everything we had was delicious. The "Doggy" sauce is the secret that makes everything tick. It's tangy, spicy, mustardy. A great sauce. The burger and dog in particular are great sandwiches. Also the kale salad is comically large.

Overall just a fun, if a bit pricey, spot to have a few drinks and a few good bites.

top_10.name: Evil Eye
top_10.address: 2937 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials: Eclectic vibe, creative and delicious cocktails (I usually get the smoked Paloma) but they have quite a variety. The mood lighting, music that isn‚Äôt too loud and no TVs (but still a pool table) makes this an amazing first date spot or a hang with an old friend. Good way to leave an impression.

Don't raise your eyebrows or give me the evil look, the evil eye hits its mark. It has a cool vibe, attracting a wide range of customers from young to old. It's loungey, it's low key but the cocktails are high class.  The bartenders know their craft and make you feel at home.  You can chill out or do some remote work.  Play some pool or chat up a new face.  I didn't try their food but their drink selection was worth the trip.  Next time I ll sample their food .

If you are looking for a bar with a cool vibe, unique food and drinks. You should try this place. The staff was friendly and the drink and was was really good. Not typical bar food. More upscale. I went in a Friday around 5:30 it was empty but by time I left at 9 it was packed! Definitely worth a try

top_10.name: Tunnel Top Lounge and Bar
top_10.address: 601 Bush St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA
testimonials: Brought my hinge date on here for the first time, I reckon it‚Äôs the best spot in sf. Alex the bartender truly put me to the best drinks, she curated a drink exactly for my taste buds. Will be bringing all my hinge dates here. Shoutout Antonio for the funny jokes.

Stopped in here on a whim. It was a Thursday evening, so it wasn‚Äôt very busy. The staff is friendly and the drinks are great. I asked for something irregular and off the menu, and with a quick explanation the bartender put it together and it was excellent. Highly recommended.
Great music, great drinks and even more amazing prices. If you're looking for some rare whiskey for a great price, check out their top shelf. Pappy, Thomas H Handy, etc. They even offer flights.

top_10.name: Prime BBQ
top_10.address: 33 W 25th Ave, San Mateo, CA 94403, USA
testimonials: Managed to get a last-minute reservation and felt quite lucky! The restaurant even followed up to confirm our arrival. The service was excellent‚Äîthey even poured the sake for us. I loved the heated tray on the table that kept our skewers warm; it‚Äôs such a thoughtful touch. The menu has plenty of options, and though the place is small, it feels very cozy and atmospheric. The upside-down umbrellas hanging from the ceiling are a unique touch. One thing to note: it‚Äôs quite dim inside, so it‚Äôs a bit hard to take photos. If you're taking a group shot, watch out for blurriness!
The food is great and tasty. The bathroom is clean not smelly. The only problem is the parking, you'll have to find it and walk a little further.

Had such a great time at Prime BBQ in San Mateo! We ordered the veggie fried rice, cucumber salad, mentaiko stir-fried udon with shrimp, vermicelli scallop with garlic, grilled oyster with garlic, and a bunch of skewers - shishito pepper, wagyu steak with uni, beef tongue, and chicken meatball. We also tried the Thai tea (with the cutest bear on top ) and a bottle of Kubota ‚ÄúSenjyu.‚Äù

Everything was tasty, but my absolute favorite was the mentaiko udon, the beef tongue skewers, and the chicken meatball.
Also, don‚Äôt miss their $2 lunch specials (Fri‚ÄìSun) for oysters, abalone, and scallops.  Super cute space with Labubu decor and a big sake selection.

top_10.name: Capelo's Barbecue
top_10.address: 2655 Middlefield Rd, Redwood City, CA 94063, USA
testimonials:
Fantastic service, food and venue! Five stars all the way!
Brisket was phenomenal with perfect rendering, perfect fat layer and bark. Cheddar&Jalape√±o sausage and chicken (dark meat) was also 5/5 - easy!
No doubt I will be coming back and anyone who love Texas BBQ needs to pay them a visit!ü§†

This place is serious about barbecue. You can see just from the wood pile to smoke the meat. The food is fantastic! We got various meats and everything is smoky and tender. I am particularly amazed with pulled pork. The meat is chunky rather than stringy, yet it is super tender and, to my preference, not sweet. The mac and cheese is thick, so as sauces. The slaw is refreshing as well. Oh pickles and macerated onions are free to grab!  Capelo is now become a place when I think of barbecue in Peninsula if not the whole bay area!

Delicious barbecue joint in Redwood City. The beef brisket was amazingly soft and moist, possibly the best brisket I‚Äôve had on the Peninsula. Pulled pork was juicy, and the Mac and cheese and creamed corn were both very good. Fast and friendly service. Small parking lot with limited parking, though.

top_10.name: Wagon Wheel Barbecue
top_10.address: 861 Leong Dr, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA
testimonials:
Really really good BBQ meat, tasty, tender, loved it. The service was good too.
Great portion and it was priced reasonably.
Would 100% visit again!

Really good spot for a quick and comforting lunch! As a visitor to this city and country I must say I felt very comfortable here! Feels truly authentic and it was absolutely delicious, the staff helped us with the menu in a very kind way.

For 3, we ordered a meal of Ribs with 2 sides that were Cole slaw and Mc and cheese, the ribs were stunning! The sides were ok, nothing out of the ordinary.

Dishes and glasses were disposable which I am not a fan of.

It was an enjoyable lunch!

The pork ribs were just amazing! Probably one of the best ones I‚Äôve tried in my life. The beef brisket was a bit underwhelming - in my opinion it had way too much fat even though I love far generally. The Cole slaw was fine although a bit acidic. The interior was utterly basic, and the cutlery and the plates were disposable. Overall not cheap price-wise but still good quality and I recommend this place if you are around

top_10.name: Baby Blues BBQ
top_10.address: 3149 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials:
I'm not typically going for a BBQ joint but I think the warm weather or the moon position sort gave me the feeling of trying Baby Blues.  Honestly I'm happy I went and it for sure didn't give me the blues.  Yes the place is rustic some might call it funky but it works.  I like the big L shaped bar in the middle on which you can sit from both sides. That somehow gives you the opportunity to strike up conversations with random other guests or just enjoy the moment by yourself.
I tried their Cesar salad Mac and Cheese and pulled pork shoulder sandwich.  I like that the pork wasn't smothered in sauce .  Sauces came on the side so to each its own.  You can bathe in them, simply dip or forgo them.

The presentation is rather smartly done.  The Caesar , oh well it's a Caesar not much to say about it.  The mac and cheese was rather tasty but could have stayed in the oven a bit longer to make it a bit less saucy.  The pulled pork was tasty. I didn't care for the brioche as it loses its texture too quickly.   I'd love to try it on a French baguette or a sourdough roll with a crust and id add gruyere.  Again the sandwich was good it just gave me ideas on how I'd try to enhance it.

Well done thanks chef

Hands down the best brisket I‚Äôve had in years, It was so tender it practically fell apart. I had it with cornbread and mac & cheese, and even finished my friend‚Äôs Caesar. Not a single complaint. Our server went above and beyond and brought us some whiskey on the house since they didn‚Äôt have our drinks of choice. I‚Äôll definitely be back to try more sides (and, obviously, more brisket).

Solid lunch option for this region of SF ~ Good, not great BBQ in SF. Very clean and inviting bbq joint with TV's.  One of the few places around open at noon for lunch. The fries are thick cut and overflowing. The Brisket sandwich itself is solid but not impressive, good quality BBQ sauces. Staff is friendly; A great place with a good value. $21 for the Brisket Sando and fries. They also serve a diverse selection of Craft beer. Friendly staff, great beer selection all in cans and therefore overpriced. $9 pint cans of craft SF beers. The brisket combo plate was good, the sauces carried the meal.. for SF solid BBQ, relatively appropriately priced. Not s place that will impress you by any means. But a Solid option

top_10.name: NORTHERN CHINA BBQ
top_10.address: 294 9th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials: Decent skewers. Good amount of seating. Service is quick. Wished they had the tray to keep the skewers warm.

5/5 SO SO YUMMYYY!!! This hit the spot üòçüò© We actually came here after another meal that we weren‚Äôt satisfied with. The best were 1. Chicken skewers and 2. Taiwanese sausage skewers. The seaweed salad was also excellent. Next time we‚Äôll come for a proper meal and get some much more!

Decent Northern China style dishes ‚Äî extensive selection of various barbecue skewers (meat, seafood, mushroom, veg) reminiscent of Mainland Chinese street food.

Lamb Skewer is slightly gamey, dusted with the classic cumin-paprika seasoning. Enjoy with cold side dishes such as the standard Smashed Cucumber. Sliced Beef in Chili Sauce is fragrant from Sichuan peppercorn and chilis.

top_10.name: Smoking Pig BBQ
top_10.address: 1144 N 4th St, San Jose, CA 95112, USA
testimonials: Great BBQ spot. Very casual. Plenty of parking (dedicated lot, some street parking). Great place to have lunch and enjoy some ribs, brisket and soda. Meat combo platters are reasonable and they include cornbread and a side. The sides are delicious. I had the potato salad today.

The real deal is Smoking Pig BBQ that features flavors and huge smokers!

Let‚Äôs begin with the service which was quick, friendly conversation, and overall ok. It was a little interesting walking in you think you would order at the register then we were asked to sit first then someone came to serve us.

The atmosphere is rough, rugged, bbq style feel, and diner type of look as well. The restaurant wasn‚Äôt as clean as I would like it. You can see the bbq bottles are worn.

Now onto the Main Event: the Food! The burnt ends were full flavor and good sauce 8.5/10. The pulled pork could have been warmer but the flavors and seasoning were on point 8/10. Fries were solid as they should be 8.5/10. The bbq chicken was good but could be improved on flavors 6.5/10. The cornbread and butter spread was really good 9/10. Overall this place is worth a try, places that smoke they have long cool times were can hinder flavors an heat depending on when you come so I always suggest multiple meats. Cheers!!!

wow, a great no-nonsense Texas BBQ place. slow smoked ribs where the meat falls off the bone, potato salad, cornbread, brisket, four kinds of sauce, and a roll of paper towel on your table. we also got a plate of Wolf Turds as an appetizer: crazy name for three jalape√±o peppers, stuffed with sausage and cheese, wrapped in bacon, and roasted. very delicious.

we got the large combo ribs with brisket and extra sides. more than enough for two, plus leftovers.

Lots of booths, super friendly service, mellow blues music, very laid back in a casual place, with lots of parking.

top_10.name: 4505 Burgers & BBQ
top_10.address: 705 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA
testimonials:
Tony told me to come...
The brisket plate was delicious. Lovely sides of slaw and hot fries. The vanilla milkshake was delicious.
The outdoor seating was less comfortable in late November, but you just need to bring a big coat.

We ordered the beef brisket plate with spicy fries and beans. The beans were the surprise standout‚Äîrich and delicious. The fries had a nice kick, but the brisket itself was just okay‚Äîchewy and a bit tough, not something I‚Äôd rush back for.
The outdoor seating with wooden benches is dog-friendly, though it can get noisy with kids running around and dogs barking. I did appreciate the convenience of having a QR code with the table number to order anything extra once seated. On the bright side, the service was friendly and attentive.

So I‚Äôve been here before and always loved the brisket, but today was the first time I tried the lunch taco happy hour, and WOW it blew my mind. The brisket tacos are so flavorful, the salsa so fresh, and the corn tortillas delicious. This place is a little pricey, and the tacos are definitely small for the cost, but they make up for it in flavor and quality!

top_10.name: Breakwater Barbecue
top_10.address: 10151 Cabrillo Hwy, El Granada, CA 94018, USA
testimonials: Had some delicious brisket and cornbread here. They have a large menu with many different meat options but it sells out quickly so stop for lunch. The sausage was also delicious. Spacious indoor and outdoor seating options available. Located right across the highway 1 from the beautiful Pacific Ocean. Enjoy the good food and great views.

Awesome barbecue in front of the beach! The restaurant serves various types of meats in southern style, sandwiches and has a great variety of beers. I tried the brisket and it was very tender and juicy, highly recommend. The trays come with two sides of your choice‚Äîit‚Äôs a lot food so keep that in mind. The prices were pretty fair considering it‚Äôs quality and their location a few steps from the beach, their patio is awesome having a beer and try their amazing barbecue.

Decent BBQ at this charming location in Half Moon Bay. Beautifully renovated and well-decorated interior, this bright and airy restaurant serves good brisket and Mac & Cheese. The beans and cabbage was bland, though. Large patio area that is ideal for hanging with friends and dogs on a sunny afternoon. Plenty of beers to choose from. Fast and friendly service. Large free parking lot.

top_10.name: Hardwood Bar & Smokery
top_10.address: 680 8th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
testimonials:
That burger was fire . BBQ was good too.
They have a very solid spirits menu. Ive already told a couple of people about this place

So sad. The meat is super dry, ribs are tough and brisket is wayyyy too dry to have such thick cuts. Sides are amazing and sauces are great, just a shame the meat was really not impressive. Service was nice, but we couldn't get the check for a while on a normal Saturday afternoon after already getting to-go boxes. Atmosphere is great! Great music and space.

Came on a very busy day with it being Folsom street fair weekend, but the staff was rushing around to make sure everyone was taken care of. Their food, and especially their blackened catfish - fantastic!!! Was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of BBQ here, especially being in SF. 100% will return

top_10.name: International Smoke San Francisco
top_10.address: 301 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA
testimonials: Had a great time here with friends. I had the Gentleman‚Äôs Manhattan - amazing drink. Mostly because of the fantastic bourbon. The smoke presentation is pretty cool too. The appetizers were delicious. The entrees were savory, flavorful and perfectly cooked. Prices are reasonable. Amazing experience.

I‚Äôve been here a few times, the menu updates and it‚Äôs always delicious. The waiters are very friendly and knowledgeable with the menu and making sure you have a good experience.

I would recommend for happy hour or date night! They also have a nice atrium for private events.

I went for my Birthday 11/27/25 and it was buffet style due to it being Thanksgiving. üôÑ

What i will say is the atmosphere is nice however the food selection was not up to part.
I was disappointed but it was Thanksgiving. Thinking back I should have cooked but it was my Birthday!

Sadly the jalape√±o bread, mashed potatoes, sourdough bread were the only foods I enjoyed oh and the champagne of course.

The service was okay but it was kind of crowded so it took the waiters a little time to come back to you but they were as attentive as they could be.

top_10.name: HINODEYA Ramen & Bar Chestnut
top_10.address: 3340 Steiner St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA
testimonials: Great spicy miso ramen. The broth is very rich and the noodles had a good chew. Overall a decent price and a nice atmosphere. There‚Äôs indoor and outdoor seating. Very quick as well!

This location is huge with outdoor and indoor seating. The back room opens to a large dining room with plenty of group seating. Sparkling sake was good. There are a lot of peaceful decorations displayed around the restaurant. Good was okay. I thought the ramen noodles had good texture. The zen broth could have more yuzu. The pork katsu cutlet was pretty fatty. The chicken karage varied in size leaving the pieces cooked at varied levels. Overall a good place to come with a group.

An very nice place to eat, the back has a more open feel while the front has more of a Japanese bar kind of feel. We spent about $100 on two appetizers, sake, a beer, a soda, and two entrees so meh on that. But the food was delicious and the atmosphere was great too. We went on Christmas, surprisingly, and it was packed. The service was practical, we enjoyed ourselves and stayed for about an hour. We got the spicy chicken, house ramen, some calamari and gyogi. The bento boxes are actually pretty big and my wife's ramen was great too. I'd come here again.

top_10.name: Torraku Ramen - Lombard
top_10.address: 1449 Lombard St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA
testimonials: Food is awesome! Great ramen and very tasty! We are just thankful so much to the Indonesian Server who was very patient with us from dropping our chopsticks to spilling glass of water. That man deserves a raise. Kudos. Recommended for Ramen
The food is so good! Our kids loved the ramen. The kids also got free ice cream which is so appreciated!  We were able to take advantage of happy hour which was awesome. Will try to come back!

I won‚Äôt say it‚Äôs the best ramen I‚Äôve had, but the experience was cool.  You pay upfront‚Ä¶ tip included.  Greeting was awesome.  Service was great.  Could have used a little more flavor in the broth.  Gyoza was delicious.  Don‚Äôt really know if it‚Äôs made there, as advertised.  Overall, grab a Sapporo draft, get some gyoza, and enjoy this paint spot.  I‚Äôll be back!

top_10.name: Hinodeya Ramen & Bar 680 Clay Downtown
top_10.address: 680 Clay St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA
testimonials: Quick stop after long day of travels.  Liked this for clam ramen.  Broth was nice and hot and full of umami.  Hit the spot.  Saw a few other folks here having as friends and/or date.  Decent cheap place w above avg food if you want to keep keep your savings in your wallet

This is one of the most delicious ramen I‚Äôve ever had, perhaps the best ever. I got the house ‚ÄúHinodeya‚Äù ramen, and it checks all the boxes: decent price, good portion, and full of umami deliciousness. The wheat noodles are tender and, despite being mildly on the al dente side on arrival, softened up nicely over the course of my meal. Service was fast and the atmosphere is relaxing. I highly recommend stopping by for a bowl.

Very nice place to eat at, Japanese music, they hit the drum everytime someone comes in, service was great and friendly.

The House ramen which was I got was good, the broth was flavorful, light but was rich in flavor. Every bite had me craving for me. The only disappointment was as the draft super dry asahi was a bit warm and the level 10 spice was more like a level 2-3. I probably would've enjoyed it more with a cup of the hot sauce.

I definitely recommend this place.

top_10.name: HINODEYA Ramen Union Square
top_10.address: 219 O'Farrell St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials: This spot is hella good. I got the zen yuzu ramen. It‚Äôs a really good vegan option. The veggie gyoza‚Äôs were good & the hot matcha tea goes perfect with the meal. Geraldo was very helpful and hospitable.

Finally had a chance to try Hinodeya! I‚Äôve always walked by at night when the line is pretty long, but this time I came in at 11am on Sunday. I chose the Chicken Umami - delicious and flavor was perfect! The Spicy Mayo and Hinodeya are their most popular though.

Sat down here for lunch on a really rainy day. The service was fast and everyone was very polite. The fried chicken is really tasty, but that's not exactly what you want your highlight to be at a ramen spot. I liked most things, but I wasn't really wowed by anything. Still, it's a good spot to grab a bite, if you're around!

top_10.name: Ramenwell
top_10.address: 3378 18th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
testimonials: Love it! Always great, we usually share one ramen, takoyakis and side salad and it‚Äôs perfect for two. It is our favorite in the mission

Their ramen could be more chewy but hands down the best pork bellies and spiciest ramen in the city (choose the Souper one if you dare). Their edamame and karaage are excellent, but the spam musubi is decent. Always paired my ramen with the ramune soda - Loved coming back here every month!

We tried the mushroom lovers ramen. Very large portion size, cute izakaya style vibe

The taste and umami was good but not mind-blowing.

Will still go back when we are in the area but not seek it out

top_10.name: Japan Center Malls
top_10.address: 1737 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
testimonials: December 2025 SFOs Japan town is a vibrant and fun place that celebrates the Japanese community and culture in California.  SFO makes a great representation of their multiculturalism.   Lots of interesting places.

Cool plaza. It was quiet when I visited so would like to see a peak time. The Peace Pagoda is still under refurbishment, so don‚Äôt make a special trip until that‚Äôs completed.  Would return, particularly for a festival or community celebration.

We bought some delicious ramen and some stuff at Daiso. The ramen was delicious and still retained it's original flavor. I got a wooden alarm clock and some Chocorooms at Daiso. The shopping experience is easy and convenient, with a lot of bathrooms. The experience was easy because short lines and convenient times. The staff around stores were nice and friendly. But the east 2nd building is usually empty at 4 or 5. I liked the visit, and there were some waterless yrinals. The prices were fair.

top_10.name: HINODEYA Ramen Japantown
top_10.address: 1737 Buchanan St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
testimonials: This is our new favorite ramen restaurant. Didn‚Äôt know this place existed but happy to share what we experienced. Food and services were excellent. We will come back for more.

This place never disappoints. Generally, there is a line to get in. The atmosphere is lively when it‚Äôs busy. The place is about medium size, not too cozy and not that big. There is outside seating. The service is great. I‚Äôve been here several times & always get the Creamy vegan ramen. It‚Äôs really good and tasty. My friends loved their ramen bowls and raved about the shishito peppers. I highly recommend this place.

Guy next to us had his folding chair collapse. He fell to the ground and seemed ok. I prefer to eat without worrying about the structural integrity of the chairs. Nice to sit outside though.

House ramen was good, subbed wheat noodles with spinach noodles, al dente. Vegan ramen was ok, strange to drink savory soy milk. Fried garlic and onion toppings were delicious.

top_10.name: Mensho Tokyo SF
top_10.address: 672 Geary St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
testimonials:
I‚Äôve eaten at the OG Jikasei Mensho in Tokyo, and somehow this spot in SF holds its own. The flavors genuinely compare.

The GKO Vegan is my forever order. It‚Äôs unapologetically garlicky, deeply savory, and completely umami-packed in that way that makes you pause mid-bite. It‚Äôs comforting but bold. I‚Äôve tried to branch out, but I always come back to it.

The Vegan Tantanmen is also excellent, rich, nutty, and satisfying. The Miso is solid, but probably my least favorite of the three. Something has to be last.

There was a month when I had dinner here almost every week. No regrets.

If another ramen snob tells you there‚Äôs better ramen in SF, believe them. But also believe me. Then go eat as much ramen as you can, because honestly, why not? üçú

Mensho Tokyo SF is a cute little ramen spot in the Tenderloin. Went here by 5pm on a Tuesday, and was able to get easy seating for two people. Street parking was difficult to find, but thankfully there was a parking garage right next to the restaurant (Temple Garage). By the time we left by 6pm, there was a long line out the door on this rainy day. Food speaks for itself.

Ordered:
Spicy Enoki chips
Corn wings
A5 Wagyu sushi
Signature Spicy Toripaitan Ramen
Spicy Sichuan Pepper Style Vegan Miso Ramen
(With a side of chashu pork and ajitama egg)

Absolutely loved our appetizers! Was surprised that the corn was sweet, considering we‚Äôre in the middle of winter. Wagyu sushi was fun and delicious - pretty sure it was real wasabi instead of horseradish-wasabi.

Ok so for ramen -
Their signature ramen was playful, with their rich and creamy broth. This was our first time trying duck chashu. Usually not a fan of duck, but this was good! LOVEDDDD the fried burdock root in this. Will plan to order extra next time, if possible.

We also tried their Spicy Vegan Miso ramen. **disclosure: I am not a vegan.** But wanted to see this style of ramen because the reviews kept raving about how much people loved their Vegan options. && it does not disappoint! I was surprised by the delicately creamy, sesame & porcini mushroom broth. The noodles are perfectly chewy.

My only negative thing is that the Sichuan Pepper Style makes the broth taste saltier than it actually is. When I come back, will plan to order the non-spicy version. Other than that - I can see why this little hole in the wall made the Michelin list.

Will plan to come back and order:
Corn wings
Signature Spicy Toripaitan Ramen
Vegan Miso Ramen w side of ajtima egg & pork chashu

Mensho Tokyo SF is truly one of the standout places in the city for anyone who loves ramen üçú. It‚Äôs not just another noodle shop ‚Äî it feels genuinely unique and deeply authentic, the kind of spot where you can tell the chefs care about craft, flavor, and experience üéå. Because of its popularity, I ended up waiting in line for a little over an hour ‚è≥ before getting in. Honestly, the wait itself becomes part of the ritual; everyone in line knows they‚Äôre about to enjoy something special.

Once inside, the service moves quickly ‚ö°. After placing my order, the food arrived much faster than I expected, especially considering how busy the restaurant was. I ordered the spicy VGKO üå∂Ô∏è, the spicy enoki mushroom üçÑ, and a Japanese beer üç∫ to go with it. I usually have a pretty high tolerance for spicy and hot foods, but the heat level of the spicy VGKO caught me off guard. It‚Äôs intense ‚Äî delicious, but definitely not for the faint of heart üî•. If you‚Äôre thinking of ordering the super spicy level, just be prepared.

Overall, Mensho Tokyo SF delivers a memorable ramen experience with bold flavors, efficient service, and a vibe that makes the wait worthwhile ‚≠ê. I‚Äôd absolutely return ‚Äî though next time, I might think twice before going for the highest spice level.

top_10.name: Marufuku Ramen
top_10.address: 1581 Webster St #235, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
testimonials:
Food 8/10
Service 10/10
Waiting time 1/10

2h wait for a okay ramen is beyond absurd. Ramen is really good but would never go back to that wait line. I would recommend if you can get there before opening. Otherwise there are plenty of better options

They‚Äôve expanded the restaurant and took over the space next door. Basically there‚Äôs no waiting like it used to be. We were there around 1:30 pm on a Monday and was immediately seated (for two)! No waiting at all. Service was friendly and very very quick! Probably about 4-5 minutes after our order we got our food which was deceptively served in small bowls. But there was a lot of food and noodles. The broth was sublime as expected, the noodles perfectly al dente (small thin) with really tender pieces of pork. It was delicious and service was excellent but it was sooo noisy inside? It was hard to talk but for this incredible ramen, it‚Äôs worth it!!

I‚Äôve heard about this place for a while and finally had the unexpected opportunity on Christmas Eve. A friend and I decided to meet at Japantown for dinner. We walked around and I remembered this place. We decided to eat here. We didn‚Äôt even have to wait 5 mins and we were called to our table! Our waitress was SO nice! She was above & beyond! Gave us recommendations and answered our questions; and staff was so attentive!
I ordered the vegan creamy broth ramen. It was good; however, I liked Hinodeya‚Äôs better as theirs was more creamy and I liked the taste better. Marufuku‚Äôs was still good though.
My friend had the Hankata Tonkatsu DX (The DX just means it has extra toppings). Apparently, this is one of the popular dishes. He said it was really good. We both finished our ramen so highly recommend.
We ordered the chicken Karaage as well. I have to say this was SO good!!! For those wondering, I know I ordered the vegan ramen but it‚Äôs because I don‚Äôt eat that much meat (obviously not 100% vegan or vegetarian).
Street parking can be tough but you if you‚Äôre lucky, you can find free residential parking or metered parking. Otherwise, there is an underground paid parking garage. If you take public transportation, the 38-Geary or 22-Fillmore (you‚Äôll have to walk a few blocks, not bad as there‚Äôs plenty of shops & restaurants along the way).
I highly recommend this place!

top_10.name: Taniku Izakaya
top_10.address: 1035 Geary St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
testimonials: Such a cozy little spot with tons of great food options! The ramen was super flavorful, the portions were huge, and everything just hit the spot. Can‚Äôt wait to come back and try so many other things on the menu that looked amazing.

I finally made it to their happy hour, which has some great deals.

Their happy hour menu contains some of their ramen bowls off their main menu for $13. I got the garlic pork ramen, and they did not skimp on the pork. There were two thick pieces of soft pork belly that was coated with garlic and seared to perfection. And the meat melted in my mouth.
The bok choy was crunchy and its bitterness was tamed with the flavorful pork. The noodles had a good bite while the corn added some sweetness. And the marinated egg also added another flavor profile. Not sure what it was marinated in, but it had a nice tea flavor. And the yolk was perfectly jammy.

And then there's the broth: full of umami, pork, and garlic flavors. I have been incredibly stressed from two projects at work and the moment I took a sip of the broth, I immediately felt at ease. The ramen was so comforting, especially now that we're experiencing autumn weather in San Francisco. I tend to eat fast, but there was no rushing this. The world and my worries melted away with each bite.

I also got the amaebi shrimp hand roll, which came with a yuzu sauce. I actually found it to be a bit gingery, which was a nice surprise in flavor. It seemed the rice was also marinated in perhaps soy sauce for that umami note.  And the shrimp was plump. It was a good bite.

This is a popular spot with a small dining space, so a line can form pretty quickly outside as the night progresses.  But that ramen is worth the wait.

It‚Äôs a small and cozy izakaya, perfect for dining alone or with a small group of 3‚Äì4 people. I ordered appetizers from the special menu. First up: Mentaiko Zucchini (so delicious! The very first bite was refreshing, followed by the rich umami saltiness of the mentaiko. A little dip in Karashi mustard made it even better‚Äîdefinitely a must-try! Highly recommended).

Next was Kuramaebi, tiger prawns deep-fried tempura style and topped with tartar sauce. After that, I ordered Ba-ra Kushiyaki and Kobe Kushiyaki (served 2 skewers each). I especially enjoyed the Kobe‚Äîit was grilled perfectly and went really well with Shichimi Togarashi. If it had the same green onion topping as the Ba-ra, I think it would have been absolutely perfect.üòã
